original: bde ba la reg par gnas par tshor ro //
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas par tshor ro //
translated: You will experience the bliss of abiding in comfort.🔽Monks, you too should eat the food of those who share your seat.

original: dge slong dag khyed kyang tshur sheg la stan gcig pa'i zas zo shig dang / khyod kyang stan gcig pa'i zas za ba na snying las chung dur 'tsho zhing /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyang tshur sheg la stan gcig pa'i zas zo shig dang / khyod kyang stan gcig pa'i zas za ba na snying las chung dur 'tsho zhing /
translated: When you eat the food of those who share your seat, you will live with little trouble,

original: gnod pa nyung ba dang / nyam nga ba chung ba dang / bskyod pa yang ba dang / 'tsho ba dang stobs dang ldan pa dang / bde ba dang kha na mtho ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par tshor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa nyung ba dang / nyam nga ba chung ba dang / bskyod pa yang ba dang / 'tsho ba dang stobs dang ldan pa dang / bde ba dang kha na mtho ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par tshor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: with little discomfort, with little agitation, with little illness, with strength, with happiness, without offense, and you will experience the bliss of abiding in comfort.🔽You should eat as much as you need without rejecting any food.

original: zas ma spangs pas ji tsam gyis chog pa bza' bar bya zhing zas brtsams pas slob dpon dang mkhan po dang bla ma dang bla ma lta bu mthong na yang ldang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zas ma spangs pas ji tsam gyis chog pa bza' bar bya zhing zas brtsams pas slob dpon dang mkhan po dang bla ma dang bla ma lta bu mthong na yang ldang bar mi bya'o //
translated: You should not get up when you see your teacher, preceptor, guru, or one who is like a guru, even if you have started to eat.

original: bca' ba lnga po rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dag gis ni spangs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bca' ba lnga po rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dag gis ni spangs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: You will not reject the five kinds of food that are roots, tree shoots, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: bza' ba lnga po 'bras chan dang / zan dron dang / sha dang / snum khur dang / 'dag gu dag gis ni spangs par 'gyur ro //🔽rgyu lnga po zas yod pa dang / zas stobs pa yod pa dang / zas brtsams pa yod pa dang / zas spangs pa yod pa dang / spyod lam las nyams pa dag gis ni spangs pa brjod par bya la /
analyzed: bza' ba lnga po 'bras chan dang / zan dron dang / sha dang / snum khur dang / 'dag gu dag gis ni spangs par 'gyur ro // rgyu lnga po zas yod pa dang / zas stobs pa yod pa dang / zas brtsams pa yod pa dang / zas spangs pa yod pa dang / spyod lam las nyams pa dag gis ni spangs pa brjod par bya la /
translated: The five foods are: cooked grain, flour, meat, fat and suet, and cakes.🔽One should say that the abandonment is by the five causes: the existence of food, the existence of the strength of food, the commencement of food, the abandonment of food, and the deterioration of behavior.

original: rgyu lnga po zas med pa dang / zas stobs pa med @135a * //🔽pa dang / zas brtsams pa med pa dang / zas spangs pa med pa dang / spyod lam las ma nyams pa dag gis ni ma spangs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu lnga po zas med pa dang / zas stobs pa med @135a * //🔽pa dang / zas brtsams pa med pa dang / zas spangs pa med pa dang / spyod lam las ma nyams pa dag gis ni ma spangs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say that the non-abandonment is by the five causes: the non-existence of food, the non-existence of the strength of food, the non-commencement of food, the non-abandonment of food, and the non-deterioration of behavior.

original: gzhan yang tshig lhag ma med pa lnga po thong shig ces bya ba dang / gzhan la byin cig ces bya ba dang / song shig ces bya ba dang / zos zin to zhes bya ba dang / chog go zhes bya ba dag gis ni spangs par brjod par bya la /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshig lhag ma med pa lnga po thong shig ces bya ba dang / gzhan la byin cig ces bya ba dang / song shig ces bya ba dang / zos zin to zhes bya ba dang / chog go zhes bya ba dag gis ni spangs par brjod par bya la /
translated: Moreover, the five without remainder are: “Throw it away,” “Give it to another,” “Go away,” “I have already eaten,” and “I have had enough.”

original: tshig lhag ma dang bcas pa lnga po re zhig thod shig ces bya ba dang / re zhig gzhan la byin cig ces bya ba dang / re zhig song shig ces bya ba dang / re zhig zos zin to zhes bya ba dang / re zhig chog go zhes bya ba dag gis ni ma spangs par brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig lhag ma dang bcas pa lnga po re zhig thod shig ces bya ba dang / re zhig gzhan la byin cig ces bya ba dang / re zhig song shig ces bya ba dang / re zhig zos zin to zhes bya ba dang / re zhig chog go zhes bya ba dag gis ni ma spangs par brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: The five with remainder are: “Throw it away for a while,” “Give it to another for a while,” “Go away for a while,” “I have already eaten for a while,” and “I have had enough for a while.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gis spangs pa bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gis spangs pa bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Monks should not eat what has been discarded.”

original: drug sde dag spangs pas kyang za bar byed /
analyzed: drug sde dag spangs pas kyang za bar byed /
translated: The group of six ate what had been discarded.

original: ma spangs pas kyang za bar byed nas /
analyzed: ma spangs pas kyang za bar byed nas /
translated: They also ate what had not been discarded.

original: dge slong don nyung du dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis spangs pa bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis spangs pa bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: “Monks, I say that you should not eat what has been discarded.”🔽“Why do monks eat what has been discarded?

original: ci'i phyir dge slong dag spangs pas kyang za bar byed /🔽ma spangs pas kyang za bar byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dge slong dag spangs pas kyang za bar byed / ma spangs pas kyang za bar byed ces smod par byed /
translated: Why do they eat what has not been discarded?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized, disparaged, and complained and said many negative things about them.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.🔽The Blessed One assembled the saṅgha of monks and questioned the group of six:

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas /
translated: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: “It is not suitable for renunciants🔽to do such a thing.🔽It is not suitable.

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not proper.🔽It is not to be done.”

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad nas /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad nas /
translated: After criticizing them in many ways, the Blessed One gave a teaching on the Dharma.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, he said, “My disciples, you should recite the training rules in this way:

original: yang dge slong gang zas zos zin cing spangs pa las bca' ba'am bza' ba 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zas zos zin cing spangs pa las bca' ba'am bza' ba 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk who has finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more eats fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The individuals are the group of six monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bslab pa la g+yel ba dang bka' la mgus pa dang / nyes pa ni zas spangs pas za bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bslab pa la g+yel ba dang bka' la mgus pa dang / nyes pa ni zas spangs pas za bar byed pa'o //
translated: The affliction is disrespect for the training and for the Buddha’s word. The misdeed is eating when one has refused an invitation to eat more.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med @135b zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med @135b zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The background story for the allowance is this. The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying in Śrāvastī, in Prince Jeta’s grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: khyim bdag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun khyim gzhan du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs nas dge slong nad pa rab tu mang po dag gi nad ga+yog rab tu mang po dag yod pa de dag gis bdag nyid kyis zos nas nad pa
analyzed: khyim bdag gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun khyim gzhan du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs nas dge slong nad pa rab tu mang po dag gi nad ga+yog rab tu mang po dag yod pa de dag gis bdag nyid kyis zos nas nad pa
translated: The householder invited the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to his house for a meal. There were many sick monks and many monks who were nursing them. They ate the food themselves and took the alms intended for the sick monks.

original: rnams kyi lto khengs pa'i bsod snyoms dag mnos pa dang / dge slong nad pa rnams kyis za bar mi nus shing /
analyzed: rnams kyi lto khengs pa'i bsod snyoms dag mnos pa dang / dge slong nad pa rnams kyis za bar mi nus shing /
translated: The sick monks were unable to eat.

original: dge slong nad ga+yog dag gis kyang bdag cag gis spangs so zhes za bar mi byed /
analyzed: dge slong nad ga+yog dag gis kyang bdag cag gis spangs so zhes za bar mi byed /
translated: The monks who were nursing the sick monks also did not eat, saying, “We have been abandoned.”

original: kun dga' ra ba pa dang / dge tshul dag kyang med nas /
analyzed: kun dga' ra ba pa dang / dge tshul dag kyang med nas /
translated: There were no monastery attendants or novices.

original: de dag gis kun dga' ra ba'i nang du zas kyi phung po chen po rnam par gzhag pa dang / der bya rog dag za ba na /
analyzed: de dag gis kun dga' ra ba'i nang du zas kyi phung po chen po rnam par gzhag pa dang / der bya rog dag za ba na /
translated: They left a large pile of food in the monastery, and the crows ate it.

original: bya rog gi sgra 'byin pa chen po byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: bya rog gi sgra 'byin pa chen po byung bar gyur to //
translated: There was a great cawing of crows.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed pa mdzad pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed pa mdzad pas /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, who knows the right time, the right occasion, the right instant, the right truth, and the right Dharma, who is endowed with right knowledge and right conduct, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, the one with vision, the unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, the teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One, asked Venerable Ānanda, “Ānanda, why is there this great cawing of crows?”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' po kun dga' ra ba'i nang na bya rog sgra 'byin pa chen po byung bar gyur ba 'di ci las gyur /
analyzed: kun dga' po kun dga' ra ba'i nang na bya rog sgra 'byin pa chen po byung bar gyur ba 'di ci las gyur /
translated: “Ānanda, what is the reason for the great cawing of crows in the monastery?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos skabs de rgyas par gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos skabs de rgyas par gsol to //
translated: The venerable Ānanda explained the situation in detail.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought,🔽“In order to make the monks dwell in comfort and to enjoy the gifts of the donors, I should allow leftovers.”

original: ngas dge slong rnams bde ba la reg par gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / sbyin pa po rnams kyi sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su longs spyod par bya ba'i phyir lhag bor gnang bar bya'o snyam du dgongs nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ngas dge slong rnams bde ba la reg par gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / sbyin pa po rnams kyi sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su longs spyod par bya ba'i phyir lhag bor gnang bar bya'o snyam du dgongs nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Thinking this, he said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na lhag bor byas te bza' bar rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na lhag bor byas te bza' bar rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: “Monks, therefore I allow you to eat leftovers.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lhag bor byas te bza' bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lhag bor byas te bza' bar rjes su gnang ngo zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: When the Blessed One said, “I allow you to eat leftovers,”

original: dge slong rnams kyis lhag bor ji ltar bya ba mi shes nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis lhag bor ji ltar bya ba mi shes nas /
translated: The monks did not know what to do with the leftovers.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong zas zos zin nas spangs te yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa gang yang rung ba zhig gis bca' ba 'am bza' ba rnyed cing za bar 'dod na dge slong des lag pa gnyis bsnyal te byin len byas la /🔽dge slong zas zos zin cing ma spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa 'am /
analyzed: dge slong zas zos zin nas spangs te yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa gang yang rung ba zhig gis bca' ba 'am bza' ba rnyed cing za bar 'dod na dge slong des lag pa gnyis bsnyal te byin len byas la / dge slong zas zos zin cing ma spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa 'am /
translated: “Monks, if a monk who has finished eating, rejected food, and is completely satisfied should find something to eat or drink and wish to eat it, that monk should wash his hands, receive the leftovers,🔽and sit down in front of a monk who has finished eating, has not rejected food, and has not changed posture.

original: dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa de'i bdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
analyzed: dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa de'i bdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
translated: Or he should sit down in front of a monk who has finished eating, has rejected food, and has not changed posture.

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should say to him,

original: @136a * // tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: @136a * // tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: ‘Venerable, please pay attention.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'tshal ma 'tshal lags shing spangs te yongs su rdzogs shing /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'tshal ma 'tshal lags shing spangs te yongs su rdzogs shing /
translated: I, monk so-and-so, having eaten and finished, have rejected food and am completely satisfied.

original: mthar thug par bgyis pa las bca' ba dang bza' ba rnyed cing 'tshal bar 'tshal na /
analyzed: mthar thug par bgyis pa las bca' ba dang bza' ba rnyed cing 'tshal bar 'tshal na /
translated: If I wish to eat the food that I have obtained,

original: lhag por bgyis te bdag la stsal du gsol /
analyzed: lhag por bgyis te bdag la stsal du gsol /
translated: please give it to me as leftovers.

original: lhag bor byed pa'i dge slong gis zas zos zin cing ma spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyis kham gnyis sam gsum zos nas /
analyzed: lhag bor byed pa'i dge slong gis zas zos zin cing ma spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kyis kham gnyis sam gsum zos nas /
translated: If the monk who is making the leftovers eat and have not rejected the food, and have not changed posture, he should eat two or three mouthfuls himself,

original: khyed kyir gyur gyis bzhud cig ces brjod pas lhag bor bya'o //
analyzed: khyed kyir gyur gyis bzhud cig ces brjod pas lhag bor bya'o //
translated: and then say, “This is yours. Go.”

original: dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa des ni bza' bar mi bya bar lag par byin nas khyod kyir gyur gyis bzhud cig ces brjod pas lhag bor bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa des ni bza' bar mi bya bar lag par byin nas khyod kyir gyur gyis bzhud cig ces brjod pas lhag bor bya'o //
translated: If the monk who is making the leftovers eat and have rejected the food, and have not changed posture, he should give it in his hand, saying, “This is yours. Go.”

original: gal te za na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te za na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he eats it, he becomes guilty of an offense.

original: rgyu ldas lhag bor ma byas par brjod par bya ste lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ldas lhag bor ma byas par brjod par bya ste lnga gang zhe na /
translated: There are five reasons for not declaring the leftovers. What are the five?

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du dang / mi 'thob pa'i phyogs su dang / rgyab nas dang / glo nas dang / spyod lam las nyams par byed du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du dang / mi 'thob pa'i phyogs su dang / rgyab nas dang / glo nas dang / spyod lam las nyams par byed du 'jug pa'o //
translated: or by causing one to fall from one’s deportment.

original: rgyu ldas lhag bor byas par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu ldas lhag bor byas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said that there are five causes for a formal procedure of ejection to be done.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?🔽not outside the boundary,🔽in a place where one can obtain it,🔽not from behind, not from the side,

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol ma yin pa dang / 'thob pa'i phyogs su dang / rgyab ma yin pa nas dang / glo ma yin pa nas dang / spyod lam las ma nyams par byed du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol ma yin pa dang / 'thob pa'i phyogs su dang / rgyab ma yin pa nas dang / glo ma yin pa nas dang / spyod lam las ma nyams par byed du 'jug pa'o //
translated: and not by causing one to fall from one’s deportment.

original: gzhan yang rgyu lngas ni lhag bor ma byas par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu lngas ni lhag bor ma byas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be said that there are five causes for a formal procedure of ejection not to be done.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?🔽outside the boundary,🔽in a place where one cannot obtain it,🔽in the almsbowl,🔽in the upper robe,

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du dang / mi 'thob pa'i phyogs su dang / lhung bzed gyi gzhir dang / thu bar dang / spyod lam las nyams par byed du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du dang / mi 'thob pa'i phyogs su dang / lhung bzed gyi gzhir dang / thu bar dang / spyod lam las nyams par byed du 'jug pa'o //
translated: and by causing one to fall from one’s deportment.

original: rgyu lngas ni lhag bor bya bar brjod bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu lngas ni lhag bor bya bar brjod bar bya ste /
translated: It should be said that there are five causes for a formal procedure of ejection to be done.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol ma yin pa dang / 'thob pa'i phyogs su dang / lhung bzed kyi gzhi ma yin pa dang / thu bar ma yin pa dang / spyod lam las ma nyams par byed du 'jug pa'i dge slong gis lhag bor byas pa mang bo dag gis bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol ma yin pa dang / 'thob pa'i phyogs su dang / lhung bzed kyi gzhi ma yin pa dang / thu bar ma yin pa dang / spyod lam las ma nyams par byed du 'jug pa'i dge slong gis lhag bor byas pa mang bo dag gis bza' bar bya ste /
translated: He should not be outside the boundary, he should be in the direction of the attainment, he should not be on the ground of the alms bowl, he should not be in the upper part, and he should not be in a different posture. The monk who is the one who makes the excess should eat it with many.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
translated: There should be no regret about this.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab par bya bar 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dag @136b dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab par bya bar 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dag @136b dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having spoken in praise of the desire to train, of respect for the training, and of the austerity of the training, having given a talk on the Dharma that was relevant to the topic, that was relevant to the purpose, and that was appropriate, said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: “Monks, therefore the former was a rule, but this is an exception:

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang zas zos zin cing spangs pa las lhag bor ma byas par bca' ba'am /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / yang dge slong gang zas zos zin cing spangs pa las lhag bor ma byas par bca' ba'am /
translated: My disciples should recite this rule for training:

original: bza' ba 'cha' ba 'am za na ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad do //
analyzed: bza' ba 'cha' ba 'am za na ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad do //
translated: ‘If a monk, after finishing his meal and refusing an invitation to eat more, eats fresh or cooked food, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.🔽The person was a monk who had many attendants.

original: gang zag ni dge slong nang g-yog rab tu mang po dag / nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong nang g-yog rab tu mang po dag / nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
translated: There was no affliction or offense.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: As for “If a monk,” it refers to the group of six or anyone similar to them.

original: zas zos zin cing spangs pa las zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa las so //
analyzed: zas zos zin cing spangs pa las zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa las so //
translated: “After finishing his meal and refusing an invitation to eat more” means after completing and concluding his meal.

original: lhag bor ma byas par zhes bya ba ni lhag mar ma byas shing ma bor yongs su ma btang bar ro //
analyzed: lhag bor ma byas par zhes bya ba ni lhag mar ma byas shing ma bor yongs su ma btang bar ro //
translated: “Without having discarded it” means without having discarded it, left it, or given it away.

original: bca' ba 'am bza' ba zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga po dang bza' ba lnga po dag go //
analyzed: bca' ba 'am bza' ba zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga po dang bza' ba lnga po dag go //
translated: “Food or drink” means the five kinds of food and the five kinds of drink.

original: 'cha' 'am za na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
analyzed: 'cha' 'am za na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
translated: “If he eats or drinks” means if he swallows it.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense” means as before.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the offense here?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of this should be understood through the basic offense, the preparatory action, the subsequent action, the classification of the offense, the non-offenses, the training, and the amendment.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag bor ma byas pa nyid kyi dus su rung ba'i zas gang yang rung ba zos na stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag bor ma byas pa nyid kyi dus su rung ba'i zas gang yang rung ba zos na stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the classification of the basic offense is this: if a monk who has refused food eats any kind of suitable food at a time when he has not made an exception, it is the basic offense of the meal of one sitting.

original: dge slong zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag bor ma byas pa nyid kyis dus su rung ba'i zas gang yang rung ba zos na 'dir dngos gzhir gsungs pa la /
analyzed: dge slong zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag bor ma byas pa nyid kyis dus su rung ba'i zas gang yang rung ba zos na 'dir dngos gzhir gsungs pa la /
translated: Monks who have abandoned food and who have not made an exception, if they eat any food suitable for the time, it is said to be a root downfall.

original: zas spangs pa nyid ni gang yin /
analyzed: zas spangs pa nyid ni gang yin /
translated: What is it to abandon food?

original: lhag bor ni gang yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: lhag bor ni gang yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: What is it to make an exception?

original: zas spangs pa nyid ces bya ba ni dge slong zas brtsams pas 'dug pa'i gnas btang ba ste /
analyzed: zas spangs pa nyid ces bya ba ni dge slong zas brtsams pas 'dug pa'i gnas btang ba ste /
translated: Abandoning food means that a monk who has begun to eat gives up his place.

original: de yang rgyu lnga bo zas yod pa dang / zas stobs pa yod pa dang / zas brtsams pa yod pa dang / zas spangs pa yod pa dang / spyod lam las nyams pa dag gis ni zas brtsams pas 'dug pa'i gnas gtong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rgyu lnga bo zas yod pa dang / zas stobs pa yod pa dang / zas brtsams pa yod pa dang / zas spangs pa yod pa dang / spyod lam las nyams pa dag gis ni zas brtsams pas 'dug pa'i gnas gtong par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is done by five causes: if food exists, if the giver of food exists, if the monk has begun to eat, if the monk has abandoned food, and if the monk has lapsed from his posture.

original: dge slong zas brtsams pa'i @137a * //
analyzed: dge slong zas brtsams pa'i @137a * //
translated: A monk who has begun to eat

original: gnas su 'dug ste /
analyzed: gnas su 'dug ste /
translated: sits in his place.

original: bca' ba lnga dang bza' lnga'i zas brtsams shing tha na lan tshva tsam yan chad bza' bar bya ba gang yang rung ba cung zad cig phyin len byas te zas brtsams pa dang / zas yod pa dang / zas stobs pa yod pa dang / zas brtsams pa yod pas bca' ba lnga dang thug pa dang skyo ma ma gtogs pa bza' ba lnga'i zas rung ba dang mi rung ba dang ma 'dres pa'i byin len stobs pa tho 'tshams pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: bca' ba lnga dang bza' lnga'i zas brtsams shing tha na lan tshva tsam yan chad bza' bar bya ba gang yang rung ba cung zad cig phyin len byas te zas brtsams pa dang / zas yod pa dang / zas stobs pa yod pa dang / zas brtsams pa yod pas bca' ba lnga dang thug pa dang skyo ma ma gtogs pa bza' ba lnga'i zas rung ba dang mi rung ba dang ma 'dres pa'i byin len stobs pa tho 'tshams pa ma yin pa /
translated: Since there is food, there is the strength of food, and there is the beginning of food, except for the five foods and the thin porridge and thick porridge, the strength of the food that is suitable and unsuitable, and that which is not mixed, is not an offense.

original: dge slong byin len byed pa rang gi zas 'thob ba'i phyogs na 'greng ba la tshig lhag ma med pa lnga po thong shig ces bya ba dang / gzhan la byin cig ces bya ba dang / song shig ces bya ba dang / zos zin to zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: dge slong byin len byed pa rang gi zas 'thob ba'i phyogs na 'greng ba la tshig lhag ma med pa lnga po thong shig ces bya ba dang / gzhan la byin cig ces bya ba dang / song shig ces bya ba dang / zos zin to zhes bya ba dang /
translated: The monk who receives the gift stands in the direction of his food and says, “Give me the five without remainder,” and “Give to another,” and “Go,” and “I have eaten,” and

original: chog go zhes bya ba dag las gang yang rung bas byin len stobs pa de spangs pa byas nas zas brtsams pa'i phyogs gang du sngar 'dug par gyur pa'i gnas btang ste /
analyzed: chog go zhes bya ba dag las gang yang rung bas byin len stobs pa de spangs pa byas nas zas brtsams pa'i phyogs gang du sngar 'dug par gyur pa'i gnas btang ste /
translated: One who has relinquished the food by any of the three statements, “I have had enough,” “It is good,” or “It is excellent,” and then begins to eat, relinquishes the original place where he sat.

original: zas spangs pa yod pa dang / spyod lam las nyams par gyur pa ni zas spangs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: zas spangs pa yod pa dang / spyod lam las nyams par gyur pa ni zas spangs pa nyid yin no //
translated: If he relinquishes the food, or if he deviates from his deportment, he relinquishes the food.

original: 'di la rgyu lngas ni zas brtsams pas 'dug pa'i gnas gong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu lngas ni zas brtsams pas 'dug pa'i gnas gong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: There are five causes for not relinquishing the place where one began to eat:

original: zas med pa dang / zas stobs pa med pa dang / zas brtsams pa med pa dang / zas spangs pa med pa dang / spyod lam las ma nyams pa dag gis so //
analyzed: zas med pa dang / zas stobs pa med pa dang / zas brtsams pa med pa dang / zas spangs pa med pa dang / spyod lam las ma nyams pa dag gis so //
translated: if there is no food, if there is no one to offer the food, if one has not begun to eat, if one has not relinquished the food, and if one has not deviated from one’s deportment.

original: tshig lhag ma dang bcas pa lngas ni byin len stobs pa spangs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshig lhag ma dang bcas pa lngas ni byin len stobs pa spangs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: There are five remaining statements that do not relinquish the offering of food:

original: re zhig thong shig ces bya ba dang / re zhig gzhan la byin cig ces bya ba dang / re zhig song shig ces bya ba dang / re zhig zos zin to zhes bya ba dang / re zhig chog go zhes bya ba dag gis so //
analyzed: re zhig thong shig ces bya ba dang / re zhig gzhan la byin cig ces bya ba dang / re zhig song shig ces bya ba dang / re zhig zos zin to zhes bya ba dang / re zhig chog go zhes bya ba dag gis so //
translated: The five kinds of food are: for now, for later, give to others, go away, I have eaten enough.

original: bca' ba lnga dang / thug pa dang skyo ma btang bas ni zas spangs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bca' ba lnga dang / thug pa dang skyo ma btang bas ni zas spangs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The five kinds of food and the soup and gruel are not abandoned by the renunciate.

original: bca' ba lnga ni rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dag go //
analyzed: bca' ba lnga ni rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dag go //
translated: The five kinds of food are roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: thug pa ni gang du kha gzar btsugs na kha gzar gyen du 'greng du mi btub pa nyid man chad kyi thug pa dag ni thug pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: thug pa ni gang du kha gzar btsugs na kha gzar gyen du 'greng du mi btub pa nyid man chad kyi thug pa dag ni thug pa nyid yin no //
translated: Soup is that in which a spoon placed in it stands upright.

original: skyo ma ni skyo ma gang gi steng du sor mo lnga gzhag pa'i rjes mi mngon pa nyid man chad kyi skyo ma dag ni skyo ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: skyo ma ni skyo ma gang gi steng du sor mo lnga gzhag pa'i rjes mi mngon pa nyid man chad kyi skyo ma dag ni skyo ma nyid yin no //
translated: Gruel is that in which the five fingers are not visible.

original: byin len stobs pa tho 'tshams pa btang bas kyang zas spangs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byin len stobs pa tho 'tshams pa btang bas kyang zas spangs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, one does not abandon food by giving back the gift of food or by harassing.

original: byin len stobs pa tho 'tshams pa ni @137b gal te 'ga' zhig tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pas dge slong la byin len stobs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: byin len stobs pa tho 'tshams pa ni @137b gal te 'ga' zhig tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pas dge slong la byin len stobs par byed pa ste /
translated: Harassing means if someone with the intention to harass makes a monk take back the gift of food.

original: de ni byin len stobs pa nyid ma yin pas dge slong gis kyang de shes nas de la tshig lhag ma med pa lnga po thong shig ces bya ba dang / gzhan la byin cig ces bya ba dang / song shig ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: de ni byin len stobs pa nyid ma yin pas dge slong gis kyang de shes nas de la tshig lhag ma med pa lnga po thong shig ces bya ba dang / gzhan la byin cig ces bya ba dang / song shig ces bya ba dang /
translated: Since that is not the gift of food itself, the monk should understand that and say to him, “Give it to someone else,” “Go away,”🔽“I have already eaten,” or “I am satisfied.”

original: zos zin te zhes bya ba dang / chog go zhes bya ba dag las gang smras kyang des zas spangs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zos zin te zhes bya ba dang / chog go zhes bya ba dag las gang smras kyang des zas spangs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By any of those, one does not abandon food.

original: bza' ba lnga dang zas mi rung ba dang ma 'dres pa btang bas ni zas spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bza' ba lnga dang zas mi rung ba dang ma 'dres pa btang bas ni zas spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One abandons food by giving up the five foods and by mixing them with unsuitable food.

original: bza' ba lnga ni 'bras chan dang / zan dron dang / sha dang / snum khur dang / lde gu dag go //
analyzed: bza' ba lnga ni 'bras chan dang / zan dron dang / sha dang / snum khur dang / lde gu dag go //
translated: The five foods are cooked grain, porridge, meat, soup, and pastries.

original: zas mi rung ba dang ma 'dres pa ni de dag nyid byin len ma byas pa dang / nang du zhag lon pa dang / nang du bcos pa dang dge slong gis btsos pa dang / gsog 'jog tu gyur pa dang / rmig gcig pa'i sha dang /
analyzed: zas mi rung ba dang ma 'dres pa ni de dag nyid byin len ma byas pa dang / nang du zhag lon pa dang / nang du bcos pa dang dge slong gis btsos pa dang / gsog 'jog tu gyur pa dang / rmig gcig pa'i sha dang /
translated: Food not to be eaten is food not offered and received, food that has been stored overnight, food cooked by oneself, food cooked by a fully ordained monk, food that has been stored, the meat of an animal that died from a single blow,

original: mi sha la sogs pa dang ma dres pa'o //🔽byin len stobs pa tho 'tshams pa ma yin pa btang bas kyang zas spangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi sha la sogs pa dang ma dres pa'o // byin len stobs pa tho 'tshams pa ma yin pa btang bas kyang zas spangs par 'gyur te /
translated: human flesh and so on that is not mixed with other food.🔽Food is abandoned by offering it to one who is not a human adversary.

original: byin len stobs pa tho 'tshams pa ma yin pa de dge slong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / gzhan yang rung bar byed pa byin len stobs par gnang ba tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa med pa zas 'thob pa'i phyogs na 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: byin len stobs pa tho 'tshams pa ma yin pa de dge slong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / gzhan yang rung bar byed pa byin len stobs par gnang ba tho 'tshams pa'i bsam pa med pa zas 'thob pa'i phyogs na 'dren pa'o //
translated: A human adversary is a fully ordained monk, a female novice, a male or female novice, a male or female layperson or anyone else who is permitted to offer to receive food.

original: lhag por ma byas pa nyid ces bya ba la lhag por ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: lhag por ma byas pa nyid ces bya ba la lhag por ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: It is said that food is not to be stored. How is it stored?

original: dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs te /
analyzed: dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs te /
translated: A monk who has finished eating and has rejected food,

original: yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa gang yang rung ba zhig gis bca' ba 'am bza' ba rnyed cing bza' bar dod na dge slong des lag pa gnyis bsnyal te byin len byas la /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa gang yang rung ba zhig gis bca' ba 'am bza' ba rnyed cing bza' bar dod na dge slong des lag pa gnyis bsnyal te byin len byas la /
translated: who has completely and fully satisfied his desire to eat, if he finds and is able to eat fresh or cooked food, that monk should wash his hands, receive the food,🔽and then eat it.

original: dge slong zas zos zin cing ma spangs la /
analyzed: dge slong zas zos zin cing ma spangs la /
translated: A monk who has finished eating and has not rejected food,

original: spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin ba'am dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa de'i mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin ba'am dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa de'i mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: who has not changed his posture, or a monk who has finished eating and has rejected food, who has not changed his posture, should sit in front of him and say:

original: cho dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol //
analyzed: cho dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol //
translated: “Venerable, please listen!

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'tshal ma 'tshal lags shing /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba 'tshal ma 'tshal lags shing /
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, have finished eating and have rejected food.

original: spangs te yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par bgyis pa la bca' ba dang bza' ba rnyed cing 'tshal bar 'tshal na lhag bor bgyis te bdag la stsal du gsol //
analyzed: spangs te yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par bgyis pa la bca' ba dang bza' ba rnyed cing 'tshal bar 'tshal na lhag bor bgyis te bdag la stsal du gsol //
translated: If I find and wish to eat fresh or cooked food, please give it to me, having made it leftover.”

original: des kham gnyis @138a * //
analyzed: des kham gnyis @138a * //
translated: The second is the one that is the object of the first.🔽

original: sam gsum zos nas 'di skad ces khyod kyir gyur gyi bzhud cig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sam gsum zos nas 'di skad ces khyod kyir gyur gyi bzhud cig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: He should eat two or three morsels and say, “It is yours. You may go.”

original: slob dpon kha cig na re khyod kyir gyur gyi ci bder gsol cig ces brjod par bya'o zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon kha cig na re khyod kyir gyur gyi ci bder gsol cig ces brjod par bya'o zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: Some masters say that he should say, “It is yours. You may eat as much as you like.”

original: de la dge slong zas zos zin cing ma spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa des ni bdag nyid kyis kham gnyis sam gsum zos nas de ltar lhag bor bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong zas zos zin cing ma spangs la spyod lam las ma nyams pa gang yin pa des ni bdag nyid kyis kham gnyis sam gsum zos nas de ltar lhag bor bya'o //
translated: If a monk has eaten and is not satisfied, but has not changed his posture, he should eat two or three morsels and say, “It is yours.”

original: dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs la spyod lam las nyams pa gang yin pa des ni bza' bar mi bya bar des lag par byin nas de ltar lhag bor bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs la spyod lam las nyams pa gang yin pa des ni bza' bar mi bya bar des lag par byin nas de ltar lhag bor bya'o //
translated: If a monk has eaten and is satisfied, but has changed his posture, he should not eat. He should give the food to the monk who is to be satisfied and say, “It is yours.”

original: za na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: za na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he eats it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: dge slong gang gis bdag gis deng 'di las zas gzhan mi bza'o zhes de ltar brtag par byas te zas spangs pa dang / de ltar brtag par ma byas par spyod lam las nyams pa tsam gyis zas spangs pa byas bas kyang lhag bor byed du gzhug tu rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gang gis bdag gis deng 'di las zas gzhan mi bza'o zhes de ltar brtag par byas te zas spangs pa dang / de ltar brtag par ma byas par spyod lam las nyams pa tsam gyis zas spangs pa byas bas kyang lhag bor byed du gzhug tu rung ngo //
translated: It is also suitable to make someone else eat the food that he has rejected, even if he has rejected it merely by a change in his behavior, without having resolved to reject it.

original: dus su rung ba ma yin ba dang / de dang 'dres pa la ni mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: dus su rung ba ma yin ba dang / de dang 'dres pa la ni mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: But it is not suitable to make someone else eat food that is not suitable to be eaten at the proper time or food that is mixed with that.

original: rgyu lngas lhag bor ma byas par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu lngas lhag bor ma byas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: One should say that food is not to be left over if it is done for five reasons.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du dang / mi 'thob pa'i phyogs su dang / rgyab nas dang / glo nas dang / spyod lam las nyams par byed du 'jug pas so //🔽de las zlog pa lngas ni lhag bor byas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du dang / mi 'thob pa'i phyogs su dang / rgyab nas dang / glo nas dang / spyod lam las nyams par byed du 'jug pas so // de las zlog pa lngas ni lhag bor byas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: If it is done outside the boundaries, if it is done in a place where one cannot obtain it, if it is done from behind, if it is done from the side, or if it is done by a change in one’s behavior.🔽One should say that food is left over if it is done for the opposite of these five reasons.

original: gzhan yang rgyu lngas ni lhag bor ma byas par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu lngas ni lhag bor ma byas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: One should say that food is not left over if it is done for five reasons.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du dang / mi 'thob pa'i phyogs su dang / lhung bzed kyi gzhi dang / thu bar dang / spyod lam las nyams par byed du 'jug pas so //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du dang / mi 'thob pa'i phyogs su dang / lhung bzed kyi gzhi dang / thu bar dang / spyod lam las nyams par byed du 'jug pas so //
translated: in a place where one has fallen from one’s proper behavior.

original: de las bzlog pa lngas ni lhag bor byas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa lngas ni lhag bor byas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of these five is called “not leftover.”

original: lhag bor zhes bya ba ni lhag mar byas shing bor ba ste /
analyzed: lhag bor zhes bya ba ni lhag mar byas shing bor ba ste /
translated: “ Leftover” means made leftover and discarded.

original: lhag bor byed pa'i dge slong gis zos pa'i lhag ma bor ba ni lhag bor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag bor byed pa'i dge slong gis zos pa'i lhag ma bor ba ni lhag bor zhes bya'o //
translated: The leftover food eaten by a monk who makes it leftover is called “leftover.”

original: gcig gis lhag bor byas pa mang po dag gis kyang bzar rung nga //
analyzed: gcig gis lhag bor byas pa mang po dag gis kyang bzar rung nga //
translated: Many people can eat what one person has made leftover.

original: lhag bor byas pa'i rnam pa ji skad bstan pa de ltar ma byas pa ni lhag bor ma byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag bor byas pa'i rnam pa ji skad bstan pa de ltar ma byas pa ni lhag bor ma byas pa nyid do //
translated: Not doing it in the way that has been taught for making it leftover is called “not leftover.”

original: de ltar dge slong zas spangs pa nyid dang lhag bor ma byas pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dge slong zas spangs pa nyid dang lhag bor ma byas pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the characteristics of a monk who has rejected food and who has not made it leftover,

original: da ni ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid bstan par bya ste /
translated: now he should teach the characteristics of the establishment of downfalls.

original: dge slong zas spangs pa nyid lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong zas spangs pa nyid lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in a monk who has given up food.

original: lhag bor ma byas pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lhag bor ma byas pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in not making a remainder.

original: spangs pa nyid dang lhag bor ma byas pa nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: spangs pa nyid dang lhag bor ma byas pa nyid kyang yin la /
translated: There is no fault in giving up food and not making a remainder.

original: de dag @138b tu 'du shes pa nyid dang yid gnyis za ba nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de dag @138b tu 'du shes pa nyid dang yid gnyis za ba nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in having the perception of those and in having doubts about them.

original: zas dus su rung ba bza' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: zas dus su rung ba bza' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating any of the five foods that are suitable at the proper time and that are included among the five foods.

original: zos shing mgul du mid pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: zos shing mgul du mid pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating and swallowing.

original: 'dir stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed ni bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'dir stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed ni bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa yin pas /
translated: Here, the offense of eating in one session is determined by the rules and the exceptions.

original: dge slong zas spangs pa nyid kyis lhag bor ma byas par dus su rung ba'i zas gang yang rung ba zos na stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong zas spangs pa nyid kyis lhag bor ma byas par dus su rung ba'i zas gang yang rung ba zos na stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed du 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, if a monk who has given up food eats any food that is suitable at the proper time and that is not a remainder, he commits the offense of eating in one session.

original: lhag bor byas te zos pa la ni ltung ba med par ston to //
analyzed: lhag bor byas te zos pa la ni ltung ba med par ston to //
translated: It shows that there is no offense if one eats leftovers.

original: stan gcig pa'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pa'i dge slong 'di yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba'i yi dam khyad par can yin pas des ni spangs pa nyid yin yang rung /
analyzed: stan gcig pa'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pa'i dge slong 'di yang dag par blangs pa las byung ba'i yi dam khyad par can yin pas des ni spangs pa nyid yin yang rung /
translated: This monk who has taken up the ascetic practices of eating in one sitting also has a special vow that arises from his acceptance.

original: spangs pa nyid ma yin yang rung ste /🔽lan cig stan gcig gi steng du byin len byas te zos zin phan chad phyis byin len byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung /
analyzed: spangs pa nyid ma yin yang rung ste / lan cig stan gcig gi steng du byin len byas te zos zin phan chad phyis byin len byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung /
translated: Therefore, whether or not he has already eaten,🔽he should not eat any food that is not leftovers or that is not prepared as leftovers,🔽whether or not he has received it,

original: lhag bor byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung ba'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag bza' bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: lhag bor byas kyang rung ma byas kyang rung ba'i bza' ba dang bca' ba dag bza' bar mi bya ste /
translated: after he has eaten the food that he has received in one sitting.

original: zos na yi dam ral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zos na yi dam ral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he eats it, he breaks his vow.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni zas spangs pa nyid dang lhag bor ma byas pa nyid dag la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni zas spangs pa nyid dang lhag bor ma byas pa nyid dag la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this downfall is the monk who has taken up the ascetic practices of eating in one sitting.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The five factors that make this a downfall are as follows:

original: zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag bor ma byas pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa nyid dang / dus su rung ba'i zas dang zos pa'o //
analyzed: zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag bor ma byas pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa nyid dang / dus su rung ba'i zas dang zos pa'o //
translated: It is not the case that one has given up the food, it is not the case that one has made a portion, it is the case that one perceives it as such, and it is the case that the food is suitable and one has eaten it.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If one is lacking in any of these factors, one is guilty of a transgression, according to circumstances.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji sring du stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te ji sring du stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The transgression of preparation is a minor offense. As long as one has begun the preparation for the offense of eating in a group, but has not yet reached the actual basis, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dang pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dang pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each time one begins the preparation for the actual basis, there is a minor offense.

original: zas spangs pa nyid ma yin pa dang / lhag bor byas pa nyid ma yin pa la spangs pa nyid dang / lhag bor byas pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: zas spangs pa nyid ma yin pa dang / lhag bor byas pa nyid ma yin pa la spangs pa nyid dang / lhag bor byas pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one has not given up the food, or has not made a portion, but perceives it as such, or is unsure of it, it is a minor offense.

original: zas brtsams pas sdang ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: zas brtsams pas sdang ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one begins to eat the food, it is a minor offense.

original: lhag bor byed pa zas zos zin cing spangs pa spyod la ma las ma nyams pas lhag bor byas pa'i zas las kham gcig gam gnyis za na nyes byas so //
analyzed: lhag bor byed pa zas zos zin cing spangs pa spyod la ma las ma nyams pas lhag bor byas pa'i zas las kham gcig gam gnyis za na nyes byas so //
translated: If one eats one or two morsels of food that has been prepared as leftovers, but which has not spoiled, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall through preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de @139a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de @139a * //
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are that many preparations of preparations.

original: snyed de / sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang snyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o /
analyzed: snyed de / sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang snyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o /
translated: The preparation of a preparation is a minor offense, a minor offense of wrong conduct.

original: ltung ba med pa ni zas ma spangs pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni zas ma spangs pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one has not given up food.

original: lhag bor byas pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: lhag bor byas pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one has prepared leftovers.

original: der 'di shes pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: der 'di shes pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one knows that the food is not leftovers.

original: dus su rung ba'i zas ma yin pa thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dang / dus kun tu rung ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dus su rung ba'i zas ma yin pa thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dang / dus kun tu rung ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one eats food that is suitable for any time, food that is suitable for seven days, food that may be kept until one is satisfied, or food that may be kept for life.

original: ma zos pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ma zos pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not eat.

original: las dang bo pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen la ltung ba med do //🔽bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: las dang bo pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen la ltung ba med do // bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginning practitioner, or is insane, or is deranged, or is overwhelmed by pain, or is the first offender.🔽The training rule on one sitting🔽The monks from the group of six ate food while sitting on the same seat as the donors.🔽“‘I will not eat food while sitting on the same seat as the donors,’ this is how you should train.”

original: stan gcig pa'i zas bza' bar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: stan gcig pa'i zas bza' bar bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should not eat food while sitting on the same seat as the donors.

original: zas ma spangs pas ji tsam gyis chog pa bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: zas ma spangs pas ji tsam gyis chog pa bza' bar bya'o //
translated: One should eat as much as one needs without rejecting any of the foods.

original: zas brtsams su 'dug ste /
analyzed: zas brtsams su 'dug ste /
translated: One should not get up from one’s seat while eating.

original: bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'i zas brtsams shing tha na lan tshva tsam yan chang bza' bar bya ba gang rung ba cung zad cig byin len byas te zas brtsams pas ldang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'i zas brtsams shing tha na lan tshva tsam yan chang bza' bar bya ba gang rung ba cung zad cig byin len byas te zas brtsams pas ldang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not get up from one’s seat while eating the five cooked foods that have been received and accepted, even if it is just a little, such as a pinch of salt.

original: dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs te yongs su rdzogs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa gang yang rung ba zhig gis bca' ba'am bza' ba rnyed cing za bar 'dod na /
analyzed: dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs te yongs su rdzogs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa gang yang rung ba zhig gis bca' ba'am bza' ba rnyed cing za bar 'dod na /
translated: If a monk, having eaten and refused, has finished, fully finished, and completed, and then finds food that is to be eaten,

original: des lhag bor byed du bcug ste bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: des lhag bor byed du bcug ste bza' bar bya'o //
translated: he should eat it after having it announced as leftover.

original: phyir ba ces pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir ba ces pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as was explained above.

original: stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed des sum cu bzhi pa bshad zid to /
analyzed: stan gcig pa'i zas kyi ltung byed des sum cu bzhi pa bshad zid to /
translated: The thirty-fourth, the downfall of eating the food of one who has been invited to a communal feast, has been explained.

original: // / spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng bzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun 'da' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: // / spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng bzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun 'da' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin story for the downfall of pressuring someone to give up their ethical discipline is as follows. The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Prince Jeta’s grove, in the grove given by Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: mnyan yod na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs na de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed dga' bar byed dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: mnyan yod na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs na de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed dga' bar byed dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: In Śrāvastī there lived a householder. He took a wife from a family of the same class, and he enjoyed himself with her with the pleasures of love.

original: de rgas pa'i gnas skabs su nye du zad pa dang / nor zad pa dang / longs spyod zad par gyur nas des chung ma la smras pa /
analyzed: de rgas pa'i gnas skabs su nye du zad pa dang / nor zad pa dang / longs spyod zad par gyur nas des chung ma la smras pa /
translated: When he was old, his relatives, wealth, and enjoyments were exhausted. He said to his wife,

original: bzang mo kho bo rgas pa'i gnas skabs su nor bsgrub mi nus kyi rab tu 'byung du 'gro'o //
analyzed: bzang mo kho bo rgas pa'i gnas skabs su nor bsgrub mi nus kyi rab tu 'byung du 'gro'o //
translated: “My dear, I am unable to acquire wealth in this old age of mine, so I will go forth.”

original: rje'i sras de bzhin mdzod cig / de rgyal byed kyi tshal du song ste /
analyzed: rje'i sras de bzhin mdzod cig / de rgyal byed kyi tshal du song ste /
translated: “Lord, do so.” He went to the Jetavana.

original: de dge slong zhig la rab tu 'byung bar gsol pa dang / des mkhan po spong ba la dgon pa @139b na bsam gtan byed pa zhig yod ba'i gan du khrid de /
analyzed: de dge slong zhig la rab tu 'byung bar gsol pa dang / des mkhan po spong ba la dgon pa @139b na bsam gtan byed pa zhig yod ba'i gan du khrid de /
translated: He requested full ordination from a monk, who took him to a preceptor who was practicing concentration in a remote place of solitude.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zheng bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung zheng bsnyen par rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: He went forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya and was fully ordained.

original: de dge slong de la gtad de gtang ngo //
analyzed: de dge slong de la gtad de gtang ngo //
translated: He was then entrusted to that monk and sent off.

original: dge slong des rgan zhugs de klog pa dang / slob tu 'jug pa na rgan zhugs de brjed ngas pas yang dang yang du ltung ba 'byin nas des de mdun du tsog pur 'dug tu bcug ste ltung ba 'chags su 'jug par byed do /
analyzed: dge slong des rgan zhugs de klog pa dang / slob tu 'jug pa na rgan zhugs de brjed ngas pas yang dang yang du ltung ba 'byin nas des de mdun du tsog pur 'dug tu bcug ste ltung ba 'chags su 'jug par byed do /
translated: The monk made the old man recite and study, but because the old man was forgetful, he would again and again commit downfalls. The monk made him sit in front of him and confess his downfalls.

original: rgan zhugs des bsams pa /
analyzed: rgan zhugs des bsams pa /
translated: The old man thought,

original: bdag slob dpon 'dis rtag tu mdun du tsog pur 'dug tu bcug ste ltung ba 'chags su 'dzud pas bdag gis kyang 'di mdun tsog pur 'dug tu bcug ste ltung ba 'chags su gzhug pa'i thabs ci yod snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag slob dpon 'dis rtag tu mdun du tsog pur 'dug tu bcug ste ltung ba 'chags su 'dzud pas bdag gis kyang 'di mdun tsog pur 'dug tu bcug ste ltung ba 'chags su gzhug pa'i thabs ci yod snyam mo //
translated: “This teacher always makes me sit in front of him and confess my downfalls. What can I do to make him sit in front of me and confess his downfalls?”

original: khyim bdag gcig gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun khyim gzhan du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs nas sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gshegs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gdugs tshod gsol nas khyim bdag de la chos bstan par brtsams
analyzed: khyim bdag gcig gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun khyim gzhan du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs nas sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gshegs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gdugs tshod gsol nas khyim bdag de la chos bstan par brtsams
translated: A householder invited the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to his house for a meal. The Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks went to the house. After the Blessed One had eaten his meal, he began to teach the Dharma to the householder.

original: so // dge slong des rgan zhugs de khrid de sbyin bdag gi khyim du song ba dang / sbyin bdag gis de gnyis la zas bstabs nas de gnyis kyis kho bo cag zas zos zin to zhes spangs pa dang / sbyin bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: so // dge slong des rgan zhugs de khrid de sbyin bdag gi khyim du song ba dang / sbyin bdag gis de gnyis la zas bstabs nas de gnyis kyis kho bo cag zas zos zin to zhes spangs pa dang / sbyin bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The donor said, “🔽Please take some and go.”

original: bsnoms te bzhud la lhag bor mdzod cig / de gnyis kyis byin len byas te dong nas /
analyzed: bsnoms te bzhud la lhag bor mdzod cig / de gnyis kyis byin len byas te dong nas /
translated: The two of them did the ritual of taking food and left.

original: rgyal byed kyi tshal du phyin pa dang / dge slong de ni chu 'chag / rgan zhugs de ni lhag bor byed du bcug na /
analyzed: rgyal byed kyi tshal du phyin pa dang / dge slong de ni chu 'chag / rgan zhugs de ni lhag bor byed du bcug na /
translated: When they got to Jetavana, the monk was washing his feet and the old man was told to put away the leftovers.

original: rgan zhugs kyis rnag gi skal ba ni lhag bor byas la /
analyzed: rgan zhugs kyis rnag gi skal ba ni lhag bor byas la /
translated: The old man put away the leftovers of the meat.🔽The monk said, “You have eaten the food that was not put aside for you.

original: dge slong de'i skal ba ni lhag bor ma byas so zhes zer te zar bcug nas de'i 'og tu khyod kyis lhag bor ma byas ba'i bca' ba dang bza' ba zos kyi ltung ba shogs shig ces byas pa dang / dge slong des smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong de'i skal ba ni lhag bor ma byas so zhes zer te zar bcug nas de'i 'og tu khyod kyis lhag bor ma byas ba'i bca' ba dang bza' ba zos kyi ltung ba shogs shig ces byas pa dang / dge slong des smras pa /
translated: You must confess the downfall of eating food that you have not put aside.”

original: rgan zhugs kho bos ltung ba mi 'chags kyi 'di ltar khyod nyid ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i gnas yod par 'gyur ro zhes des dge slong rnams la skabs de brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du dag slong zas zos zin cing spangs pa la skabs tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di nyes pa 'byung bar bya'o snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas nas tshe dang ldan pa 'di 'cho
analyzed: rgan zhugs kho bos ltung ba mi 'chags kyi 'di ltar khyod nyid ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i gnas yod par 'gyur ro zhes des dge slong rnams la skabs de brjod pa dang / dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du dag slong zas zos zin cing spangs pa la skabs tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di nyes pa 'byung bar bya'o snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas nas tshe dang ldan pa 'di 'cho
translated: “Why do monks knowingly seek an opportunity to accuse a monk who has eaten and refused an invitation to eat again, thinking, ‘In any case, we will bring down this monk with a downfall’?🔽They say, ‘Venerable, eat this.

original: shig 'di zo zhig ces lhag bor ma byas pa'i bca' ba dang bza' ba dus kyis stobs @140a * //🔽bar byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: shig 'di zo zhig ces lhag bor ma byas pa'i bca' ba dang bza' ba dus kyis stobs @140a * // bar byed ces smod par byed /
translated: Eat that.’ They force him to eat leftover food and to eat at the wrong time.🔽They disparage him,🔽ridicule him,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and gossip about him.”

original: kha zer bar byed ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this incident, this occasion, and this monk in mind, gathered the saṅgha of monks

original: rgan zhugs de la rmas nas /🔽dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: rgan zhugs de la rmas nas / dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: and questioned the monk:🔽“This is not in accordance with the Dharma,

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not in accordance with the monastic code,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not suitable,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not proper conduct,🔽it is not allowable,🔽it is not to be done.

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: This is not something a renunciant should do.”🔽Having censured him in many ways,

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: seeing ten benefits, he decreed to my hearers: “The basis of the training should be recited like this:

original: yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs pa la skabs tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di nyes pa 'byung bar bya'o snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas nas tshe dang ldan pa 'di 'cho shig 'di zo shig ces lhag bor
analyzed: yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs pa la skabs tshol zhing ci nas kyang dge slong 'di nyes pa 'byung bar bya'o snyam pa de nyid rkyen du byas nas tshe dang ldan pa 'di 'cho shig 'di zo shig ces lhag bor
translated: “Monks, if a monk, knowing that a monk has finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more, seeks an opportunity, thinking, ‘By any means I will get this monk in trouble,’ and then, on the basis of that, says, ‘Venerable, eat this, eat that,’

original: ma byas pa'i bca' ba dang bza' ba dus kyis stobs par byed na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: ma byas pa'i bca' ba dang bza' ba dus kyis stobs par byed na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: and causes him to eat fresh or cooked food that has not been offered, then that monk too should acknowledge it: ‘I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing, which is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rgan zhugs /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rgan zhugs /
translated: The person was an elder monk.

original: nyon mongs pa ni nyes rtsom /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni nyes rtsom /
translated: The affliction was malice.

original: nyes pa ni shes bzhin du dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs pa la lhag bor ma byas pa'i bca' ba dang / bza' ba dus kyis stobs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni shes bzhin du dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs pa la lhag bor ma byas pa'i bca' ba dang / bza' ba dus kyis stobs pa'o //
translated: The offense was causing a monk who had finished his meal and refused an invitation to eat more to eat fresh or cooked food that had not been offered.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: “Monks” means the monks here.

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang nyid kyi rig pa'am gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang nyid kyi rig pa'am gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
translated: “Knowing” means knowing by oneself or being told by others.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: “A monk” means a member of this religion.🔽“Having eaten and refused” means having finished and completed.

original: zas zos zin cing spangs pa la zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa la go skabs tshol zhing zhes bya ba ni kla na ka tshol zhing ngo /🔽ci nas kyang dge slong 'di nyes pa 'byung bar bya'o /
analyzed: zas zos zin cing spangs pa la zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa la go skabs tshol zhing zhes bya ba ni kla na ka tshol zhing ngo / ci nas kyang dge slong 'di nyes pa 'byung bar bya'o /
translated: “Looking for an opportunity” means looking for a pretext.

original: snyam pa dang zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang dge slong 'di ltung ba dang bcas par byas par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: snyam pa dang zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang dge slong 'di ltung ba dang bcas par byas par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o //
translated: “Thinking, ‘How can I cause this monk to incur an offense?’” means thinking, “How can I make this monk commit a downfall?”

original: de nyid rkyen du byas nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rkyen du byas nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Making that the basis” means not making anything else the basis.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'di 'cho shig 'di zo shig ces bya ba ni bca' ba dang bza' ba'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'di 'cho shig 'di zo shig ces bya ba ni bca' ba dang bza' ba'o //
translated: “Eat this, eat that” means eat the cooked and the raw.

original: lhag bor ma byas pa'i zhes bya ba ni lhag mar ma byas shing ma bor yongs su ma btang ba'i'o //
analyzed: lhag bor ma byas pa'i zhes bya ba ni lhag mar ma byas shing ma bor yongs su ma btang ba'i'o //
translated: “Without having discarded” means without having discarded, without having left, without having given up.

original: bca' ba dang bza' ba zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga po dang bza' ba lnga bo dag go //
analyzed: bca' ba dang bza' ba zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga po dang bza' ba lnga bo dag go //
translated: “The cooked and the raw” means the five cooked foods and the five raw foods.

original: dus kyis stobs na zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du stobs na'o //
analyzed: dus kyis stobs na zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du stobs na'o //
translated: “If he forces” means if he repeatedly forces.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni @140b snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni @140b snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “A downfall” is as usual.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Here, how is there a downfall?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes pa bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes pa bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the characteristics of the basic offense, the preparatory act, the preparatory act of the preparatory act, the presentation of the downfalls, the absence of downfalls, the training, and the amendment.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong shes bzhin du dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs pa lhag bor ma byas pa'i zas rung ba dus kyis stobs na spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong shes bzhin du dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs pa lhag bor ma byas pa'i zas rung ba dus kyis stobs na spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the presentation of the basic offense is this: If a fully ordained monk, knowing that a fully ordained monk has finished his meal and refused leftovers, forces him to eat suitable food that is not leftover but that he has obtained at the proper time, he commits an offense entailing confession that is a basic downfall.

original: dge slong yang zas zos zin cing spangs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: dge slong yang zas zos zin cing spangs pa nyid yin la /
translated: The monk has finished his meal and refused leftovers.

original: ltung ba 'byin pa pos kyang der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin pa pos kyang der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: Also, there is no fault if the one who causes the downfall has the perception of that, or is in doubt.

original: dge slong nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if it is a fully ordained monk.

original: lhag bor ma byas pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: lhag bor ma byas pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if it is not a leftover.

original: zas rung ba bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: zas rung ba bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if it is any of the five suitable foods or the five suitable foods to eat.

original: dus kyis stobs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dus kyis stobs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if it is given at the proper time.

original: dag gi rnam par rig byed kyis stobs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dag gi rnam par rig byed kyis stobs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if it is given by a physical indication.

original: pha rol pos dang du blangs kyang rung ma blangs kyang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: pha rol pos dang du blangs kyang rung ma blangs kyang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if the other person accepts it or not.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag bor ma byas ba nyid dag la 'du shes gtso cher byed ba po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag bor ma byas ba nyid dag la 'du shes gtso cher byed ba po nyid yin no //
translated: The main factors in this downfall are the perception of the food as abandoned and the perception of it as not a leftover.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actual downfall is completed by five factors.

original: dge slong zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag bor ma byas pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa dang / dus su rung ba'i zas dang stobs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag bor ma byas pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa dang / dus su rung ba'i zas dang stobs pa'o //
translated: The monk has rejected the food, has not made an exception, has the perception that it is that, and gives the food that is suitable for the time.
