original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of those factors are incomplete, it is a downfall in the sense of a serious infraction, as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfall of rejecting the food but has not reached the actual basis, it is a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the preparations for the actual basis that one has begun, there is a minor infraction.

original: zas spangs pa nyid ma yin pa dang / lhag bor ma byas pa nyid ma yin ba la spangs pa nyid dang lhag bor ma byas pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: zas spangs pa nyid ma yin pa dang / lhag bor ma byas pa nyid ma yin ba la spangs pa nyid dang lhag bor ma byas pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not the case that one has rejected the food, or it is not the case that one has not made an exception, but one has the perception that one has rejected it or has not made an exception, or one is unsure of it, it is a minor infraction.

original: zas rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: zas rung ba ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the food is not suitable, it is a minor infraction.

original: dge slong nyams pa dang ma chags pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong nyams pa dang ma chags pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the monk is degenerate or not attached, it is a minor infraction.

original: dge slong nyams pa dang ma chags pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong nyams pa dang ma chags pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the monk is not lustful, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge long ma la nyes byas so //🔽phrin pa dang spring yig la sogs pas stobs pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge long ma la nyes byas so // phrin pa dang spring yig la sogs pas stobs pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If the monk is lustful, there is a serious violation.🔽If the monk sends a messenger or a letter, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes @141a * //🔽byas phra mo ste /🔽sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes @141a * // byas phra mo ste / sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: The offense for the preparatory action is wrong conduct.🔽The offense for the preparatory action of the preparatory action is also wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The offense for the preparatory action of the preparatory action of the preparatory action is also wrong conduct.

original: ltung ba med pa ni zas ma spangs pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni zas ma spangs pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk does not give up the food.

original: lhag por ma byas pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: lhag por ma byas pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk does not make it excessive.

original: der 'du shes med pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: der 'du shes med pa nyid la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk does not have the perception of it being excessive.

original: lhag por bya mi dgos pa thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dang / dus kun tu rung ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: lhag por bya mi dgos pa thun tshod du rung ba dang / zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dang / dus kun tu rung ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk does not need to make it excessive, if it is suitable for one time, suitable for seven days, suitable for as long as one lives, or suitable at all times.

original: ma bstabs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ma bstabs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk does not invite.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor pa dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor pa dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner, or insane, or deranged, or tormented by painful feelings.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //🔽nyes rtsom mi bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o // nyes rtsom mi bya'o //
translated: The training rule is that a monk should train in not relying on any of the forms of not giving up, in all respects, in all places, and at all times.🔽One should not commit a misdeed.

original: klan ka mi btsal lo //
analyzed: klan ka mi btsal lo //
translated: One should not seek to find fault.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no /
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no /
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed de sum cu lnga pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed de sum cu lnga pa bshad zin to /
translated: This was the thirty-fifth training rule on not giving up.

original: // /'dus shing za ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // /'dus shing za ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin of the downfall of eating in a group

original: bcas pa dang / gnang pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bcas pa dang / gnang pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of rules: those that are proscribed and those that are permitted.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: The origin of the proscribed rules is this. The Blessed Buddha was staying in Rājagṛha, in the Kalandakanivāpa in the Veṇuvana.

original: de'i tshe na lha sbyin dge slong rab tu mang po dag dang lhan cig kun dga' ra ba'i nang na 'dus shing zas za na dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag kun dga' ra ba'i nang na 'dus shing zas za bar byed ces smod🔽par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe na lha sbyin dge slong rab tu mang po dag dang lhan cig kun dga' ra ba'i nang na 'dus shing zas za na dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag kun dga' ra ba'i nang na 'dus shing zas za bar byed ces smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: “Why are the monks eating in the monastery?”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, in this connection, in this context, gathered the saṅgha of monks

original: lha sbyin la rmas nas /
analyzed: lha sbyin la rmas nas /
translated: and questioned Devadatta:

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: “This is not the way of the ascetic,🔽it is not suitable,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not proper,🔽it is not in accord with the Dharma,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not in accord with the Vinaya,

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: it is not something the one who is rightly self-awakened would say.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: The Blessed One, having seen the ten benefits of establishing the training rules, established this basis of training for his disciples:

original: 'dus shing za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: 'dus shing za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If you eat in a group, you commit an offense.’”

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
analyzed: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
translated: The place was Rājagṛha.

original: gang zag ni lha sbyin 'khor dang bcas @141b pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni lha sbyin 'khor dang bcas @141b pa /
translated: The person was Devadatta and his followers.

original: nyon mongs pa ni mi mthun pa 'dod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni mi mthun pa 'dod pa /
translated: The affliction was desire for what is inappropriate.

original: nyes pa ni 'dus shing za ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni 'dus shing za ba'o //
translated: The offense was eating in a group.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: The background for the allowance was that the Blessed Buddha was staying in the Kalandakanivāpa in the Veṇuvana near Rājagṛha.

original: dge slong rab tu mang po na ba dag sman pa'i gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rab tu mang po na ba dag sman pa'i gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: Many monks who were sick went to the doctor and said,

original: bzhin bzangs kho bo cag la sman ston cig / des smras pa /🔽'phags pa dag zhal sus gsol cig / sus sbyin par 'gyur /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs kho bo cag la sman ston cig / des smras pa / 'phags pa dag zhal sus gsol cig / sus sbyin par 'gyur /
translated: “Sir, prescribe medicine for us.”🔽“Noble ones, who will give you food?”

original: bdag gis gsol lo //
analyzed: bdag gis gsol lo //
translated: “We will give it to them.”

original: ci dge 'dun thams cad dam /
analyzed: ci dge 'dun thams cad dam /
translated: “Will the whole Sangha eat it?”

original: ma lags te dge slong bsnyung ba ji snyed pa dag go //
analyzed: ma lags te dge slong bsnyung ba ji snyed pa dag go //

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
analyzed: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /
translated: The place was Rājagṛha.🔽The people were a great many monks of this doctrine.

original: gang zag ni chos 'di pa'i dge slong rab tu mang po dag / nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang zag ni chos 'di pa'i dge slong rab tu mang po dag / nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //
translated: There was no affliction or offense.

original: de la 'dus shing za na zhes bya ba ni mi mthun par za na'o //
analyzed: de la 'dus shing za na zhes bya ba ni mi mthun par za na'o //
translated: In this case, “if one eats in a group” means if one eats in a group that is not in harmony.

original: dus ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni dus bzhag ste'o //
analyzed: dus ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni dus bzhag ste'o //
translated: “Except on an appropriate occasion” means except on an appropriate occasion that has been set aside.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “One commits an offense entailing confession” is as above.

original: de la dus ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dus ni 'di yin te /
translated: In this case, the appropriate occasions are these:

original: na ba dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: na ba dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “When one is sick” means as follows.

original: dge slong na ba zas gcig gis 'tsho bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong na ba zas gcig gis 'tsho bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: A sick monk is not able to live on one meal.

original: las dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: las dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “When one is working” means as follows.

original: dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi 'am /
analyzed: dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi 'am /
translated: A monk is working for the saṅgha or for a group.

original: mchod rten gyi las tha na phyag dar re lde tsam mam /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi las tha na phyag dar re lde tsam mam /
translated: The activity of the stupa is to sweep away even the smallest dust particles.

original: dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam byas pa'o //🔽lam dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam byas pa'o // lam dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The action of a stupa is, for example, to sweep or to sweep and to sprinkle a small area.

original: dge slong dpag tshad phyed du song ba'am de'i phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs pa'o //🔽grung zhugs pa dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dpag tshad phyed du song ba'am de'i phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs pa'o // grung zhugs pa dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The time of the path is, for example, when a monk has gone a half-league or a quarter-league and returns.

original: dge slong grur zhugs te dpag tshad phyed du song ba'am de'i phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong grur zhugs te dpag tshad phyed du song ba'am de'i phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The time of embarking on a boat is, for example, when a monk has gone a half-league or a quarter-league by boat and returns.

original: 'dus pa chen po dus so zhes bya ba ni spags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa chen po dus so zhes bya ba ni spags pa'o //
translated: The time of a great gathering is, for example, when a great gathering of monks has gathered.

original: dge sbyong gi zas dus te zhes bya ba ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dag 'khod na de yang dge sbyong zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi zas dus te zhes bya ba ni 'di las phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba dag 'khod na de yang dge sbyong zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: The time of the food of ascetics is, for example, when those who have gone forth outside of this doctrine are present, and that is counted as the food of ascetics.

original: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad pa de la de ni gnang ba dang mthun pa'i chos yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad pa de la de ni gnang ba dang mthun pa'i chos yin pa'o //
translated: The time of that is when the basis of training is made, and that is the Dharma that is in accord with the permission.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here one should understand the characteristics of downfalls, their absence, the precepts, and their restoration, by means of the basic transgression, the preparatory stage, and the final stage.🔽The basic transgression is to eat in a group, that is, to eat in the same place as other fully ordained monks who are not sick, who have not done work, who are not traveling, who are not on a boat, or who are not eating specific foods.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong na ba ma yin pa dang / las ma byas pa dang / lam du song ba dang / grur ma zhugs pa dang so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas @143b can dag las gzhan pa dge 'dun du longs pa'i dge slong cig car du za bas mtshams kyi nang du dge 'dun gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba las logs shig tu 'dug ste dus ston chen
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong na ba ma yin pa dang / las ma byas pa dang / lam du song ba dang / grur ma zhugs pa dang so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas @143b can dag las gzhan pa dge 'dun du longs pa'i dge slong cig car du za bas mtshams kyi nang du dge 'dun gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba las logs shig tu 'dug ste dus ston chen
translated: The preparatory stage is to sit down in a place other than the assembly hall of the monastic compound, on the day of the great observance, the fifteenth of the month, or on the day of the confession ceremony, the last day of the month.

original: po ma yin pa dang / dge slong gi zas ma yin pa zas gang yang rung ba chung zad kyis gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba'am 'dus te za ba gang yang rung ba cig la ma bsrul bar der 'du shes pas dus su rung ba'i zas zos na 'dus shing za ba'i ltung byed
analyzed: po ma yin pa dang / dge slong gi zas ma yin pa zas gang yang rung ba chung zad kyis gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba'am 'dus te za ba gang yang rung ba cig la ma bsrul bar der 'du shes pas dus su rung ba'i zas zos na 'dus shing za ba'i ltung byed
translated: If a monk who is not sick, who has not done work, who has not gone on a journey, and who has not boarded a boat, eats in a group, or eats separately, without having invited to a house, any food that is not the food of a renunciate, or that is not the food of a monk, or that is not suitable food, then, if he eats any suitable food, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The offense is the basis for relinquishment and confession.

original: dge slong na ba ma yin pa dang / las ma byas pa dang / lam du ma song ba dang / grur ma zhugs pa nyid la na smad ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong na ba ma yin pa dang / las ma byas pa dang / lam du ma song ba dang / grur ma zhugs pa nyid la na smad ba med do //
translated: A monk who is not sick, who has not done work, who has not gone on a journey, and who has not boarded a boat, is not allowed to eat in a group.

original: na ba'i tshad ni dge slong na ba zas gcig gis 'tsho bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: na ba'i tshad ni dge slong na ba zas gcig gis 'tsho bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: The measure of being sick is that a monk is unable to live on a single meal.

original: las kyi tshad ni dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi 'am mchod rten gyi las tha na phyag dar re lde tsam mam /🔽dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam byas pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi tshad ni dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi 'am mchod rten gyi las tha na phyag dar re lde tsam mam / dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam byas pa'o //
translated: The measure of work is that a monk has done work for the community or for a stupa, even if it is only sweeping the floor or arranging the boundary.

original: lam gyi tshad ni dge slong dpag tshad phyed du song ba'am de'i phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi tshad ni dge slong dpag tshad phyed du song ba'am de'i phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The measure of a journey is that a monk has gone half a krośa or more, and has returned.

original: grur zhugs pa'i tshad ni dge slong grur zhugs te dpag tshad phyed du song ba 'am de'i phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: grur zhugs pa'i tshad ni dge slong grur zhugs te dpag tshad phyed du song ba 'am de'i phyed du song ste phyir 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The measure of boarding a ship is that a monk has boarded a ship and gone half a league or a quarter of a league and returned.

original: dge slong na ba ma yin pa dang / las ma byas pa dang / lam du ma song ba dang / grur ma zhugs pa de dag so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag las gzhan pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong na ba ma yin pa dang / las ma byas pa dang / lam du ma song ba dang / grur ma zhugs pa de dag so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag las gzhan pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: For those who are not sick, who have not done work, who have not gone on a journey, and who have not boarded a ship, it is not a downfall to eat separately from those who are staying in a place where food is determined.

original: so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag ces bya ba ni gnas gang na zas tha dad pa nyid du nges pa de ni /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag ces bya ba ni gnas gang na zas tha dad pa nyid du nges pa de ni /
translated: Those who are staying in a place where food is determined are those who are staying in a place where the food is determined to be different.

original: so sor nges pa'i zas so //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i zas so //
translated: That is, food that is determined.

original: dge slong gang dag la gnas de yod pa de dag ni so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gang dag la gnas de yod pa de dag ni so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag ces bya'o //
translated: Those monks who have that place are called those who are staying in a place where food is determined.

original: de yang mtshams gcig gi nang na dge 'dun gyi zas kyi 'du ba'i sgo tha dad pa nyid kyis zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid dang / sbyin bdag gcig nyid yin kyang zas kyi gnas so sor nges par byas pas zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de yang mtshams gcig gi nang na dge 'dun gyi zas kyi 'du ba'i sgo tha dad pa nyid kyis zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid dang / sbyin bdag gcig nyid yin kyang zas kyi gnas so sor nges par byas pas zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid dang /
translated: Further, in one boundary, food is not eaten together because the assembly of the Saṅgha's food is separate.🔽Even if the benefactor is the same, food is not eaten together because the place of the food is ascertained to be separate.🔽Food is not eaten together because the benefactors are different and the place of the food is ascertained to be separate.

original: sbyin bdag tha dad pas zas kyi gnas so sor nges par byas pas zan lhan cig ma yin pa dag ni so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag ces bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin bdag tha dad pas zas kyi gnas so sor nges par byas pas zan lhan cig ma yin pa dag ni so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag ces bya ste /
translated: These are called those who have a separate place for food.

original: da dag la ltung ba 'di rnam par mi gzhag pas de dag las gzhan pa zhes smod de /
analyzed: da dag la ltung ba 'di rnam par mi gzhag pas de dag las gzhan pa zhes smod de /
translated: Since this downfall is not specified for them, it is said that it is for those other than them.

original: de dag las bzlog pa mtshams kyi nang na dge 'dun gyi zas kyi 'du ba'i sgo yang tha mi dad la /
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa mtshams kyi nang na dge 'dun gyi zas kyi 'du ba'i sgo yang tha mi dad la /
translated: The opposite of those is in one boundary, the assembly of the Saṅgha's food is not separate and

original: zan yang lhan cig nyid du nges par byas pa las zan lhan cig byas pa ma yin pa nyid du za ba dang / @144a * //
analyzed: zan yang lhan cig nyid du nges par byas pa las zan lhan cig byas pa ma yin pa nyid du za ba dang / @144a * //
translated: food is not eaten together because it is ascertained to be eaten together.

original: sbyin bdag kyang gcig nyid yin la des zas kyi gnas kyang gcig pa nyid du nges par byas pa las zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid du za ba dang / sbyin bdag tha dad pa yin du zin kyang zan de dag gi zas dang zas kyi gnas gcig pa nyid dus nges par byas pa las zan lhan cig ma yin pa de nyid du za ba dag la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: sbyin bdag kyang gcig nyid yin la des zas kyi gnas kyang gcig pa nyid du nges par byas pa las zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid du za ba dang / sbyin bdag tha dad pa yin du zin kyang zan de dag gi zas dang zas kyi gnas gcig pa nyid dus nges par byas pa las zan lhan cig ma yin pa de nyid du za ba dag la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Even if the masters are different, if they have determined that the food and the place of eating are the same, then the downfall is determined for those who eat the food at different times.

original: so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag las gzhan pa de yang dge 'dun du longs pa'i dge slong cig car du za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i zas kyi gnas can dag las gzhan pa de yang dge 'dun du longs pa'i dge slong cig car du za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: But if the food and the place of eating are not determined to be the same, then there is no downfall for those who eat the food at the same time, even if they are monks who have participated in the communal gathering of the saṅgha.🔽If the food and the place of eating are not determined to be the same, or if the monks have not participated in the communal gathering of the saṅgha, or if they are not monks, or if they eat the food at the same time, then this downfall is not determined.

original: dge 'dun du ma longs pa dang / dge slong ma yin pa dang / dus gcig tu cig car mi za ba la ltung ba 'di rnam par mi gzhag pas dge 'dun du longs pa'i dge slong cig car du za ba zhes smos te /
analyzed: dge 'dun du ma longs pa dang / dge slong ma yin pa dang / dus gcig tu cig car mi za ba la ltung ba 'di rnam par mi gzhag pas dge 'dun du longs pa'i dge slong cig car du za ba zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase “monks who have participated in the communal gathering of the saṅgha” is used.

original: de la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This downfall is determined for those who eat the food at different times.

original: mtshams gcig gi nang du 'dus shing za ba lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: mtshams gcig gi nang du 'dus shing za ba lan smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating together in one place.

original: dge 'dun gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba las logs shig tu 'dug ste za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba las logs shig tu 'dug ste za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating separately from those who eat in the residence of the Saṅgha basis.

original: dus ston chen po dang dge sbyong gi zas ma yin pa'i zas la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dus ston chen po dang dge sbyong gi zas ma yin pa'i zas la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating at a great festival or food that is not food of ascetics.

original: dus ston chen po zhes bya ba ni gtsug phud kyi dus ston dang / dus ston chen po dang / lo lnga'i dus ston lta bu'i tshe mtshams kyi nang du dge 'dun la dus ston chen po byung ba na dge slong gi dge 'dun du longs pa dag gis rang rang gi skal ba spags te mnos nas mtshams kyi nang gi skyed mos tshal la sogs pa dag
analyzed: dus ston chen po zhes bya ba ni gtsug phud kyi dus ston dang / dus ston chen po dang / lo lnga'i dus ston lta bu'i tshe mtshams kyi nang du dge 'dun la dus ston chen po byung ba na dge slong gi dge 'dun du longs pa dag gis rang rang gi skal ba spags te mnos nas mtshams kyi nang gi skyed mos tshal la sogs pa dag
translated: A great festival is a festival of the crown protrusion, a great festival, or a five-year festival. When a great festival occurs for the Saṅgha within the boundaries, the Saṅgha of fully ordained monks should divide up their shares and accept them.

original: tu khyer te dge 'dun gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba las logs shig tu 'dus te tshoms so so tha dang par za ba la ltung ba 'di rnam par ma bzhag pas dus ston chen po ma yin pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: tu khyer te dge 'dun gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba las logs shig tu 'dus te tshoms so so tha dang par za ba la ltung ba 'di rnam par ma bzhag pas dus ston chen po ma yin pa zhes smos te /
translated: This downfall is not posited for eating separately in a group of more than two in a temple of the Sangha, or for eating separately in a group of more than four in a private house, or for eating separately in a group of more than ten in a place other than a temple or a private house.🔽This downfall is not posited for eating separately in a group of more than twenty in a place other than a temple or a private house, or for eating separately in a group of more than twenty-five in a place other than a temple, a private house, or a place other than a temple or a private house.🔽This downfall is not posited for eating separately in a group of more than twenty in a place other than a temple or a private house, or for eating separately in a group of more than twenty-five in a place other than a temple, a private house, or a place other than a temple or a private house.

original: dus ston chen po de lta bu ma yin pa'i zas la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag go //🔽dge sbyong gi zas zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi mtshams kyi nang na rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i zhang po kun du 'tsho dag gi nang du rab tu byung ba 'di las phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba'i dge sbyong 'dug pas dge 'dun gzhi'i 'dug
analyzed: dus ston chen po de lta bu ma yin pa'i zas la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag go // dge sbyong gi zas zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi mtshams kyi nang na rgyal po gzugs can snying po'i zhang po kun du 'tsho dag gi nang du rab tu byung ba 'di las phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba'i dge sbyong 'dug pas dge 'dun gzhi'i 'dug
translated: This downfall is not posited for eating separately in a group of more than twenty in a place other than a temple or a private house, or for eating separately in a group of more than twenty-five in a place other than a temple, a private house, or a place other than a temple or a private house.🔽This downfall is not posited for eating separately in a group of more than twenty in a place other than a temple or a private house, or for eating separately in a group of more than twenty-five in a place other than a temple, a private house, or a place other than a temple or a private house.

original: gnas su za ba las logs shig tu dge sbyong nyi shu 'am nyi shu rtsa lnga'i tshogs kyi zan sbyar ba lta bu la ltung ba 'di rnam par mi gzhag pas dge sbyong gi zas ma yin pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: gnas su za ba las logs shig tu dge sbyong nyi shu 'am nyi shu rtsa lnga'i tshogs kyi zan sbyar ba lta bu la ltung ba 'di rnam par mi gzhag pas dge sbyong gi zas ma yin pa zhes smos te /
translated: This downfall is not posited for eating separately in a group of more than twenty in a place other than a temple or a private house, or for eating separately in a group of more than twenty-five in a place other than a temple, a private house, or a place other than a temple or a private house.🔽This downfall is not posited for eating separately in a group of more than twenty in a place other than a temple or a private house, or for eating separately in a group of more than twenty-five in a place other than a temple, a private house, or a place other than a temple or a private house.

original: dge sbyong gi zas de lta bu ma yin pa zas gzhan la ltung ba 'di rnam par @144b gzhag go //🔽zas gang yang rung ba chung zad kyis gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba'am 'dus shing za ba gang yang rung ba cig la ma bsrul bar 'dus shing za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi zas de lta bu ma yin pa zas gzhan la ltung ba 'di rnam par @144b gzhag go // zas gang yang rung ba chung zad kyis gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba'am 'dus shing za ba gang yang rung ba cig la ma bsrul bar 'dus shing za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: This downfall is formulated for other foods than those of a renunciate.🔽There is no offense if one eats in one’s dwelling or in the company of others any kind of food, even if it is not cooked in the monastery,

original: zas brims pa tha na lan tshva tshums gang ngam /
analyzed: zas brims pa tha na lan tshva tshums gang ngam /
translated: if one eats any kind of food, even if it is only a mouthful of salt or a mouthful of vegetables,🔽in the company of others in the monastery,

original: lngam ldum srad gcig cam yan chang gang yang rung ba dge 'dun gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba la 'dus shing za bas phul yang rung /🔽'dus shing za ba la dge 'dun gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za bas phul yang rung ste /
analyzed: lngam ldum srad gcig cam yan chang gang yang rung ba dge 'dun gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba la 'dus shing za bas phul yang rung /🔽'dus shing za ba la dge 'dun gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za bas phul yang rung ste /
translated: or if one eats in the company of others in the monastery, even if it is only a mouthful of salt or a mouthful of vegetables.

original: de'i tshe na zan gcig pa nyid yin pas de la ltung ba 'di rnam par mi gzhag pas gang yang rung ba chung zad kyis gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba'am 'dus shing za ba gang yang rung ba cig la ma bsrul ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na zan gcig pa nyid yin pas de la ltung ba 'di rnam par mi gzhag pas gang yang rung ba chung zad kyis gzhi'i 'dug gnas su za ba'am 'dus shing za ba gang yang rung ba cig la ma bsrul ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “if he eats in a place that is not his dwelling, or if he eats in a group, without having invited anyone.”

original: de ltar ma bsrul bar 'dus shing za ba la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar ma bsrul bar 'dus shing za ba la ltung ba 'di rnam par gzhag go //
translated: If he eats in a group without having invited anyone, this downfall is posited.

original: mtshams kyi nang nyid la der 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang nyid la der 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: If he eats in the same place as others, but not at the same time, there is no fault.

original: zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid la der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: zan lhan cig ma yin pa nyid la der 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: If he eats in the same place as others, but not at the same time, there is no fault.

original: dus su rung ba'i zas bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa gang yang rung ba zos pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dus su rung ba'i zas bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa gang yang rung ba zos pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: If he eats any of the five foods suitable for all times and the five foods that are suitable when previously obtained, there is no fault.

analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen pos nye ba 'khor la sogs pa sar pa skyes phran gzhon nu bcu bdun sde'i tshogs rab tu byung zhing bsnyen par rdzogs par byed de /

analyzed: de'i tshe na de dag snga dro sham thabs bgos /

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te /
translated: took their alms bowls and robes,

original: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
analyzed: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //

original: bud med ni sred pa spyad pa yin pas bud med kyis de dag mthong nas brang brdungs te smras pa /
analyzed: bud med ni sred pa spyad pa yin pas bud med kyis de dag mthong nas brang brdungs te smras pa /
translated: Since women are lustful, when they saw this, they beat their breasts and said,

analyzed: 'di dag skyes pa gang dag gis 'di dag skyes ma thag gi kha lan tshvas 'gengs par ma nus pa dang / bral phrag tu khron pa bcug ste /

original: 'brang bar mi nus pa de dag gis ci thob /
analyzed: 'brang bar mi nus pa de dag gis ci thob /
translated: What did they get?”

original: bcu bdun sde dag nyam nga bar gyur nas @146b smras pa /
analyzed: bcu bdun sde dag nyam nga bar gyur nas @146b smras pa /
translated: The group-of-seventeen were embarrassed and said,

analyzed: bdag cag gis zan bcad par gyur pa ni bla'i /
translated: “It is better for us to fast.

original: tshig ngan pa 'di lta bu dag thos par gyur pa ni mi rung do zhes de dag de nyid nas phyir log ste /
analyzed: tshig ngan pa 'di lta bu dag thos par gyur pa ni mi rung do zhes de dag de nyid nas phyir log ste /
translated: It is not right for us to hear such bad words.” They turned back from there

original: zan bcad pa byas nas /
analyzed: zan bcad pa byas nas /
translated: and fasted.

original: de dag gis ji srid du lus las mdangs ma yal ba de srid du dge ba'i phyogs la tron byas nas gang gi tshe lus las mdangs yal ba de'i tshe na glos phab ste nyal lo //
analyzed: de dag gis ji srid du lus las mdangs ma yal ba de srid du dge ba'i phyogs la tron byas nas gang gi tshe lus las mdangs yal ba de'i tshe na glos phab ste nyal lo //
translated: As long as their bodies did not lose their luster, they practiced virtue. When their bodies lost their luster, they lay down and slept.

original: grong khyer bskyed mos tshal la dga' ba dag bza' ba dang btung ba dag khyer te mnyan yod kyi phyi rol rgyal byed kyi tshal du dong nas 'cha' bar byed /
analyzed: grong khyer bskyed mos tshal la dga' ba dag bza' ba dang btung ba dag khyer te mnyan yod kyi phyi rol rgyal byed kyi tshal du dong nas 'cha' bar byed /
translated: Those who liked to go to parks in the city took food and drink and went to the Jetavana outside Śrāvastī and ate.

original: za bar byed 'thung bar byed pa na bcu bdun sde dag gis de dag mthong nas lto ba la nyug par byed pa na /
analyzed: za bar byed 'thung bar byed pa na bcu bdun sde dag gis de dag mthong nas lto ba la nyug par byed pa na /

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'phags pa dag gsol bzhed dam /🔽'dod do / de dag gis bcu bdun sde dag la bza' ba dang btung ba byin pa dang / de dag gis longs spyad nas zung du bsdebs te 'chag cing kha ton bya bar brtsams pa dang / nye dgas de dag kha ton byed pa mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag gsol bzhed dam / 'dod do / de dag gis bcu bdun sde dag la bza' ba dang btung ba byin pa dang / de dag gis longs spyad nas zung du bsdebs te 'chag cing kha ton bya bar brtsams pa dang / nye dgas de dag kha ton byed pa mthong nas smras pa /
translated: “Noble ones, do you wish to eat?”🔽“We do.” They gave food and drink to the group of seventeen, and after they had eaten, they sat together and began to recite.

original: kya ma'o bcu bdun sde dag gis shin tu brtson 'grus brtsams so //
analyzed: kya ma'o bcu bdun sde dag gis shin tu brtson 'grus brtsams so //
translated: When Upāli saw them reciting, he said, “Oh! The group of seventeen have begun to practice very diligently.”

original: btsun pa nye dga' bcom ldan 'das kyis bde na chos mngon par rjod par byed do //
analyzed: btsun pa nye dga' bcom ldan 'das kyis bde na chos mngon par rjod par byed do //
translated: “Venerable Upāli, when the Blessed One is comfortable, he recites the Abhidharma.”

original: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gis len pa po la zas byin na gnas lnga sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag gis len pa po la zas byin na gnas lnga sbyin par byed de /
translated: When a donor or benefactor gives food to a recipient, they give five things:

original: tshe sbyin pa dang / kha dog sbyin pa dang / stobs sbyin pa dang / spobs pa sbyin pa dang / brtson 'grus sbyin pa ni bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal pa ni legs par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe sbyin pa dang / kha dog sbyin pa dang / stobs sbyin pa dang / spobs pa sbyin pa dang / brtson 'grus sbyin pa ni bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal pa ni legs par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: They give life, they give complexion, they give strength, they give eloquence, and they give vigor.

original: zos na spobs pa dang ldan par 'gyur gyi ma zos na mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zos na spobs pa dang ldan par 'gyur gyi ma zos na mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you eat, you will become eloquent, but if you do not eat, you will not become eloquent.

original: khyod kyi sa zos sam /
analyzed: khyod kyi sa zos sam /
translated: “Have you eaten?”

original: zos so // khyed dus ma yin par zar rung ngam /
analyzed: zos so // khyed dus ma yin par zar rung ngam /
translated: “We have eaten.” “Is it proper for you to eat at the wrong time?”

original: gal te dus su ma rnyed na kho bo cag gis ltogs te 'chi par bya 'am ci zhes zer nas /
analyzed: gal te dus su ma rnyed na kho bo cag gis ltogs te 'chi par bya 'am ci zhes zer nas /
translated: “If we do not get it at the right time, will we die of hunger?”🔽The monks who had little desire complained and criticized those monks,

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dus ma yin par bca' ba dang za bar byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dus ma yin par bca' ba dang za bar byed ces smod par byed /
translated: “Why do the monks eat cooked food at the wrong time?”🔽They disparaged them,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and spread it about.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this incident, with this cause, with this occasion, gathered the saṅgha of monks

original: bcu bdun sde dag la rmas nas /🔽dge spyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: bcu bdun sde dag la rmas nas / dge spyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: and questioned the group of seventeen:🔽“Monks, this is not the proper conduct🔽of a monastic,🔽this is not the proper conduct,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /🔽tshul dang mthun @147a * //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa / tshul dang mthun @147a * //
translated: this is not in accord with the Dharma,

original: pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: pa ma yin pa /
translated: this is not in accord with the Monastic Law,🔽this is not to be done.

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: This is not the proper conduct of a monastic.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: Having seen the ten benefits, he laid down a training rule for my disciples that goes as follows:

original: yang dge slong gang dus ma yin par bca' ba 'am bza' ba 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dus ma yin par bca' ba 'am bza' ba 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk eats at the wrong time, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location is Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni bcu bdun sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni bcu bdun sde /
translated: The individuals are the group of seventeen.

original: nyon mongs pa ni sbyor mi bzod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni sbyor mi bzod pa /
translated: The affliction is not being able to tolerate the training.

original: nyes pa ni dus ma yin par za ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dus ma yin par za ba'o //
translated: The offense is eating at the wrong time.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun sde 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun sde 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: In this case, “any bhikṣu” means the group of seventeen or anyone else like them.

original: dus ma yin par zhes bya ba ni dus ma yin pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dus ma yin par zhes bya ba ni dus ma yin pa gnyis te /
translated: “At the wrong time” means at two wrong times:

original: skya rengs ma shar ba dang / byed yol bar ro //🔽bca' ba 'am bza' ba zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lda bo dang bza' ba lda po dag go //
analyzed: skya rengs ma shar ba dang / byed yol bar ro // bca' ba 'am bza' ba zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lda bo dang bza' ba lda po dag go //
translated: before noon and after noon.🔽“Food” means both solid food and semisolid food.

original: 'cha' 'am zan zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
analyzed: 'cha' 'am zan zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
translated: “Eats” means to swallow it after it has been chewed.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni lnga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni lnga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense” means the fifth offense.

original: de la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / spyong ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ltung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / spyong ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the offense is to be understood by the characteristics of the basic offense, the purification, the application, the application of the application, the non-offense, the training, and the amendment.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par zhag pa ni dge slong mi na bas 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa gnas gang na bdag nyid gnas pa'i rang gi nyi ma phyed yol phan chad nas phyi de nyin par gyi rengs dang po ma shar bar shes
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par zhag pa ni dge slong mi na bas 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa gnas gang na bdag nyid gnas pa'i rang gi nyi ma phyed yol phan chad nas phyi de nyin par gyi rengs dang po ma shar bar shes
translated: Here, the actual basis of the downfall is as follows: A monk who is not sick eats fresh or cooked food after midday in a place such as Jambudvīpa, where he lives, until the following dawn, when the first hint of light appears in the east.

original: bzhin du bca' ba dang bza' ba 'chos sam zos na dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhin du bca' ba dang bza' ba 'chos sam zos na dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If he eats, he commits the actual downfall of eating at the wrong time.

original: dge slong min ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong min ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if he is not a monk or if he is sick.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa gnas gang na dge slong bdag nyid gnas pa'i rang gi nyi ma phyed yol phan chad nas phyi de nyin par skya rengs dang po ma shar tshun chad na dge slong gi zas kyi dus ma yin pas de'i bar gyi dus thams
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa gnas gang na dge slong bdag nyid gnas pa'i rang gi nyi ma phyed yol phan chad nas phyi de nyin par skya rengs dang po ma shar tshun chad na dge slong gi zas kyi dus ma yin pas de'i bar gyi dus thams
translated: In a place such as Jambudvīpa, where the monk lives, after midday until the following dawn, when the first hint of light appears in the east, it is not the time for a monk to eat.

original: cad la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: cad la na smad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault if he eats during all the periods of time that are not the time for eating.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa'i gling bzhi gang na gnas kyang rang gi dus ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa'i gling bzhi gang na gnas kyang rang gi dus ma yin pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is in Jambudvīpa or one of the other continents, and it is not the wrong time.

original: mtho ris dang ngan song dag tu ni 'du shes kyis rnam par gzhag pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: mtho ris dang ngan song dag tu ni 'du shes kyis rnam par gzhag pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is in a celestial realm or an animal realm, and it is not the wrong time.

original: rang gi dus ma yin pa la der 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang gi dus ma yin pa la der 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is in a human realm, and it is not the wrong time, but one perceives it to be the wrong time, or one is unsure of it.

original: dus su rung ba'i @147b zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dus su rung ba'i @147b zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa gang yang rung ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is the right time, and the food is one of the five kinds of fresh foods or one of the five kinds of cooked foods.

original: zos shing mid pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: zos shing mid pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one has eaten and then vomited.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dus ma yin pa de nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dus ma yin pa de nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The main factor in this downfall is the perception that it is the wrong time.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: There are five factors in the actual downfall:🔽not being a renunciate,🔽it being the wrong time,🔽perceiving it to be the wrong time,🔽eating food that is suitable to be eaten at the right time,

original: dge slong min pa dang / dus ma yin pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa dang / dus su rung ba'i zas zos pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong min pa dang / dus ma yin pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa dang / dus su rung ba'i zas zos pa'o //
translated: and

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshad na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshad na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If they are incomplete, they are all downfalls.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor offense.

original: ji srid du dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has not reached the actual basis of the downfall of eating at the wrong time, having begun the preparation for that, it is a minor offense.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes re'o //
translated: For each preparation that is different from the actual basis, there is a separate minor offense.

original: dus la dus ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dus la dus ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If it is the right time but one perceives it as the wrong time, or one is unsure of it, it is a minor offense.

original: zas rung ba ma yin pa nyid la nyes byas so //
analyzed: zas rung ba ma yin pa nyid la nyes byas so //
translated: If the food is suitable, it is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation for preparation is a very minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are also that many preparations for preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation for preparation is a minor offense, and the very minor offense is a very minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong na ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni dge slong na ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall if one is a fully ordained monk and sick.

original: dus nyid du ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dus nyid du ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is the right time.

original: der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is unconscious.

original: dus su rung ba'i zas las gzhan ba dus ma yin par rung ba 'bras bu lda dang bu ram dang sbrang rtsi dang khar dang btung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba la sogs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dus su rung ba'i zas las gzhan ba dus ma yin par rung ba 'bras bu lda dang bu ram dang sbrang rtsi dang khar dang btung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba la sogs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one eats food that is suitable to eat at the right time, but not at the wrong time, such as rice, sugar cane, honey, molasses, drinks, or food that is suitable to eat during the day, but not at night.

original: ma zos shing mgul du ma mid pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ma zos shing mgul du ma mid pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not eat and does not swallow.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is a beginner; if one is insane; if one is the first offender; if one is sick; or if one is suffering.🔽The training rule on eating at the wrong time is finished.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The monks should not eat at the wrong time.

original: dge slong na bas sman pas bstan pa'i zas rung ba bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong na bas sman pas bstan pa'i zas rung ba bsten par bya'o //
translated: The monks should eat the food that is suitable for the sick that is prescribed by a doctor.

original: phyir bcos pa ni lnga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni lnga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is like that for the fifth offense entailing expulsion.

original: dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu bdun pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: dus ma yin par za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu bdun pa bshad zin to /
translated: The thirty-seventh downfall, that of eating at the wrong time, has been explained.

original: // / gsog 'jog gi ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //🔽tshe dang ldan pa nag po'i kun du spyod pa ni grong ngam /

translated: The origin of the downfall of storing is as follows. The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.🔽The venerable Kāla’s practice was to stay near and attend to any town or

analyzed: btsun pad tshol so //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /

analyzed: tsho dang ldan pa nag po la rmas nas /

original: yul ni mnyan yong /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yong /

original: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa nag po /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bag chags ma byang bas so sor ma brtags pa /

analyzed: nyes pa ni zas gsog 'jog byas pa za ba'o //

analyzed: gsog 'jog byas pa zhes bya ba ni gsog 'jog byas pa rnam pa gnyis te /

translated: Here, the characteristics of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the amendings should be understood through the main part and the preparatory acts.

translated: All the other characteristics of the downfalls of storing and the downfall of storing are the same as the former.

original: khyad par du ni snga ma ni sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba skya rengs brgyad pa shar te gsog 'jog tu gyur pa la spang ba'i ltung byed du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: khyad par du ni snga ma ni sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba skya rengs brgyad pa shar te gsog 'jog tu gyur pa la spang ba'i ltung byed du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The difference is that the former is defined as a downfall of abandonment because of keeping for eight sunrises the medicine that is to be consumed within seven days.

original: 'di'i dus su rung ba'i zas bca' ba lda dang bza' ba lnga gsog 'jog tu gyur pa zos pa la ltung byed 'ba' zhig tu rnam par gzhag go //

translated: This is defined as a mere downfall because of eating the five cooked foods and the five fresh foods that are to be stored.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis dus su rung ba'i zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga las gang yang rung ba byin len byas pa ma zhig par bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba phyed yol las 'das nas gsog 'jog
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis dus su rung ba'i zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga las gang yang rung ba byin len byas pa ma zhig par bza' ba'i phyir 'chang ba phyed yol las 'das nas gsog 'jog
translated: Here, the actual basis of a downfall is as follows: If a fully ordained monk keeps food that is suitable for any time, such as the five types of cooked grain and the five types of vegetables, which he has received and has not been discarded, in order to eat it after midday, and he then eats it after the time of storing it,

original: tu gyur pa la der 'du shes pas zos na gsog 'jog gi ltung byed kyi dngos zhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tu gyur pa la der 'du shes pas zos na gsog 'jog gi ltung byed kyi dngos zhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then he commits the actual basis of the downfall of storing.🔽If he keeps food suitable for any time that he has received and has not been discarded in order to eat it, then after midday it becomes stored.

original: dus su rung ba'i zas byin len byas pa ni byin len ma zhig par bza' ba'i phyir 'chang na phyed yol na gsog 'jog tu gyur pas dus su rung ba'i zas kyang gsog 'jog byas pa yin la dge slong gis kyang der 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis
analyzed: dus su rung ba'i zas byin len byas pa ni byin len ma zhig par bza' ba'i phyir 'chang na phyed yol na gsog 'jog tu gyur pas dus su rung ba'i zas kyang gsog 'jog byas pa yin la dge slong gis kyang der 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis
translated: Therefore, even food suitable for any time becomes stored. If a fully ordained monk perceives it as such and has doubt,

original: za bas de zos pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: za bas de zos pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: then there is no fault in eating it.

original: dus su rung ba'i zas ni snga dro ba'i zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa nad pa dang nad pa ma @149a * //
analyzed: dus su rung ba'i zas ni snga dro ba'i zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa nad pa dang nad pa ma @149a * //
translated: Food that is suitable to be eaten at the proper time is food that is included in the five types of food and five types of drink that are to be consumed in the morning.

original: yin pa thams cad kyis rang gi gung tshigs kyi dus tshun chad du bye brag med par bsten par bya ba gang yin pa'o //🔽de gsog 'jog tu gyur pa ni dus su rung ba'i zas kyi dus ni skya rengs shar ba nas brtsams nas gung tshigs kyi skad cig ma'i bar de /
analyzed: yin pa thams cad kyis rang gi gung tshigs kyi dus tshun chad du bye brag med par bsten par bya ba gang yin pa'o // de gsog 'jog tu gyur pa ni dus su rung ba'i zas kyi dus ni skya rengs shar ba nas brtsams nas gung tshigs kyi skad cig ma'i bar de /
translated: It is to be consumed by all, both the sick and the healthy, up until the time of midday.🔽Food that is stored is food that is suitable to be eaten at the proper time that is given and received in the morning, from the time the first light of dawn appears until the moment midday begins.

original: dus der dus su rung ba'i zas byin lan byas pa byin len de nyid ma zhig par phyi dro'i dus su gung tshigs las yol bar thal ba ni gsog 'jog byas pa yin te /
analyzed: dus der dus su rung ba'i zas byin lan byas pa byin len de nyid ma zhig par phyi dro'i dus su gung tshigs las yol bar thal ba ni gsog 'jog byas pa yin te /
translated: If that food that is given and received is not discarded and is consumed in the afternoon, after midday, it is food that is stored.

original: byin len de zhig na ni gsog 'jog byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byin len de zhig na ni gsog 'jog byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that giving and receiving is discarded, it is not food that is stored.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dus su rung ba'i zas gsog 'jog tu gyur pa de nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed dang po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dus su rung ba'i zas gsog 'jog tu gyur pa de nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed dang po nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this is the one who is the primary perceiver of the food that is suitable for the time and is stored.

original: 'di la yan lag bzhis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag bzhis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there is a downfall of the actual basis by four limbs:

analyzed: dus su rung ba'i zas dang / gsog 'jog tu gyur pa dang / der 'du shes pa dang / zos pa'o //
translated: the food that is suitable for the time, that is stored, the perception of that, and eating it.

analyzed: de dag las yan lag mtshang na ci rigs par na smad do //

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /

translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

analyzed: ji srid du gsog 'jog gi ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one begins the preparation for the downfall of storing but does not reach the actual basis, there is a minor infraction.

translated: For each preparation that is different from the actual basis, there is a minor infraction.
