original: gang gi tshe rung ba nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe byin len byas pa nad pas thun tshod du rung ba nyid du byin gyis ma brlabs pas ni dus dang dus ma yin par yang na ba ma yin pa thams cad kyis kyang btung du rung ba nyid
analyzed: gang gi tshe rung ba nyid du gyur pa de'i tshe byin len byas pa nad pas thun tshod du rung ba nyid du byin gyis ma brlabs pas ni dus dang dus ma yin par yang na ba ma yin pa thams cad kyis kyang btung du rung ba nyid
translated: It is suitable for all who are not sick to drink it at the proper time or the improper time.🔽That which is consecrated by the sick as suitable for the sick is only to be drunk by the sick.

original: yin no // de dag byin len byas pa nad pas thun tshod du rung bar byin gyis brlabs pa ni nad pa 'ba' zhig gis btung la tha na thun tshod du rung ba zhes bya'o //🔽btung ba de dag gal te /🔽dus su rung ba'i rdzas las sbyor na ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas sbyar zhing btsags te /
analyzed: yin no // de dag byin len byas pa nad pas thun tshod du rung bar byin gyis brlabs pa ni nad pa 'ba' zhig gis btung la tha na thun tshod du rung ba zhes bya'o // btung ba de dag gal te / dus su rung ba'i rdzas las sbyor na ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas sbyar zhing btsags te /
translated: Even if it is called “suitable for the sick,”🔽if it is made from substances suitable for the proper time,

original: chu grangs mos btab la byin len bstabs par bya'o //
analyzed: chu grangs mos btab la byin len bstabs par bya'o //
translated: then it is to be consecrated by one who has not completed the novitiate.🔽It is to be consecrated by one who has not completed the novitiate, and it is to be consecrated by one who has completed the novitiate.

original: gal te dus ma yin par rung ba'i rdzas las sbyar na ni bsnyen par rdzogs pas kyang rdzas de nyid byin len byas te sbyar te btsags la gang gi tsho mthun pa'i tshe na chu grang mos gdab pa'i bstabs pa dang byin len stobs su bcug nas btung
analyzed: gal te dus ma yin par rung ba'i rdzas las sbyar na ni bsnyen par rdzogs pas kyang rdzas de nyid byin len byas te sbyar te btsags la gang gi tsho mthun pa'i tshe na chu grang mos gdab pa'i bstabs pa dang byin len stobs su bcug nas btung
translated: If it is prepared from substances suitable at improper times, then even one fully ordained may drink it after receiving it and preparing it himself, straining it and adding hot water when it is the right time.

original: du yang rung do //
analyzed: du yang rung do //
translated: It is suitable to drink it after receiving it from another.

original: dus su rung ba'i rdzas las sbyar ba'i btung ba de ni btung ba'i mtha' yang thun tshod gcig gi mtha' tshun chad du btung bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dus su rung ba'i rdzas las sbyar ba'i btung ba de ni btung ba'i mtha' yang thun tshod gcig gi mtha' tshun chad du btung bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: That drink prepared from substances suitable at a specific time should be drunk within the limit of one watch.

original: de las ring du bzhag na zas kyi 'gyur ba bsten pas gal te ska ba la sogs par gyur na gsog 'jog gi nyes pa bsten par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ring du bzhag na zas kyi 'gyur ba bsten pas gal te ska ba la sogs par gyur na gsog 'jog gi nyes pa bsten par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is left longer than that, then since it is used as a substitute for food, if it becomes thick and so on, then it would be used with the fault of storing it.

original: dus ma yin par rung ba'i rdzas las sbyor ba'i btung ba ni rdzas de'i bza' ba'i dus kyi mtha' zhag bdun pa 'am /
analyzed: dus ma yin par rung ba'i rdzas las sbyor ba'i btung ba ni rdzas de'i bza' ba'i dus kyi mtha' zhag bdun pa 'am /
translated: A drink prepared from substances suitable at improper times should be drunk within seven days of the time it is suitable to eat those substances.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba gang yin pa de srid du btung ba de yang gzhag cing btung du rung ngo //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba gang yin pa de srid du btung ba de yang gzhag cing btung du rung ngo //
translated: That drink is also suitable to be drunk for as long as it is kept.

original: de la yang thun tshod du rung bar byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa yin gyi thun tshod du rung bar byin gyis brlabs pa ni rang gi tshogs ji lta ba bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang thun tshod du rung bar byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa yin gyi thun tshod du rung bar byin gyis brlabs pa ni rang gi tshogs ji lta ba bzhin du bya'o //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of not consecrating it as suitable for the eon. But if it is consecrated as suitable for the eon, it should be used according to one’s own faction.

original: thun tshod du rung ba'i ltung ba byin gyis brlabs pa'i chog dang / sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba'i ltung ba byin gyis brlabs pa'i chog dang / sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The rite and mantra for consecrating the downfall of that suitable for the eon is as follows:

original: thun tshod du rung ba'i rgyu ba'i rdzas de dag gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mkhas pa gang yang rung ba'i sa gzhir sbyar cing btsags nas bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang /
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba'i rgyu ba'i rdzas de dag gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mkhas pa gang yang rung ba'i sa gzhir sbyar cing btsags nas bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang /
translated: Those substances suitable for the eon should be mixed and strained on the ground of any skilled person who is not fully ordained. Then, one should eat it without adding any unsuitable food that is held in the hand, or that is cooked inside,

original: nang du zhag lon pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa la sogs pa dang ma @150a * //
analyzed: nang du zhag lon pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa la sogs pa dang ma @150a * //
translated: or that has been stored overnight, or that is cooked by a fully ordained monk, and so on.

original: 'dres par byas la /
analyzed: 'dres par byas la /
translated: One should do it without mixing it with unsuitable substances.

original: dge slong nad pas kyang snga dro lag pa bsnyal te byin len byas la /
analyzed: dge slong nad pas kyang snga dro lag pa bsnyal te byin len byas la /
translated: A sick monk should wash his hands in the morning and receive the alms.

original: de dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa cig gi mdun du tsog phur 'dug ste /
analyzed: de dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa cig gi mdun du tsog phur 'dug ste /
translated: He should sit in front of a fully ordained monk who is of the same view and has the same distinguishing marks, and who is staying within the same boundary.

original: gnyi gas lhung bzed dam snyom snod lag mthil gyon par bzhag ste /
analyzed: gnyi gas lhung bzed dam snyom snod lag mthil gyon par bzhag ste /
translated: Both should place their alms bowl or alms bowl base on the palm of their hand.

original: g-yas pas steng nas bkab nas nad pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas pas steng nas bkab nas nad pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The sick monk should cover it with his right hand and say this:

original: cho dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: cho dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: ‘Venerable, please pay attention.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sman thun tshod du rung ba 'di dag bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis bgyi bar thun tshod du rung bar byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sman thun tshod du rung ba 'di dag bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis bgyi bar thun tshod du rung bar byin gyis brlab po //
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, consecrate as allowable for seven days this medicine that is allowable for one day, which I will use together with my fellow practitioners of pure conduct.’

original: lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: He should repeat this three times.

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The listener should say, ‘It is suitable.’

original: nad pas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nad pas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The sick monk should say, ‘It is good.’

original: de phyin chad nyi ma phyed yol nad de nyid kyi mtshan mo'i thun tshod dang po'i mtha'i bar du byin len ma zhig par byas te /
analyzed: de phyin chad nyi ma phyed yol nad de nyid kyi mtshan mo'i thun tshod dang po'i mtha'i bar du byin len ma zhig par byas te /
translated: After that, until the end of the first period of the night, one should not discard the acceptance.

original: rang gis bsten cing btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gis bsten cing btung bar bya'o //
translated: One should drink it oneself.

original: mtshan mo'i thun tshod dang po mtha'i tshud chad du 'thungs zin cing lhag ma med na der zad /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i thun tshod dang po mtha'i tshud chad du 'thungs zin cing lhag ma med na der zad /
translated: If one has drunk it until the end of the first period of the night and there is none left, then it is finished.

original: yod na yang btung ba'i phyir 'chang na thun tshod dang po las 'das na gsog 'jog tu 'gyur zhing de 'thungs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: yod na yang btung ba'i phyir 'chang na thun tshod dang po las 'das na gsog 'jog tu 'gyur zhing de 'thungs na nyes byas so //
translated: If there is some, but one keeps it in order to drink it, then if one drinks it after the first period, it becomes stored and if one drinks it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong mi na bas ni thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba byin gyis brlab tu yang mi rung la /
analyzed: dge slong mi na bas ni thun tshod du rung ba'i btung ba byin gyis brlab tu yang mi rung la /
translated: A monk who is not sick is not allowed to consecrate a drink that is suitable for a period.

original: gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa btung du yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa btung du yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Nor is he allowed to drink one consecrated by another.

original: dge slong na ba ma yin pas thun tshod du rung bar byin gyis ma brlabs pa dus dang dus ma yin par na ba dang / na ba ma yin pas kyang btung du rung ba de dag las gang yang rung ba gal te byin len byas pa ma zhig par btung ba'i phyir 'chang na thun tshod las 'das na de yang gsog 'jog tu 'gyur zhing de 'thungs na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong na ba ma yin pas thun tshod du rung bar byin gyis ma brlabs pa dus dang dus ma yin par na ba dang / na ba ma yin pas kyang btung du rung ba de dag las gang yang rung ba gal te byin len byas pa ma zhig par btung ba'i phyir 'chang na thun tshod las 'das na de yang gsog 'jog tu 'gyur zhing de 'thungs na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk who is not sick keeps any of those medicines that are suitable to be drunk by a sick or healthy monk, either in time or not in time, for the purpose of drinking them, after having received them without transforming them with the blessing of making them suitable within a day, then if he keeps them beyond the time period, they become stored and if he drinks them, he also has a fault.

original: sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir 'chang na skya rengs brgyad pa shar te gsog 'jog tu 'gyur ba de zos pa yang skabs 'di'i nyes byas te /
analyzed: sman zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa bza' ba'i phyir 'chang na skya rengs brgyad pa shar te gsog 'jog tu 'gyur ba de zos pa yang skabs 'di'i nyes byas te /
translated: If he keeps the seven-day medicine for the purpose of eating it, then when the eighth dawn has risen, it becomes stored and if he eats it, he also has a fault in this context.

original: sman zhag bdun pa ni zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba dag go //
analyzed: sman zhag bdun pa ni zhun mar dang / 'bru mar dang / sbrang rtsi dang / bu ram dang / bu ram gyi dbu ba dag go //
translated: The seven-day medicine is clarified butter, sesame oil, honey, sugar, and sugar-cane scum.

original: zhun mar zhes bya ba ni mar bzhus pa ste /
analyzed: zhun mar zhes bya ba ni mar bzhus pa ste /
translated: Clarified butter is melted butter.

original: bdud rtsi yang de'i khongs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi yang de'i khongs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: Amṛta is also included in that.

original: 'bru mar zhes bya ba ni 'bru mar nyid do //
analyzed: 'bru mar zhes bya ba ni 'bru mar nyid do //
translated: “Oil” means sesame oil.

original: zhag rnam pa lnga po nya'i zhag dang / ri bong gi zhag dang / chu srin byis pa gsod @150b kyi zhag dang / dom gyi zhag dang / phag gi zhag dus su bskol /🔽dus su btsags /🔽dus su byin len byas /
analyzed: zhag rnam pa lnga po nya'i zhag dang / ri bong gi zhag dang / chu srin byis pa gsod @150b kyi zhag dang / dom gyi zhag dang / phag gi zhag dus su bskol / dus su btsags / dus su byin len byas /
translated: The five kinds of fat are the fat of fish, rabbit, porpoise, bear, and pig.🔽They are to be boiled at the proper time,🔽strained at the proper time,

original: dus su byin gyis brlabs pa de dag kyang 'di'i khongs su gtogs so //
analyzed: dus su byin gyis brlabs pa de dag kyang 'di'i khongs su gtogs so //
translated: and consecrated at the proper time.

original: sbrang rtsi zhes bya ba ni sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi'o //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi zhes bya ba ni sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi'o //
translated: Honey means the honey of bees.

original: bu ram dang bu ram gyi dbu ba zhes bya ba ni bu ram nyid de /
analyzed: bu ram dang bu ram gyi dbu ba zhes bya ba ni bu ram nyid de /
translated: Sugar and sugar lumps are sugar cane.

original: tvags dang / le kha ral sogs pa yang 'di'i khongs su gtogs so //
analyzed: tvags dang / le kha ral sogs pa yang 'di'i khongs su gtogs so //
translated: Jaggery and molasses are also included here.

original: sman zhag bdun pa byin len byas pa dang / byin gyis brlabs pa de dag ni dge slong nad pas zhag bdun gyi mtha'i dus tshun chad du rang gis byin len byas shing byin gyis brlabs te bsten par bya ba nyid yin gyi mi na bas na byin gyis brlab tu yang mi rung la /
analyzed: sman zhag bdun pa byin len byas pa dang / byin gyis brlabs pa de dag ni dge slong nad pas zhag bdun gyi mtha'i dus tshun chad du rang gis byin len byas shing byin gyis brlabs te bsten par bya ba nyid yin gyi mi na bas na byin gyis brlab tu yang mi rung la /
translated: The seven-day medicine is to be used by a sick monk for seven days at the most, after he has accepted it and consecrated it. It is not suitable for one who is not sick to consecrate it.

original: gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa dag bzar yang mi rung do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa dag bzar yang mi rung do //
translated: It is also not suitable for one who is not sick to eat the medicine consecrated by another.

original: sos pa nyid na de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no //
analyzed: sos pa nyid na de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no //
translated: If one recovers, one should give it to those who are sick if they request it.

original: slong ba med na dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: slong ba med na dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If there is no one to request it, it should be placed in the medicine house of the saṅgha.

original: de dag zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The consecration and mantra for the seven-day medicine is as follows.

original: sman de dag sman pa dang / sman pa rab tu byung ba dang / sman g-yog bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mkhas pa gang yang rung bas rung ba'i sa gzhir snga dro bskol zhing btsags na bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: sman de dag sman pa dang / sman pa rab tu byung ba dang / sman g-yog bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mkhas pa gang yang rung bas rung ba'i sa gzhir snga dro bskol zhing btsags na bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: They should be made free of unsuitable things,

original: lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang / nang du zhag lon pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa la sogs pa dang ma 'dres par byas la /
analyzed: lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang / nang du zhag lon pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa la sogs pa dang ma 'dres par byas la /
translated: such as being held in the hand, being cooked indoors, being kept overnight, or being cooked by a fully ordained monk.

original: dge slong nad pas kyang snga dro lag pa bsnyal te byin len byas la /
analyzed: dge slong nad pas kyang snga dro lag pa bsnyal te byin len byas la /
translated: A sick fully ordained monk should wash his hands in the morning and receive the medicine.

original: dge slong bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa cig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa cig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
translated: He should then squat in front of a fully ordained monk who is of the same gender and view and who is staying within the same boundary.

original: gnyi gas lhung bzed dam sman snod lag mthil g-yon par bzhag la g-yas pas kha nas bkab ste nad pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi gas lhung bzed dam sman snod lag mthil g-yon par bzhag la g-yas pas kha nas bkab ste nad pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Both should place the alms bowl or the medicine container on the left palm and cover it with the right hand. The sick monk should say the following:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i zhes bgyi ba'i sman zhag bdun pa 'di dag bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyir bgyi bar zhag bdun par byin gyis bral po //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i zhes bgyi ba'i sman zhag bdun pa 'di dag bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyir bgyi bar zhag bdun par byin gyis bral po //
translated: “Venerable, please listen. I, the monk named so-and-so, will use this medicine that lasts seven days for myself and for those who are practicing pure conduct together with me. I will use it for seven days.

original: lan gsum du bzlas /
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas /
translated: ” Repeat this three times.

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: After that, the one who is listening should say, “It is suitable.”

original: nad pas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nad pas legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The one who is sick should say, “It is good.”

original: de phyin chad zhag bdun gyi bar du byin len ma zhig par byas te rang gis bsten cing bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de phyin chad zhag bdun gyi bar du byin len ma zhig par byas te rang gis bsten cing bza' bar bya'o //
translated: From then on, for seven days, he should not break the continuity of the taking of the medicine, and he should use it and eat it.

original: zhag bdun par byin gyis @151a * //
analyzed: zhag bdun par byin gyis @151a * //
translated: On the day after the day on which the medicine that lasts seven days is consecrated,

original: brlabs pa'i nyi ma 'das so cog dge slong la nyi ma re re zheng deng phan chad du nyi ma dang po 'das te /
analyzed: brlabs pa'i nyi ma 'das so cog dge slong la nyi ma re re zheng deng phan chad du nyi ma dang po 'das te /
translated: each day the monk should say, “From today onward, the first day has passed.

original: deng ni nyi ma gnyis pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: deng ni nyi ma gnyis pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Today is the second day,” and so on.

original: zhag brgyad pa'i skya rengs ma shar tshun chad du zos zin cing lhag ma med na der zad /
analyzed: zhag brgyad pa'i skya rengs ma shar tshun chad du zos zin cing lhag ma med na der zad /
translated: If the medicine is all gone by the time the dawn of the eighth day arrives, then the fault is complete.

original: yod na nad pa'i phyir slong ba la sbyin pa'am /
analyzed: yod na nad pa'i phyir slong ba la sbyin pa'am /
translated: If there is some left, the monk should give it to someone who is sick,

original: dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag pa 'am bsam pa thag pa nas ltos pa med pa'i sems kyis gzhan la gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag pa 'am bsam pa thag pa nas ltos pa med pa'i sems kyis gzhan la gtang bar bya'o //
translated: or he should put it in the medicine house of the community, or he should give it away to others with a mind that is free from any concern for his own interest.

original: de ltar ma byas par bza' ba'i phyir 'chang na skya rengs brgyad pa shar na gsog 'jog tu 'gyur zhing spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar ma byas par bza' ba'i phyir 'chang na skya rengs brgyad pa shar na gsog 'jog tu 'gyur zhing spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir yang 'gyur la /
translated: If he does not do any of these things and keeps the medicine for the purpose of eating it, then when the dawn of the eighth day arrives, the medicine becomes stored and set aside, and he has committed the basic offense of a downfall due to storing.

original: de zos na gsog 'jog gi ltung byed 'di nyid kyi skabs kyi nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de zos na gsog 'jog gi ltung byed 'di nyid kyi skabs kyi nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he eats that medicine, he commits an offense for the period of time during which he is eating it.

translated: Since the embers are like a container, the substance to be burned is burned inside, above those embers that are inside the boundary.🔽Since the boundary and the area around the dwelling are the dwelling itself, even if one stays there overnight or cooks there, it is as if one stays overnight and cooks inside the dwelling.🔽In an uncovered upper story, since the space above the head down to the sky above is the dwelling itself, even if one stays overnight or cooks there, it is as if one stays overnight and cooks inside.

original: gnas steng ma g-yogs pa la ni nang gi nam mkha' thams cad gnas nyid yin pas der zhag lon pa dang btsos pa yang nang du zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnas steng ma g-yogs pa la ni nang gi nam mkha' thams cad gnas nyid yin pas der zhag lon pa dang btsos pa yang nang du zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa nyid yin no //
translated: In an uncovered upper story, since all the space inside is the dwelling itself, even if one stays overnight or cooks there, it is as if one stays overnight and cooks inside.

original: 'og khang gi steng gi yang thog gzhan yang 'og khang de nyid kyi gnas yin pas /
analyzed: 'og khang gi steng gi yang thog gzhan yang 'og khang de nyid kyi gnas yin pas /
translated: The other upper stories above the lower story are also the lower story itself.

original: der zhag lon pa dang btsos pa yang nang du zhag lon pa dang / nang du btsos pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: der zhag lon pa dang btsos pa yang nang du zhag lon pa dang / nang du btsos pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, if one stays there, it is as if one stays inside and if one cooks there, it is as if one cooks inside.

original: gnas stong par byas pa zhig tu gal te dge slong re zhig gnas par gyur na de yang dge slong gi gnas nyid yin pas de ra zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnas stong par byas pa zhig tu gal te dge slong re zhig gnas par gyur na de yang dge slong gi gnas nyid yin pas de ra zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa nyid yin no //
translated: If a bhikṣu stays for a while in an empty dwelling, that is also the dwelling of a bhikṣu. Therefore, if he stays there, it is as if he stays inside and if he cooks there, it is as if he cooks inside.

original: dge slong gi gnas sam /
analyzed: dge slong gi gnas sam /
translated: If a bhikṣu stays in a dwelling of a bhikṣu

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gnas na dge tshul cam gnas su zin kyang de dge slong gi gnas nyid yin pas der zhag lon pa dang btsos pa yang nang du @153a * //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gnas na dge tshul cam gnas su zin kyang de dge slong gi gnas nyid yin pas der zhag lon pa dang btsos pa yang nang du @153a * //
translated: or in a dwelling of the saṅgha of bhikṣus, even if a novice monk stays there, it is the dwelling of a bhikṣu. Therefore, if he stays there, it is as if he stays inside and if he cooks there, it is as if he cooks inside.

original: zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa nyid yin la dge slong gis btsos pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi nang yang rung phyi rol yang rung ste dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang pa dang sa gzhir yang rung dge slong gi gnas dang gzhan du yang rung🔽ste / dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa can ma nyams pas btso ba dang sreg pa la sogs pas g-yos su byas pa'o //🔽dge slong gis btsos pa yang dge slong kho nas bza' bar bya ba ma yin gyi /🔽dge slong ma rnams kyis bza' bar mi bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa nyid yin la dge slong gis btsos pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams kyi nang yang rung phyi rol yang rung ste dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang pa dang sa gzhir yang rung dge slong gi gnas dang gzhan du yang rung ste / dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa can ma nyams pas btso ba dang sreg pa la sogs pas g-yos su byas pa'o // dge slong gis btsos pa yang dge slong kho nas bza' bar bya ba ma yin gyi / dge slong ma rnams kyis bza' bar mi bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is cooked by a bhikṣu if it is cooked by a bhikṣu who is not impaired, either inside or outside the boundary, in a kitchen or on the ground that is suitable for the Saṅgha, in the dwelling of a bhikṣu, or elsewhere.🔽It is cooked by a bhikṣu if it is cooked by a bhikṣu who is not impaired, either inside or outside the boundary, in a kitchen or on the ground that is suitable for the Saṅgha, in the dwelling of a bhikṣu, or elsewhere.🔽It is cooked by a bhikṣu if it is cooked by a bhikṣu who is not impaired, either inside or outside the boundary, in a kitchen or on the ground that is suitable for the Saṅgha, in the dwelling of a bhikṣu, or elsewhere.

original: dge slong mas btsos pa yang dge slong ma kho nas bza' bar bya ba ma yin gyi //🔽dge slong rnams kyis bza' bar mi bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong mas btsos pa yang dge slong ma kho nas bza' bar bya ba ma yin gyi //🔽dge slong rnams kyis bza' bar mi bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is cooked by a bhikṣu if it is cooked by a bhikṣu who is not impaired, either inside or outside the boundary, in a kitchen or on the ground that is suitable for the Saṅgha, in the dwelling of a bhikṣu, or elsewhere.🔽It is cooked by a bhikṣu if it is cooked by a bhikṣu who is not impaired, either inside or outside the boundary, in a kitchen or on the ground that is suitable for the Saṅgha, in the dwelling of a bhikṣu, or elsewhere.

original: nang du btsos pa dang dge slong gis btsos ba zhes bya ba gnyis ka'i skabs nas btsos pa zhes bya ba'i sbra smos pa'i mtshan nyid ni spyir 'dra ste /
analyzed: nang du btsos pa dang dge slong gis btsos ba zhes bya ba gnyis ka'i skabs nas btsos pa zhes bya ba'i sbra smos pa'i mtshan nyid ni spyir 'dra ste /
translated: The general definition of cooked is as follows:

original: rjen pa btsos pa gang yin pa de ni btsos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjen pa btsos pa gang yin pa de ni btsos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is raw is cooked.

original: de yang til dang 'bras dang sha la sogs pa mi snyi ba rnams kyi rjen pa nyid ni bshur ba la sogs pas sum cha bangs pa nyid kyi mdun rol phan chang de /
analyzed: de yang til dang 'bras dang sha la sogs pa mi snyi ba rnams kyi rjen pa nyid ni bshur ba la sogs pas sum cha bangs pa nyid kyi mdun rol phan chang de /
translated: Moreover, the rawness of hard substances such as sesame, rice and meat is destroyed by cutting, etc., when one third is cooked.

original: de phyin chad ni rjen pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de phyin chad ni rjen pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: After that, it is not raw.

original: rdzas snyi ba rnams kyi rjen pa nyid ni kha dog gyur pa'i mdun rol phan chad de /
analyzed: rdzas snyi ba rnams kyi rjen pa nyid ni kha dog gyur pa'i mdun rol phan chad de /
translated: The rawness of soft substances is destroyed by color change.

original: de phyin chad rjen pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de phyin chad rjen pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: After that, it is not raw.

original: 'o ma la sogs pa khu ba rnams kyi rjen pa nyid ni lan gnyis khol bar gyur pa nyid kyi mdun rol phan chad de /
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa khu ba rnams kyi rjen pa nyid ni lan gnyis khol bar gyur pa nyid kyi mdun rol phan chad de /
translated: The rawness of liquids such as milk is destroyed by boiling twice.

original: de phyin chad ni rjen pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de phyin chad ni rjen pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: After that, it is not raw.

original: lhung bzed dang lhung bzed chung du dang / kha ga zar dang / kham phor dang / tshva khug dang / lhung bzed kyi snod dang / gos dang / man shel dang / khri dang / khri'u dang / 'khar ba dang / phru ba dang /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang lhung bzed chung du dang / kha ga zar dang / kham phor dang / tshva khug dang / lhung bzed kyi snod dang / gos dang / man shel dang / khri dang / khri'u dang / 'khar ba dang / phru ba dang /
translated: a begging bowl, a small begging bowl, a water strainer, a cup, a bag, a container for a begging bowl, a robe, a crystal, a bed, a bench, a staff, a water pot,

original: bum pa dang / ril ba dang / lde mig dang / lde mig kyog po gsog 'jog byas pas 'bags pa za na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bum pa dang / ril ba dang / lde mig dang / lde mig kyog po gsog 'jog byas pas 'bags pa za na nyes byas so //
translated: a water jar, a key, a key ring, or a container for a key ring, and then eats the stored food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: kha dri ma can gyis bza' ba dang / btung ba dag zos sam 'thungs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: kha dri ma can gyis bza' ba dang / btung ba dag zos sam 'thungs na nyes byas so //
translated: If he eats or drinks food or drink that has a bad smell, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: lan tshva dang / 'gyur byed dang / rnyog pa dag las lan tshva tsha chur gyur pa dang / 'gyur byed 'gyur byed kyi chur gyur pa dang / rnyog pa rnyog chur gyur pa gsog 'jog byas pa 'am byin len ma byas par 'thungs pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: lan tshva dang / 'gyur byed dang / rnyog pa dag las lan tshva tsha chur gyur pa dang / 'gyur byed 'gyur byed kyi chur gyur pa dang / rnyog pa rnyog chur gyur pa gsog 'jog byas pa 'am byin len ma byas par 'thungs pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If he drinks salt water, sour water, or turbid water that has been stored or that has not been received, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ltos pa med par btang ba la yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na de byin len @153b byas te zos pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ltos pa med par btang ba la yang ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na de byin len @153b byas te zos pa la nyes byas so //
translated: Also, if one gives without regard to the material to be given, such as what is in one's hand, and so on, it is still regarded as giving.

original: bza' ba dang bca' ba gsog 'jog ma byas pa la dge slong gis gsog 'jog byas par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za bas zos pa la nyed byas so //
analyzed: bza' ba dang bca' ba gsog 'jog ma byas pa la dge slong gis gsog 'jog byas par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za bas zos pa la nyed byas so //
translated: If a monk eats food that is not stored, but which he perceives as stored, or which he doubts as to whether it is stored, he commits an offense.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The offense of preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are also that many preparations of preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation of a preparation is also a minor offense, a minor offense.

original: ltung pa med pa ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba byin gyis brlabs pa rnams ni dus thams cad du za ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ltung pa med pa ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba byin gyis brlabs pa rnams ni dus thams cad du za ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one eats at all times what has been consecrated as medicine to be kept until one is cured.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba byin gyis ma brlabs pa rnams ni snga dro ba dang phyi dro ba'i dus kyis phyir bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba byin gyis ma brlabs pa rnams ni snga dro ba dang phyi dro ba'i dus kyis phyir bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The medicines that are not consecrated for life-long use are included in the morning and evening medicines.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba ni /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba ni /
translated: Medicines for life-long use are:

original: rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / tshe ba dang / 'gyur byed dang / lan tshva dang / sman khu dang / dug sman zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / tshe ba dang / 'gyur byed dang / lan tshva dang / sman khu dang / dug sman zas kyi don du khyab par byed pa ma yin pa dag go //
translated: roots, stems, leaves, flowers, fruits, vegetables, condiments, salt, medicinal decoctions, and medicines that are not used as food.

original: de la rtsa ba ni gla sgang dang / shu dag dang / yung ba dang / sge'u gsher dang / gong nga dkar po la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba ni gla sgang dang / shu dag dang / yung ba dang / sge'u gsher dang / gong nga dkar po la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Roots are ginger, asafoetida, turmeric, garlic, white onion, and so forth.

original: sdong bu ni tsan dan dang / spyi mo dang / shug pa dang / sle tres dang / thang shing dang / skyer pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: sdong bu ni tsan dan dang / spyi mo dang / shug pa dang / sle tres dang / thang shing dang / skyer pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Stems are sandalwood, nutmeg, juniper, pomegranate, pine, buckthorn, and so forth.

original: 'dab ma ni ba sha ka dang / ko sha ti ka dang / pa to la dang / nim ma pa dang / sapta parna'i 'dab ma la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: 'dab ma ni ba sha ka dang / ko sha ti ka dang / pa to la dang / nim ma pa dang / sapta parna'i 'dab ma la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The leaves are those of the bhasaka, koshatika, patola, nimba, saptaparna, and so on.

original: me tog ni ba sha ka dang / nim pa dang / dha ta ki dang / klu shing dang / pad ma'i ze ba la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: me tog ni ba sha ka dang / nim pa dang / dha ta ki dang / klu shing dang / pad ma'i ze ba la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The flowers are those of the bhasaka, nimba, dhataki, nagakesara, lotus, and so on.

original: 'bras bu ni aa ru ra dang / skyu ru nga dang / ba ru ra dang / ne la sham dang / pi pi ling la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni aa ru ra dang / skyu ru nga dang / ba ru ra dang / ne la sham dang / pi pi ling la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The fruits are those of the emblic myrobalan, yellow myrobalan, black myrobalan, nelum, long pepper, and so on.🔽The resins are those of the devadaru, sarja, lac, beeswax, and shellac, and so on.

original: tshi ba ni shing kun dang / sra tsi dang / rgya skyegs dang / spra tshil dang / shing ma zhol sogs pa dag go //🔽'byung byed ni til gyi dang / rgya skyegs shing gi dang / sa tshur gyi dang / nas kyi dang / nas kyi gra ma'i dang / ba sha ka'i dang / thal ba'i 'gyur byed la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: tshi ba ni shing kun dang / sra tsi dang / rgya skyegs dang / spra tshil dang / shing ma zhol sogs pa dag go //🔽'byung byed ni til gyi dang / rgya skyegs shing gi dang / sa tshur gyi dang / nas kyi dang / nas kyi gra ma'i dang / ba sha ka'i dang / thal ba'i 'gyur byed la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The salts are those of sesame, lac, soda, barley, barley husk, bhasaka, and ash, and so on.

original: lan tshva ni rgya tsha dang / kha ru tsha dang / tsha dmar dang / rgya mtsho'i tsha dang / ba tsha la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: lan tshva ni rgya tsha dang / kha ru tsha dang / tsha dmar dang / rgya mtsho'i tsha dang / ba tsha la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Salt is rock salt, black salt, red salt, sea salt, and white salt.

original: sman khu ni shing aa mra dang / ni ma pa dang / ko sham pa dang / shi ri sha dang / 'dzam bu la sos pa'i sman khu dag go //
analyzed: sman khu ni shing aa mra dang / ni ma pa dang / ko sham pa dang / shi ri sha dang / 'dzam bu la sos pa'i sman khu dag go //
translated: Medicinal decoctions are those made from mango, neem, kosambaka, śirīṣa, and jambū leaves.

original: dug sman ni nu zhos 'tsho ba'i be'u'i lci ba dang / gcin dang / shing kants dang / ka pi ta la dang / aa shvad tha dang / au dum b'a ra dang / nya gro dha la sogs pa'i thal ba dang / @154a * //
analyzed: dug sman ni nu zhos 'tsho ba'i be'u'i lci ba dang / gcin dang / shing kants dang / ka pi ta la dang / aa shvad tha dang / au dum b'a ra dang / nya gro dha la sogs pa'i thal ba dang / @154a * //
translated: Medicinal powders are the dung, urine, and ashes of a calf that is still drinking milk, and the ashes of kantsa, kapittha, aśvattha, udumbara, and nyagrodha trees.

original: sa gzhi sor bzhi'i 'og nas brkos pa'i sa dag go //
analyzed: sa gzhi sor bzhi'i 'og nas brkos pa'i sa dag go //
translated: And the earth dug up from a depth of four finger-widths.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba'i sman byin gyis brlabs pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba'i sman byin gyis brlabs pa'i cho ga dang sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The consecration and mantra for the medicine to be kept until recovery are as follows.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba'i sman de dag gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mkhas pa gang yang rung bas rung ba'i sa gzhir bshams shing bsdogs nas bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba'i sman de dag gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa mkhas pa gang yang rung bas rung ba'i sa gzhir bshams shing bsdogs nas bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa lag nyar blangs pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang /
translated: The medicine that is to be kept until one is cured is to be arranged and prepared on a suitable surface by a qualified person who is not fully ordained. It should not be mixed with any food that is not suitable to eat, or with anything cooked inside, or anything that has been kept overnight, or anything cooked by a fully ordained monk.

original: nang du zhag lon pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa la sogs pa dang ma 'dres par byas la dge slong nad pas kyang snga dro lag pa bsnyal te byin len byas la /
analyzed: nang du zhag lon pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa la sogs pa dang ma 'dres par byas la dge slong nad pas kyang snga dro lag pa bsnyal te byin len byas la /
translated: The fully ordained sick monk should wash his hands in the morning and receive the medicine.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa cig gi mdun du tsog phur 'dug ste gnyis lhung bzed dam sman snod lag mthil gyon par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na gnas pa cig gi mdun du tsog phur 'dug ste gnyis lhung bzed dam sman snod lag mthil gyon par gzhag ste /
translated: He should sit in front of a fully ordained monk who is of the same view and has the same distinguishing marks, and who is staying within the same boundary. He should place the begging bowl or medicine container on the palm of his hand.

original: g-yas pas steng nas bkab nas nad pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas pas steng nas bkab nas nad pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: With his right hand he should cover it. The sick monk should say this:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol //
translated: “Venerable, please consider this.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sman 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba 'di dag bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyir bgyid par 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang bar byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sman 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba 'di dag bdag dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyir bgyid par 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang bar byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, consecrate these medicines to be kept until the end of my life for myself and for those who are practicing pure conduct together with me.

original: lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: lan gsum bzlas /
translated: Repeat three times.

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya /
translated: After that, say, “Listening is the method.”

original: nad pas kyang legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nad pas kyang legs so zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The patient should say, “Excellent.”

original: de phyin chad bdag gnyid ji srid 'tsho ba'i bar du 'am sman de dag ji srid ma zad kyi bar du byin len ma zhig par bgyis te /
analyzed: de phyin chad bdag gnyid ji srid 'tsho ba'i bar du 'am sman de dag ji srid ma zad kyi bar du byin len ma zhig par bgyis te /
translated: From now on, I will use these medicines until I die or until they are used up, and I will not do the lifting of the restrictions.

original: rang gis bsten zhing bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gis bsten zhing bza' bar bya'o //
translated: I will rely on them and eat them.

original: dge slong mi na bas ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba'i sman byin gyis brlab tu yang mi rung la /
analyzed: dge slong mi na bas ni 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba'i sman byin gyis brlab tu yang mi rung la /
translated: A monk who is not sick is not suitable to consecrate medicines to be kept until the end of life.

original: gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa yang bza' bar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa yang bza' bar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not suitable for him to eat those consecrated by another.

original: sos pa nyid na de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no //
analyzed: sos pa nyid na de dag nad pa'i phyir slong na sbyin no //
translated: If he recovers, he should give them to those who are sick if they ask for them.

original: slong ba med na dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: slong ba med na dge 'dun gyi sman khang du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If there is no one to beg, it should be placed in the medicine house of the Saṅgha.

analyzed: bdag po dag gi gnas 'dir dge slong su yang gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya gtsug lag khang gi phyogs kyi gnas 'ga' zhig spangs pa ni dge slong gi gnas nyid ma yin pa deng zhag lon pa dang btsos pa la nang du zhag lon pa dang / nang du btsos pa'i nyes pa med do // gtsug lag khang stong par dge slong zhig zhag 'ga' tsam gnas 'cha' bar byed na yang dge slong gi gnas nyid yin pa las dge slong de de nas song na ni dge slong gi gnas nyid ma yin pas der zhag lon pa dang @154b btsos pa la nad
translated: If a place in a temple is abandoned with the announcement, No monk should stay in this place of the owners, it is not a monk's dwelling. There is no fault of staying overnight or cooking there.🔽If a monk stays for a few nights in an empty temple, it is a monk's dwelling. If that monk leaves, it is not a monk's dwelling. There is no fault of staying overnight or cooking there.

original: du zhag lon pa dang / nad du btsos pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: du zhag lon pa dang / nad du btsos pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If a monk stays for a few nights in an empty temple, it is a monk's dwelling. If that monk leaves, it is not a monk's dwelling. There is no fault of staying overnight or cooking there.

original: sbyin bdag gis rung ba ma yin pa'i gzhir zhag tu bzhag pa dang / btsos pa 'bul bar byed pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis rung ba ma yin pa'i gzhir zhag tu bzhag pa dang / btsos pa 'bul bar byed pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the host places the monk in an unsuitable place for the night, or if he offers him cooked food.

original: sa bon mtshams kyi nang du zhag lon pa dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du btab pa las /
analyzed: sa bon mtshams kyi nang du zhag lon pa dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du btab pa las /
translated: If seeds are stored inside the boundary and are planted outside the boundary,

original: rtsa ba dang / myu gu dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa skyes pa gang yin pa de ni nang du zhag lon pa nyid ma yin zhing /🔽de der btsos na yang nang du btsos pa nyid ma yin pas de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang / myu gu dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa skyes pa gang yin pa de ni nang du zhag lon pa nyid ma yin zhing / de der btsos na yang nang du btsos pa nyid ma yin pas de la nyes pa med do //
translated: the roots, sprouts, and fruits that grow from them are not considered to be stored inside the boundary.🔽If the seeds are cooked inside the boundary, the cooked food is not considered to be cooked inside the boundary.

original: 'tshod par byed pa'i me mtshams kyi nang rol na 'dug pa nyid kyis bco bar bya ba'i rdzas mtshams kyi phyi rol na 'dug pa 'tshed par byed pa ni nang du btsos pa nyid ma yin pas de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'tshod par byed pa'i me mtshams kyi nang rol na 'dug pa nyid kyis bco bar bya ba'i rdzas mtshams kyi phyi rol na 'dug pa 'tshed par byed pa ni nang du btsos pa nyid ma yin pas de la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the fire for cooking is inside the boundary and the food to be cooked is outside the boundary.

original: me lce ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid yin pas mtshams kyi nang na 'bar ba'i me lce la bsreg pa ni nang du btsos pa nyid ma yin pas de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: me lce ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid yin pas mtshams kyi nang na 'bar ba'i me lce la bsreg pa ni nang du btsos pa nyid ma yin pas de la nyes pa med do //
translated: The flame is like the sky, so the flame burning inside the boundary is not the same as the flame inside the boundary.

original: mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa'i me lce las 'ga' zhig gis bong ba la sogs pa dag gis me phyir byung ba dang / rlung la sogs pa'i dbang gis me rang byung ba dag ni mtshams kyi nang gi de'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa'i me lce las 'ga' zhig gis bong ba la sogs pa dag gis me phyir byung ba dang / rlung la sogs pa'i dbang gis me rang byung ba dag ni mtshams kyi nang gi de'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: If someone uses a clod of earth or something else to extinguish the fire outside the boundary, or if the fire arises by itself due to the power of wind and so on, that fire is not the same as the fire inside the boundary,

original: sa der gtogs pa nyid kyang ma yin pas me de dag gis btsos pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sa der gtogs pa nyid kyang ma yin pas me de dag gis btsos pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: nor does it belong to that level. Therefore there is no fault in cooking with that fire.

original: gzhan gnas pa nyid ni gzhan gyi gnas nyid ma yin pas gnas gcig na khyim pa dang dge slong gnyi ga gnas na de dge slong gi gnas nyid ma yin pas der zhag lon ba dang btsos pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gnas pa nyid ni gzhan gyi gnas nyid ma yin pas gnas gcig na khyim pa dang dge slong gnyi ga gnas na de dge slong gi gnas nyid ma yin pas der zhag lon ba dang btsos pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If a layperson and a monk both live in the same house, since the house is not the same as the monk's dwelling, there is no fault in staying there for a night or cooking there.

original: gnas gcig na khyim pa dang dge slong gnyi ga gnas pa las khyim pa med kyang khyim pa'i rdzas yod na dge slong gi gnas nyid ma yin bas der zhag lon pa dang btsos pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gnas gcig na khyim pa dang dge slong gnyi ga gnas pa las khyim pa med kyang khyim pa'i rdzas yod na dge slong gi gnas nyid ma yin bas der zhag lon pa dang btsos pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If both householders and monks live in one place, but there are no householders, then if there are householders' goods, it is not a monk's dwelling place. Therefore, there is no fault in staying there for a night or cooking there.

original: dge tshul rnams kyi gang zag gi gnas dang / dge tshul gyi tshogs spyir dbang ba'i gnas de ni dge slong gi gnas nyid ma yin pas der zhag lon pa dang btsos pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge tshul rnams kyi gang zag gi gnas dang / dge tshul gyi tshogs spyir dbang ba'i gnas de ni dge slong gi gnas nyid ma yin pas der zhag lon pa dang btsos pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If it is a dwelling place of novices, or a place generally owned by the community of novices, it is not a monk's dwelling place. Therefore, there is no fault in staying there for a night or cooking there.

original: lag nyar blangs pa dang nang du zhag lon pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa de dag mu ge byung ba la sogs pa'i dus su snga dro'i zas snga dro de la lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa snga dro de nyid la za ba dang /
analyzed: lag nyar blangs pa dang nang du zhag lon pa dang / nang du btsos pa dang / dge slong gis btsos pa de dag mu ge byung ba la sogs pa'i dus su snga dro'i zas snga dro de la lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa snga dro de nyid la za ba dang /
translated: Taking possession, staying overnight, cooking inside, and cooking by a monk. Those who take possession, stay overnight, cook inside, or are cooked by a monk, in times of famine and so on, eat in the morning the food taken possession of in the morning and so on.

original: phyi dro'i zas phyi dro de la lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa yang phyi dro de nyed thun tshod kyi mtha' tshud chad du za ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: phyi dro'i zas phyi dro de la lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa yang phyi dro de nyed thun tshod kyi mtha' tshud chad du za ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: If one takes food in the afternoon, one should eat it before sunset.

original: kha dri ma can gyis bza' ba dang btung ba dag zos sam 'thungs na nyes byas su gsungs pas /
analyzed: kha dri ma can gyis bza' ba dang btung ba dag zos sam 'thungs na nyes byas su gsungs pas /
translated: If one eats or drinks with a dirty mouth, one commits an offense.

original: kha bkru ste bza' @155a * //
analyzed: kha bkru ste bza' @155a * //
translated: One should eat and drink with a clean mouth.

original: bar bya ba rung ba dag zos pa dang 'thungs pa la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bar bya ba rung ba dag zos pa dang 'thungs pa la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one eats or drinks what is suitable after having cleaned one’s mouth.🔽How does one clean one’s mouth?

original: ci tsam gyis na kha dag pa yin zhe na kha'i phyi rol mchu gnyis ni lci ba 'am sas kun nas bkrus te chus bshal na dag pa yin no //🔽kha'i nang na chu mkhur ba do 'am gsum gyis bshal na dag pa yin no //
analyzed: ci tsam gyis na kha dag pa yin zhe na kha'i phyi rol mchu gnyis ni lci ba 'am sas kun nas bkrus te chus bshal na dag pa yin no // kha'i nang na chu mkhur ba do 'am gsum gyis bshal na dag pa yin no //
translated: If one’s lips are smeared with grease, one should clean them with ashes or earth and then rinse with water.🔽If one’s mouth is smeared with grease, one should rinse it with water two or three times.

original: lhung bzed ni bsam pa dag pas lan gnyis sam gsum bkru bshal byas na sgra mi snyan kyang dag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: lhung bzed ni bsam pa dag pas lan gnyis sam gsum bkru bshal byas na sgra mi snyan kyang dag pa nyid yin no //
translated: If one’s bowl is smeared with grease, one should wash it two or three times with water that is free of living organisms.

original: lhur bzed kyi rtsi langs pas 'bags pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: lhur bzed kyi rtsi langs pas 'bags pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one’s bowl is smeared with the grease of a resin.

analyzed: lhung bzed 'dag rdzas sam lci ba 'am sa gang yang rung bas lan gsum bkrus pa la snum pa nyid yod pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If the bowl is dirty, it should be washed three times with a cleaning agent, cow dung, or clay, whichever is appropriate. There is no offense if the bowl is oily.

original: lhung bzed dag par byas pa la snum bag gam tshon rtsi'i bag langs par gyur na steng gi snum bag la sogs pa bsal te spyad pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: lhung bzed dag par byas pa la snum bag gam tshon rtsi'i bag langs par gyur na steng gi snum bag la sogs pa bsal te spyad pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If the bowl is clean but has an oily film or discoloration, there is no offense in using it after removing the oily film or discoloration.

analyzed: lhung bzed kyi phyogs zas la sogs pas 'bags pa'i phyogs de nyi tshe bkrus nas spyad pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: If a part of the bowl is defiled by food, there is no offense in using the bowl after washing that part.

original: lan tshva tsha chur gyur pa dang / 'gyur byed 'gyur byed kyi chur gyur pa dang / rnyog pa rnyog chur gyur pa de nad pa dang / nad pa ma yin pa thams cad la dus ma yin par byin len byas na ma btsags par 'thungs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: lan tshva tsha chur gyur pa dang / 'gyur byed 'gyur byed kyi chur gyur pa dang / rnyog pa rnyog chur gyur pa de nad pa dang / nad pa ma yin pa thams cad la dus ma yin par byin len byas na ma btsags par 'thungs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: If salt water, sour water, or muddy water is not available, there is no offense in drinking water that has not been strained, whether one is sick or not, if one does so without taking the full ritual procedure.

translated: The held in hand and the received in the mouth are not the same as the held in hand and the received in the mouth of the person who is the strength of the receiver.🔽The held in hand and the received

translated: The fully ordained nun who possesses the supreme vow, the fully ordained nun who possesses the supreme vow, the novice nun who has received the precepts, the novice monk who has received the precepts, the male and female lay practitioner who have received the precepts, and the male and female lay practitioner who have not received the precepts.

translated: For example, what is stored, accepted, and held by a householder is not held by a fully ordained monk or nun,

original: bslab pa byin pa'i yang ma yin /
analyzed: bslab pa byin pa'i yang ma yin /

translated: The fully ordained monks and nuns may not keep the food that belongs to the novice monk and the novice nun in their possession.🔽The fully ordained monks and nuns may not store the food that belongs to the novice monk and the novice nun.🔽The fully ordained monks and nuns may not accept the food that belongs to the novice monk and the novice nun.

analyzed: dge tshul ma dang dge slong mal yang de bzhin no //

translated: If one does not accept it, but eats it after it has been given back by another, there is no fault.
