translated: If a monk accepts rice and so on from farmers in order to pay a tax in kind, and then stores it in a granary and so on, if the conditions for spoilage occur,

original: pa'am bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag med dam /
analyzed: pa'am bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag med dam /
translated: or if there are no novices or post-ulants,

original: 'drub par byad pa gzhan @156a * //
analyzed: 'drub par byad pa gzhan @156a * //
translated: or if there is no other way to cook it,

original: dag med pa la sogs pa'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na de de dag la dge slong gis reg pa la lag nyar blangs ba'i nyes pa med do //🔽bza' bar byab bkal ba'i shing rta la yang gal te rkyen de lta bu dag yod par gyur na de'i tshe kha lo ba'i stan 'ba' zhig ma gtogs pa nyid kyi shing rta la dge slong gis reg pa la lag nyar blangs pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dag med pa la sogs pa'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na de de dag la dge slong gis reg pa la lag nyar blangs ba'i nyes pa med do // bza' bar byab bkal ba'i shing rta la yang gal te rkyen de lta bu dag yod par gyur na de'i tshe kha lo ba'i stan 'ba' zhig ma gtogs pa nyid kyi shing rta la dge slong gis reg pa la lag nyar blangs pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If there are such conditions as these, then there is no offense for the monk to touch them.🔽If there are such conditions as these, then there is no offense for the monk to touch the cart, except for the driver’s seat.

original: gal te rkyen de lta bu dag yod na 'bras la sogs pas gang ba'i shing rta'i kha lo ba'i stan ma gtogs pa nyid kyi shing rta la dge slong gis reg pa la yang lag nyar blangs pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gal te rkyen de lta bu dag yod na 'bras la sogs pas gang ba'i shing rta'i kha lo ba'i stan ma gtogs pa nyid kyi shing rta la dge slong gis reg pa la yang lag nyar blangs pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If there are such conditions as these, then there is no offense for the monk to touch the cart, except for the driver’s seat.

original: rkyen de lta bu yod par gyur na bza' bar bya ba bcu ga pa'i gru dang / 'bras la sogs pas gang ba'i gru dang / grur nad pa dang / min pa zhugs pa la yang ru skya ma gtogs pa nyid kyi gru la dge slong gis reg pa lag nyar blangs pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rkyen de lta bu yod par gyur na bza' bar bya ba bcu ga pa'i gru dang / 'bras la sogs pas gang ba'i gru dang / grur nad pa dang / min pa zhugs pa la yang ru skya ma gtogs pa nyid kyi gru la dge slong gis reg pa lag nyar blangs pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: If such a condition exists, there is no offense for a monk to touch and take hold of a boat filled with food to be eaten, a boat filled with rice and so on, a boat with sick people, or a boat with non-humans, except for a boat with thieves.

original: du skya 'dzin pa'i stan yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: du skya 'dzin pa'i stan yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the seat of the boatman.

original: dge 'dun dang gang zag gis bza' ba la sogs pa sman dag thab tu skol ba'i tshe lud na /
analyzed: dge 'dun dang gang zag gis bza' ba la sogs pa sman dag thab tu skol ba'i tshe lud na /
translated: When the Saṅgha or an individual is cooking medicine such as food, if it boils over,

original: dang por shing dbri ba dang / me bsad pa dang / gos kyi thu ba la sogs pas rlung g-yab pas 'bad par bya ba'i thabs kyis zhi bar ma gyur na de'i tsho dge slong gis bskyam pa dang / dbyung ba dang / gzar bu'i las dang /🔽dbog pa dag la lag nyar blangs pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dang por shing dbri ba dang / me bsad pa dang / gos kyi thu ba la sogs pas rlung g-yab pas 'bad par bya ba'i thabs kyis zhi bar ma gyur na de'i tsho dge slong gis bskyam pa dang / dbyung ba dang / gzar bu'i las dang /🔽dbog pa dag la lag nyar blangs pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: first one should stir it, extinguish the fire, and fan it with the corner of one's robe and so on. If it does not subside by these means, then at that time there is no offense for a monk to stir it, remove it, use a ladle,🔽and pour it.

original: dge slong chu klung rgal ba'i phyir ram dam lam brgyags khyer ba'i khur tsa ba snyag pa'i phyir chog ma 'byor tam /
analyzed: dge slong chu klung rgal ba'i phyir ram dam lam brgyags khyer ba'i khur tsa ba snyag pa'i phyir chog ma 'byor tam /
translated: If a monk is unable to carry provisions for a journey because he is crossing a river or carrying a heavy load,

original: lam brgyags gzhan med na lag nyar blangs ba'i lam brgyags bzar rung ste de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: lam brgyags gzhan med na lag nyar blangs ba'i lam brgyags bzar rung ste de la nyes pa med do //
translated: if he has no other provisions, he may eat the provisions he is carrying. There is no offense.

original: dge slong lam du zhugs pas lam brgyags khyer ba'i khur tsa ba med na sbyin bdag sgro bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong lam du zhugs pas lam brgyags khyer ba'i khur tsa ba med na sbyin bdag sgro bar bya'o //
translated: If a monk who has set out on a journey has no provisions for the road, he should ask the donor to carry them.

original: khyer ba med na rang gis bskur ro //
analyzed: khyer ba med na rang gis bskur ro //
translated: If the donor is unable to carry them, the monk should carry them himself.

original: rang gis khyer ba'i lam brgyags de nyid las gzhan la sbyin bas lam brgyags brje zhing bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gis khyer ba'i lam brgyags de nyid las gzhan la sbyin bas lam brgyags brje zhing bza' bar bya'o //
translated: He may eat the provisions he is carrying, but he should not exchange them for other provisions.

original: de yang ma grub na de bza' bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de yang ma grub na de bza' bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: If that is not possible, he may eat them.

original: byin len stobs pa med na byin len ma byas pa rang gis khyer ba de 'am /
analyzed: byin len stobs pa med na byin len ma byas pa rang gis khyer ba de 'am /
translated: If he is unable to carry them because he has no one to receive the offering, he may eat the provisions he is carrying without receiving them.

original: gzhan yang bza' bar bya ba nying yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bza' bar bya ba nying yin te /
translated: Or he may eat other provisions.

original: rang gis khyer pa dang / byin len ma byas pa de gnyis bza' ba yang dge slong gang gis sngar nyin gcig zan bcad pa byas pa des bza' bar bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang gis khyer pa dang / byin len ma byas pa de gnyis bza' ba yang dge slong gang gis sngar nyin gcig zan bcad pa byas pa des bza' bar bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: Also, if a monk has fasted for one day, he may eat both that which he has carried and that which he has not received.

original: de bza' ba'i tshad ni nyi ma dang po la spang gang do //
analyzed: de bza' ba'i tshad ni nyi ma dang po la spang gang do //
translated: The measure of that which he may eat is one measure on the first day,

original: nyi ma gnyis pa la spar ba do'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis pa la spar ba do'o //
translated: one and a half measures on the second day,

original: nyi ma gsum pa la ni ji tsam gyis chog pa bza' bar bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: nyi ma gsum pa la ni ji tsam gyis chog pa bza' bar bya ba nyid de /
translated: and as much as he likes on the third day.

original: de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in that.

original: @156b dge slong zan med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid yin na shing thog dang / rtsa ba rung bar ma byas pa dang / byin len ma byas pa dang / lag nyar blangs pa dag kyang dus ma yin par yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: @156b dge slong zan med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid yin na shing thog dang / rtsa ba rung bar ma byas pa dang / byin len ma byas pa dang / lag nyar blangs pa dag kyang dus ma yin par yang bza' bar bya ba nyid yin la /
translated: If a monk is very hungry and has not eaten, then even if the fruit or root has not been made suitable, has not been received, or has been held in the hand, he may eat it even at an inappropriate time.

original: rang gis kyang btogs pa nyid dang / dbyung ba nyid dang / btso ba bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyang byar rung la /
analyzed: rang gis kyang btogs pa nyid dang / dbyung ba nyid dang / btso ba bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyang byar rung la /
translated: It is suitable for him to pick it himself, to cook it himself, and to prepare it himself.

original: gzhan byed du gzhug tu yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan byed du gzhug tu yang rung ste /
translated: It is also suitable for him to have another do it.

original: de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense in these cases.

original: dge slong zan med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid des byin len ma bstabs pa dang / rung bar ma byas pa dang / dus ma yin bar za ba la sogs pa rung bar bya ba dag la rtsom 'dod pa na byang gi sgra mi snyan na grags pa'i yid la byed pa byas pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong zan med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid des byin len ma bstabs pa dang / rung bar ma byas pa dang / dus ma yin bar za ba la sogs pa rung bar bya ba dag la rtsom 'dod pa na byang gi sgra mi snyan na grags pa'i yid la byed pa byas pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: When a monk is very hungry because he has not eaten for a long time, and he wishes to begin eating before the mealtime, without having received the food, without having made it permissible, and so on, then if he has the intention to eat as is customary in the northern Kuru region, there is no offense.

original: 'dab ma dag snod nyid du spyod pa na byin len ma byas pa nyid la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'dab ma dag snod nyid du spyod pa na byin len ma byas pa nyid la nyes pa med do //
translated: When he uses leaves as a vessel, there is no offense if he has not received them.

original: snod nyid du spyod pa 'di la 'dab ma dag shing ljon pa la sogs pa dag las brdas pa dang ma brdas pa dag ni byin len bstabs pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par med do //
analyzed: snod nyid du spyod pa 'di la 'dab ma dag shing ljon pa la sogs pa dag las brdas pa dang ma brdas pa dag ni byin len bstabs pa nyid kyi phyir khyad par med do //
translated: In this case, using leaves as a vessel, whether they have been cut or not, there is no difference, because they are already received.

original: 'dab ma brngas pa dag yod na de nyid spyad do //
analyzed: 'dab ma brngas pa dag yod na de nyid spyad do //
translated: If there are cut leaves, he should use them.

original: brdas pa gzhan med na ma brngas pa dag kyang spyad de de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: brdas pa gzhan med na ma brngas pa dag kyang spyad de de la nyes pa med do //
translated: If there are no cut leaves, he may use uncut leaves. There is no offense in this case.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginner, or is insane, or is deranged, or is overwhelmed by pain.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gsog 'jog gi ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gsog 'jog gi ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The training rule on storing is finished.

original: bum pa la sogs pa snum can dag snum med par bya ba'i phyir chu'i rdzing bu zab mo'i nang du nya 'am dus sbal lam sbal pa 'am chu srin byis pa gsod dam nya khyi ba dag gis ma lus par bldags kyi bar du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa snum can dag snum med par bya ba'i phyir chu'i rdzing bu zab mo'i nang du nya 'am dus sbal lam sbal pa 'am chu srin byis pa gsod dam nya khyi ba dag gis ma lus par bldags kyi bar du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The monk should place the oily objects such as the pot in a deep pond until the fish, turtles, frogs, alligators, or otters have completely devoured them.

original: bum pa la sogs pa snum can dag yang na med bsregs pas kyang snum med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa snum can dag yang na med bsregs pas kyang snum med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or the oily objects such as the pot can be made free of oil by burning them.

original: de ltar ma lus par bldags pa dang bsregs pa dag 'dag rdzas sam lci bas bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma lus par bldags pa dang bsregs pa dag 'dag rdzas sam lci bas bkru bar bya'o //
translated: When they have been completely devoured or burned, he should wash them with a substance or with clay.

original: chu rnyog pa can ni gzhan gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung gi bar rdu dang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu rnyog pa can ni gzhan gyi gzugs brnyan 'byung gi bar rdu dang bar bya'o //
translated: One should make the water clear by straining it through a cloth until the reflection of one’s face in the water is clear.

original: ka ta ka'i 'bras bus chu shin tu dang bar 'gyur ro //🔽'gyur byed kyis kyang chu shin tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ka ta ka'i 'bras bus chu shin tu dang bar 'gyur ro // 'gyur byed kyis kyang chu shin tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Water becomes very clear by the addition of the fruit of the kataka tree.🔽Water becomes very clear by the addition of a purifying agent.

original: zan gyis kyang chu shin tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zan gyis kyang chu shin tu dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Water becomes very clear by the addition of rice.

original: zan de mi 'jig par bya ba'i phyir snum gyis bsku'o //
analyzed: zan de mi 'jig par bya ba'i phyir snum gyis bsku'o //
translated: In order to prevent the rice from spoiling, it should be anointed with oil.

original: lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ltos pa med par btang ba de bza' ba'i phyir blang bar mi bya'o //🔽lag nyar @157a * //
analyzed: lag nyar blangs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ltos pa med par btang ba de bza' ba'i phyir blang bar mi bya'o // lag nyar @157a * //
translated: One should not take back into one’s possession things such as a staff that one has given away without reserve.

original: blangs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ltos pa med par btang ba de shes bzhin du phyir blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: blangs pa la sogs pa'i rdzas ltos pa med par btang ba de shes bzhin du phyir blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not take back into one’s possession things such as a staff that one has given away without reserve, even if one has forgotten that one has given them away.

original: dge slong gi lam brgyags khyer ba'i khur tsa ba med na sbyin bdag gis de bskur bar spro bar bya'o //🔽sbyin bdag spro bar bya bar ma grub ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi lam brgyags khyer ba'i khur tsa ba med na sbyin bdag gis de bskur bar spro bar bya'o // sbyin bdag spro bar bya bar ma grub ste /
translated: If a monk does not have a companion to carry his provisions on the road, the donor should be asked to send them.

original: khyer ba med na rang gis lam brgyags bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyer ba med na rang gis lam brgyags bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If the donor is not available, one should carry one’s own provisions on the road.

original: rang gis khyer ba'i lam brgyags de nyid las gzhan la sbyin pas lam brgyags brje zhing gzhan bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gis khyer ba'i lam brgyags de nyid las gzhan la sbyin pas lam brgyags brje zhing gzhan bza' bar bya'o //
translated: The monk should eat the food of the road, that is, the food that he carries with him, and he should give the rest to another monk.

original: dge slong zan med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid na byin len ma bstabs pa dang / dus ma yin par za ba la sogs pa rung bar bya bdag la rtsom 'dod pa na byang gi sgra mi snyan na grags pa'i yid la byed pa bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong zan med pa shin tu bkres pa nyid na byin len ma bstabs pa dang / dus ma yin par za ba la sogs pa rung bar bya bdag la rtsom 'dod pa na byang gi sgra mi snyan na grags pa'i yid la byed pa bya'o //
translated: When a monk is very hungry, and he is not offered food, and he wishes to eat at the wrong time, he should think of the people of Uttarakuru.

original: lag pa bsnyal ba dang 'dab ma dag yod na skyogs kyis skom mi btung go //
analyzed: lag pa bsnyal ba dang 'dab ma dag yod na skyogs kyis skom mi btung go //
translated: If he has a bowl and leaves, he should not drink water with the bowl.

original: med na ma bsgribs par mi bya'o //🔽skyogs de chu dang bcas pa nyid dam /
analyzed: med na ma bsgribs par mi bya'o // skyogs de chu dang bcas pa nyid dam /
translated: If he does not have a bowl, he should not drink water without a bowl.🔽He should not leave the bowl with water in it,

original: chu med pa nyid na yang kham cad pa nyid du mi gzhag go //
analyzed: chu med pa nyid na yang kham cad pa nyid du mi gzhag go //
translated: or without water in it, upside down.

original: de'i kha gab ni rnam pa gsum ste /🔽shing las byas pa dang / rdo las byas pa dang / sa las byas pa ste de bcang ngo //🔽skyogs gzhi shing las byas pa'am /
analyzed: de'i kha gab ni rnam pa gsum ste / shing las byas pa dang / rdo las byas pa dang / sa las byas pa ste de bcang ngo // skyogs gzhi shing las byas pa'am /
translated: He should carry a bowl-cover of three types:🔽made of wood, stone, or clay.

original: rdo las byas pa bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo las byas pa bcang bar bya'o //
translated: He should carry a bowl-support made of wood or stone.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.

original: gsog 'jog gi ltung byed de sum cu brgyad pa bshad zin to /🔽// / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
analyzed: gsog 'jog gi ltung byed de sum cu brgyad pa bshad zin to / // / so sor thar pa'i mdo rgya cher 'grel pa 'dul ba kun las btus pa /
translated: This was the explanation of the thirty-eighth downfall: amassing and storing.🔽The Vinaya Verses:

original: bam po nyi shu dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu dgu pa /
translated: The Vinaya Compendium:

original: byin len ma byas bar za ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang / gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: byin len ma byas bar za ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang / gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The introduction to the downfall of eating without having received the food in one’s hands is twofold: in terms of the proscriptions and in terms of the permissions.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //
translated: The introduction in terms of the proscriptions: The Bhagavān Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: tshe dang ldan pa nag po chen po ni thams cad dur khrod pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa nag po chen po ni thams cad dur khrod pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The venerable Mahākāśyapa was always in the charnel ground.

original: de'i lhung bzed kyang dur khrod pa yin /🔽chos gos kyang dur khrod pa yin /
analyzed: de'i lhung bzed kyang dur khrod pa yin / chos gos kyang dur khrod pa yin /
translated: His alms bowl was from the charnel ground.🔽His Dharma robes were from the charnel ground.

original: bsod snyoms kyang dur khrod pa yin /
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyang dur khrod pa yin /
translated: His alms were from the charnel ground.

original: gnas mal yang dur khrod pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas mal yang dur khrod pa yin te /
translated: His bedding and seat were from the charnel ground.

original: gang gi tshe skye bo phal po che la mi ngas byung ba de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa nag po chen po tsho ba dang / pags pa dang / sha dang khrag rgyas par gyur cing de yang dang yang du grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug par mi byed la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skye bo phal po che la mi ngas byung ba de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa nag po chen po tsho ba dang / pags pa dang / sha dang khrag rgyas par gyur cing de yang dang yang du grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug par mi byed la /
translated: When many people had dysentery, the venerable Mahākāśyapa’s flesh, skin, blood, and strength increased, and he did not enter the village for alms again and again.

original: gang gi che skye bo phal che la mi ngas ma byung ba de'i cho na cho dang ldan pa nag po chen po ring pa dang nyam chung pa dang skem pa dang skam pa dang / @157b lus ma thob par gyur cing /
analyzed: gang gi che skye bo phal che la mi ngas ma byung ba de'i cho na cho dang ldan pa nag po chen po ring pa dang nyam chung pa dang skem pa dang skam pa dang / @157b lus ma thob par gyur cing /
translated: When many people did not have dysentery, the venerable Mahākāśyapa became tall, weak, thin, emaciated, and his body became unattractive.

original: de yang dang yang du grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: de yang dang yang du grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug par byed de /
translated: He entered the village for alms again and again.

original: sgo bas de mtshan mar bzung nas 'phags pa nag po chen po 'di sha mi za 'am snyam shing /
analyzed: sgo bas de mtshan mar bzung nas 'phags pa nag po chen po 'di sha mi za 'am snyam shing /
translated: The gatekeeper noticed this and thought, “Is the noble Mahākāśyapa not eating meat?”

original: thams cad du yang 'phags pa nag po chen po mi sha za 'o zhes sgra grags so //
analyzed: thams cad du yang 'phags pa nag po chen po mi sha za 'o zhes sgra grags so //
translated: Everywhere the rumor spread, “The noble Mahākāśyapa eats human flesh.”

original: mnyan yod na bram ze zhig 'dug pa des /
analyzed: mnyan yod na bram ze zhig 'dug pa des /
translated: In Śrāvastī there was a brahmin🔽who had a daughter

original: rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas /
analyzed: rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas /
translated: He took a wife of equal caste

original: de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: and he played with her,

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: had fun, and enjoyed himself.

original: de'i bu mo zhig byung nas bsring zhing bskyed de chen mor gyur to //
analyzed: de'i bu mo zhig byung nas bsring zhing bskyed de chen mor gyur to //
translated: A daughter was born to them, and they raised her and she grew up.

original: dus gzhan zhig na bram ze de dus la bab nas nye du rnams kyis gos sngon po dang / ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po dag gis khyogs spyil brgyan nas dur khrod du khyer te bsregs shing dod nas /
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na bram ze de dus la bab nas nye du rnams kyis gos sngon po dang / ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po dag gis khyogs spyil brgyan nas dur khrod du khyer te bsregs shing dod nas /
translated: Later, when the brahmin’s time had come, his relatives decorated a bier with blue, yellow, red, and white cloth and carried him to the charnel ground, where they burned him.

original: de'i chung ma dang bu mo gnyis mtha' gcig tu dong ste bsdad pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa nag po chen po de'i gdong du lta zhing sdod pa mthong nas bu mos smras pa /
analyzed: de'i chung ma dang bu mo gnyis mtha' gcig tu dong ste bsdad pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa nag po chen po de'i gdong du lta zhing sdod pa mthong nas bu mos smras pa /
translated: His wife and daughter went to one side and sat down, and when the daughter saw that the venerable Mahākāśyapa was looking at her face, she said,

original: yum 'phags pa nag po chen po 'di bya rog mo zhar ma bzhin du nges par rtog cing sdod do zhes ngag gi las rtsub po yang smras par gyur to //
analyzed: yum 'phags pa nag po chen po 'di bya rog mo zhar ma bzhin du nges par rtog cing sdod do zhes ngag gi las rtsub po yang smras par gyur to //
translated: “Mother, this noble Mahākāśyapa is staring at me like a crow.” She spoke these harsh words.

original: mnyan yod na bram ze'i khye'u dag gis 'phags pa nag po chen po mi sha za'o zhes thos nas de dag gis de bgam pa'i phyir de'i cho gcig shi ba'i cha lugs su byas nas yud dang 'bru mar gyis bskus te khyogs spyil du bzhag nas mnyan yod
analyzed: mnyan yod na bram ze'i khye'u dag gis 'phags pa nag po chen po mi sha za'o zhes thos nas de dag gis de bgam pa'i phyir de'i cho gcig shi ba'i cha lugs su byas nas yud dang 'bru mar gyis bskus te khyogs spyil du bzhag nas mnyan yod
translated: In Śrāvastī, some young brahmins heard that the noble Mahākāla ate human flesh. In order to test him, they made a corpse in the attire of a dead person, anointed it with oil, placed it on a litter, and set out from Śrāvastī.

original: nas phyir dbyung bar brtsams pa dang / cho dang ldan pa nag po chen po yang mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs te /
analyzed: nas phyir dbyung bar brtsams pa dang / cho dang ldan pa nag po chen po yang mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs te /
translated: They began to carry it out, and the noble Mahākāla also entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: des de mthong nas bsams pa /
analyzed: des de mthong nas bsams pa /
translated: He saw it and thought,

original: bdag dgang dka' ba 'di'i don du grong du bsod snyoms la zhugs te /
analyzed: bdag dgang dka' ba 'di'i don du grong du bsod snyoms la zhugs te /
translated: What is the use of entering the village for alms for the sake of this difficult-to-fill body?

original: ci rung phyir log la zas lnga po 'di dag nyid bza' bar bya'o snyam nas de phyir log go //
analyzed: ci rung phyir log la zas lnga po 'di dag nyid bza' bar bya'o snyam nas de phyir log go //
translated: I will return and eat these five foods. He turned back.

original: de dag gis de dur khrod du bor te mtha' gcig tu dong nas tshang tshing dang lhab lhub dag gi nang du mgo bcum ste bsdad do //
analyzed: de dag gis de dur khrod du bor te mtha' gcig tu dong nas tshang tshing dang lhab lhub dag gi nang du mgo bcum ste bsdad do //
translated: They threw it in the charnel ground, went to one side, and sat with their heads lowered among the thickets and ornaments.

original: der lba zhig gis bgrod par brtsams pa dang / cho dang ldan pa nag po chen pos bsams pa /
analyzed: der lba zhig gis bgrod par brtsams pa dang / cho dang ldan pa nag po chen pos bsams pa /
translated: Then a leper started to go there, and the noble Mahākāla thought,

original: lbas zas lnga po dag zos shing bdag gi zan chang par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam du rig nas des myur ba myur bar 'gro bar brtsams pa dang / bram ze'i khye'u de skrag ste /
analyzed: lbas zas lnga po dag zos shing bdag gi zan chang par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam du rig nas des myur ba myur bar 'gro bar brtsams pa dang / bram ze'i khye'u de skrag ste /
translated: “If the leper eats the five foods and becomes my equal, that would not be right.” Knowing this, he started to go there quickly, and the young brahmin became frightened.

original: kho bo zos zhes du bar brtsams so //
analyzed: kho bo zos zhes du bar brtsams so //
translated: He started to cry, “I’m going to be eaten!”

original: bram ze'i khye'u de dag dbyug pa thogs te myur ba myur bar dong nas /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u de dag dbyug pa thogs te myur ba myur bar dong nas /
translated: The young brahmins took up sticks and went there quickly.

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'phags pa drang srong gi rgyal mtshan thogs shing @158a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa drang srong gi rgyal mtshan thogs shing @158a * //
translated: “Noble one, you are holding the banner of a sage,

original: sdig pa'i las rtsub mo 'di dang 'di lta bu lhag par spyod dam /
analyzed: sdig pa'i las rtsub mo 'di dang 'di lta bu lhag par spyod dam /
translated: but you are especially practicing this kind of evil, rough action.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: ji byas / mi sha za'o //
analyzed: ji byas / mi sha za'o //
translated: “What? I eat human flesh.”

original: bzhin bzangs dag khyod kyis kho bo mtshon thogs te sha gcod cing za ba mthong ngam de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs dag khyod kyis kho bo mtshon thogs te sha gcod cing za ba mthong ngam de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “Good sirs, did you see me cutting up flesh with a weapon and eating it?” They said,

original: 'o na ci'i slad du myur ba kho nar byon /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i slad du myur ba kho nar byon /
translated: “Then why did you come so quickly?”

original: bzhin bzangs dag kho bo la blo skyes te /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs dag kho bo la blo skyes te /
translated: “Good people, I thought,

original: lba 'dis zas lnga po dag zos shing bdag gi zan chad par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam du rig nas myur ba myur bar 'ongs so //
analyzed: lba 'dis zas lnga po dag zos shing bdag gi zan chad par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam du rig nas myur ba myur bar 'ongs so //
translated: ‘It’s not right for this leper to eat the five foods and for me to go hungry.’ So I came here as quickly as I could.”

original: 'phags pa zas lnga po dag gsol lam /
analyzed: 'phags pa zas lnga po dag gsol lam /
translated: “Noble one, did you eat the five foods?”

original: mi sha gsol ni ma 'tshal gyi /
analyzed: mi sha gsol ni ma 'tshal gyi /
translated: “I did not eat human flesh.🔽But it is well known everywhere that the noble Mahākāla eats human flesh.”

original: 'di ltar thams cad du 'phags pa nag po chen po mi sha gsol zhes ni grags par gyur to zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad du 'phags pa nag po chen po mi sha gsol zhes ni grags par gyur to zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: The Blessed One thought,

original: nyes dmigs gang cung zad ci byung ba de ni dge slong dag byin len byed du ma bcug par za ba las gyur pa yin pas de lta bas na dge slong rnams kyis byin len byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: nyes dmigs gang cung zad ci byung ba de ni dge slong dag byin len byed du ma bcug par za ba las gyur pa yin pas de lta bas na dge slong rnams kyis byin len byed du bcug ste /
translated: “Whatever problems arise are due to monks eating without having received the food. Therefore monks should eat only after having received the food.

original: za na de nyid dang nga por 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: za na de nyid dang nga por 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: If they eat, they commit an offense.”

original: de lta bas na dge slod rnams la byin len byed du bcug ste bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slod rnams la byin len byed du bcug ste bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the monks should be made to receive the gift and then eat it.

original: byin len ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: byin len ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of receiving the gift:

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: lus kyis lus su dang / lus dang 'brel pas lus su dang / lus kyis lus dang 'brel pa dang / lus dang 'brel pas lus dang 'brel par dang / gzhag pa'i chog nyid ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis lus su dang / lus dang 'brel pas lus su dang / lus kyis lus dang 'brel pa dang / lus dang 'brel pas lus dang 'brel par dang / gzhag pa'i chog nyid ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The body receiving the gift from the body, the body receiving the gift from what is connected to the body, the body receiving the gift from the body and what is connected to the body, what is connected to the body receiving the gift from what is connected to the body, and the mere act of placing the food is the fifth.

original: rung ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rung ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of what is suitable:

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: mes rung ba dang / mtshon gyis rung ba dang / sen mos rung ba dang / rnyings pas rung ba dang / ne tsos rma phung pas rung ba dang lda pa'o //
analyzed: mes rung ba dang / mtshon gyis rung ba dang / sen mos rung ba dang / rnyings pas rung ba dang / ne tsos rma phung pas rung ba dang lda pa'o //
translated: What is suitable by fire, what is suitable by weapon, what is suitable by nail, what is suitable by age, and what is suitable by the parrot’s wound is the fifth.

original: gzhan yang rung ba rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ba rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five other kinds of what is suitable:

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: phyung ba dang / gshegs pa dang bcad pa dang / phug pa dang / sa bon gyi chos nyid med pa nyid ni rnam pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: phyung ba dang / gshegs pa dang bcad pa dang / phug pa dang / sa bon gyi chos nyid med pa nyid ni rnam pa lnga pa'o //
translated: What is suitable by being taken out, what is suitable by being taken away, what is suitable by being cut, what is suitable by being pierced, and the absence of the nature of a seed is the fifth.

original: lag pa bkan par byin len rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: lag pa bkan par byin len rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of receiving the gift with the arm extended:

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: man shel dang / khri dang khri'u dang / thu ba dang / lhung bzed kyi gzhi 'di nyid ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: man shel dang / khri dang khri'u dang / thu ba dang / lhung bzed kyi gzhi 'di nyid ni lnga pa'o //
translated: A crystal, a bed, a bench, a pillow, and a bowl rest.

original: mes rung bar bya ba ni phung por byas te /
analyzed: mes rung bar bya ba ni phung por byas te /
translated: The purification by fire is done by making a pile.

original: mes gnas gnyis sam gsum du reg par byas na thams cad du rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mes gnas gnyis sam gsum du reg par byas na thams cad du rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one touches it in two or three places with fire, it is purified everywhere.

original: mtshon dang sen mos ni re re nas so //
analyzed: mtshon dang sen mos ni re re nas so //
translated: With a knife or one’s nails, it is purified by each individual part.

original: khyim pa rnams mi snyoms par 'drim na dge tshul dag 'drim du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa rnams mi snyoms par 'drim na dge tshul dag 'drim du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: If the householders do not distribute evenly, the novices should be made to distribute.

original: de dag kyang mi snyoms na dge slong dag gis lag pa dag bsnyal te byin len byas nas brim par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi snyoms na dge slong dag gis lag pa dag bsnyal te byin len byas nas brim par bya'o //
translated: If they also do not distribute evenly, the monks should receive the alms by extending their hands and then distribute them.

original: 'on kyang ma @158b snyoms na brim par bya ba gces pa dang bar ma dang / tha ma dag so sor bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma @158b snyoms na brim par bya ba gces pa dang bar ma dang / tha ma dag so sor bya'o //
translated: If they still do not distribute evenly, the best, middling, and worst should be distributed separately.

original: 'drim par byed pa'i skal ba ni mkhan po dang / slob dpon nam /
analyzed: 'drim par byed pa'i skal ba ni mkhan po dang / slob dpon nam /
translated: The portion of the distributor is the portion of the preceptor, the teacher,

original: drung na 'dug pa dag gis 'drim du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: drung na 'dug pa dag gis 'drim du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: or the one who is sitting nearby.

original: stan las ma 'phags pas ci tsam nus pa de tsam dag byin len byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: stan las ma 'phags pas ci tsam nus pa de tsam dag byin len byed du gzhug go //
translated: Those who are able to do so without rising from their seats should be made to do so.

original: 'dril ba dag stan las ma 'phags pas len nus pa dag ni byin len byed du gzhug mi dgos la /
analyzed: 'dril ba dag stan las ma 'phags pas len nus pa dag ni byin len byed du gzhug mi dgos la /
translated: Those who are able to do so while remaining seated should not be made to do so.

original: mi nus pa dag ni yang byin len byed du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: mi nus pa dag ni yang byin len byed du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Those who are unable to do so should be made to do so.

original: khyim pa dag kyang 'drim du gzhug par bya zhing /
analyzed: khyim pa dag kyang 'drim du gzhug par bya zhing /
translated: The laity should also be made to do so.

original: dge slong gis dang por bzung zhing khyim pas phyis bzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis dang por bzung zhing khyim pas phyis bzung bar bya'o //
translated: The monks should take the first portion, and the laity should take the second portion.

original: dge slong dag las blangs pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi byin len ni de nyid lan no //
analyzed: dge slong dag las blangs pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi byin len ni de nyid lan no //
translated: The distribution of those that are taken from the monks is done by them.

original: khyim pa dag las blangs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni byin len byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: khyim pa dag las blangs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni byin len byed du gzhug go //
translated: The distribution of those that are taken from the laity is done by the laity.

original: dang po dge slong dag gis gtang bar bya zhing /🔽phyis khyim pa dag gis gtong bar bya ste /
analyzed: dang po dge slong dag gis gtang bar bya zhing / phyis khyim pa dag gis gtong bar bya ste /
translated: The monks should give the first portion.🔽The laity should give the second portion.

original: phyi de nyin par dge 'dun la brim par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi de nyin par dge 'dun la brim par bya'o //
translated: The next day, it should be distributed to the Saṅgha.

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag dge 'dun la zhun mar gyi bum pa la sogs pa dag da bul na blang par bya zhing /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag dge 'dun la zhun mar gyi bum pa la sogs pa dag da bul na blang par bya zhing /
translated: If faithful brahmins and householders offer the Saṅgha a pot of ghee, and so on, they should accept it.

original: blangs nas dge 'dun la brim par bya'o //
analyzed: blangs nas dge 'dun la brim par bya'o //
translated: Having accepted it, they should distribute it to the Saṅgha.

original: de dag gi chos gos dag snum par 'gyur ba ltan bar du rtsva dang lo ma dag bcug ste brim par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi chos gos dag snum par 'gyur ba ltan bar du rtsva dang lo ma dag bcug ste brim par bya'o //
translated: They should distribute it to the Saṅgha after inserting grass or leaves between the robes and the ghee.

original: de dag bzung ste 'gred ba na ngal bar gyur pa lta na gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag bzung ste 'gred ba na ngal bar gyur pa lta na gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If they are tired from carrying them, they should put them down.

original: gzhag pa na 'dril ba lta na 'og gzhi la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhag pa na 'dril ba lta na 'og gzhi la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If they are put down and get dirty, they should be put on a covering.

original: snod phul bdag kyang blang zhing chu'i rdzing bu za ba mo'i nang du zhag bdun nam brgyad gzhug par bya zhing /🔽gang gi tshe nya 'am rus sbal lam sbal pa 'am ma chu srin byis pa gsod dam /
analyzed: snod phul bdag kyang blang zhing chu'i rdzing bu za ba mo'i nang du zhag bdun nam brgyad gzhug par bya zhing / gang gi tshe nya 'am rus sbal lam sbal pa 'am ma chu srin byis pa gsod dam /
translated: They should accept the offered vessel and put it in a pond or a pool for seven or eight days.

original: nya khyi bdag gis ma lus par ldags par gyur ba de'i cho na rung ba'i khad par bcug ste spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: nya khyi bdag gis ma lus par ldags par gyur ba de'i cho na rung ba'i khad par bcug ste spyad par bya'o //
translated: When the fish, turtles, frogs, or young crocodiles have eaten all the flesh, they should put it in a suitable place and use it.

original: rnam pa lngas ni byin len byed du ma bcug par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas ni byin len byed du ma bcug par brjod par bya ste /
translated: “There are five ways of not having someone else do the receiving:

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol na 'dug pa dang / mi 'thob pa'i phyogs nas dang / glo nas dang / rgyab nas dang / lag pa khas phub pas byin len byed du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol na 'dug pa dang / mi 'thob pa'i phyogs nas dang / glo nas dang / rgyab nas dang / lag pa khas phub pas byin len byed du 'jug pa'o //
translated: If the other person is outside the boundary, in a direction where one cannot reach, or if one receives from the side or the back, or if one receives with one’s hand covered.

original: rnam pa ldas ni byin len byed du bcug par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa ldas ni byin len byed du bcug par brjod par bya ste /
translated: “There are five ways of having someone else do the receiving:

original: lda gang zhe na /
analyzed: lda gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: snga ma las bzlog pa dag gis so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis byin len byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: snga ma las bzlog pa dag gis so // bcom ldan 'das kyis byin len byed du bcug ste /
translated: The opposite of the above.

original: bza' bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bza' bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: “The Blessed One said, ‘You should eat after having someone else do the receiving.’

original: drug sde dag byin len byed du bcug pa dang / byin len byed du ma bcug pa yang za bar byed nas dge slong don nyung du dag bcom ldan 'das kyis byin len @159a * //
analyzed: drug sde dag byin len byed du bcug pa dang / byin len byed du ma bcug pa yang za bar byed nas dge slong don nyung du dag bcom ldan 'das kyis byin len @159a * //
translated: “The group of six ate both after having someone else do the receiving and without having someone else do the receiving.

original: byed du bcug ste bza' bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: byed du bcug ste bza' bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: Since the Blessed One said, ‘You should eat after having someone else do the receiving,’🔽the monks who had few desires complained and criticized them,🔽“‘How can the group of six eat both after having someone else do the receiving and without having someone else do the receiving?’

original: ci'i phyir dge slong dag byin lan byed du bcug pa dang / byed du ma bcug par yang za bar byed ces smod par byed /🔽phyag gtong bar byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dge slong dag byin lan byed du bcug pa dang / byed du ma bcug par yang za bar byed ces smod par byed / phyag gtong bar byed /
translated: They are giving gifts and eating the food without permission.”🔽They complained and criticized them,

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: and the monks told the Blessed One about it.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Buddha, knowing that this was the cause, the reason, and the circumstance, gathered the saṅgha of monks and questioned the group of six:

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: “Monks, is it true that the group of six are doing this?”🔽“It is not suitable,🔽it is not proper,🔽it is not worthy of a renunciant,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not allowable,🔽it is not to be done.

original: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: This is not something a renunciant should do.”🔽The Blessed One rebuked them in many ways, and after rebuking them, he gave a teaching and instructed the monks:

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, I see ten benefits in laying down a training rule for my disciples, the monks.

original: yang dge slong gang ma byin par kha nas mid pa'i zas za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang ma byin par kha nas mid pa'i zas za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: Also, If a monk eats food that has not been given, he commits an offense.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The person was the group of six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bka' dang bslab pa la g-yel ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bka' dang bslab pa la g-yel ba /
translated: The affliction was negligence in the Buddha's words and training.

original: nyes pa ni byin len byed du ma bcug par za ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni byin len byed du ma bcug par za ba'o //
translated: The fault was eating without having received the gift.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The background of the allowance was that the Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta's Grove, Anāthapiṇḍada's park.

original: dge slong dgon pa pa dgon pa na gnas pa rnams la chu dang so shing gi byin len stobs pa med nas de dag gis dgon pa'i gnas mal dag bor te /
analyzed: dge slong dgon pa pa dgon pa na gnas pa rnams la chu dang so shing gi byin len stobs pa med nas de dag gis dgon pa'i gnas mal dag bor te /
translated: The monks in the wilderness did not have anyone to give them water and tooth cleaners. They abandoned their wilderness dwellings

original: grong mtha'i gnas mal dag tu zhugs so //
analyzed: grong mtha'i gnas mal dag tu zhugs so //

analyzed: kun dga' bo ci'i phyir dge slong dgon pa bdag gis dgon pa'i gnas mal dag bor te grong mtha'i gnas mal dag tu zhugs /
translated: “Ānanda, why did the monks who lived in the wilderness abandon their beds and seats in the wilderness and go to live in beds and seats in the vicinity of villages?”

original: cho dang ldan pa kun dga' bos skabs de rgyas par gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: cho dang ldan pa kun dga' bos skabs de rgyas par gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The venerable Ānanda told the Blessed One in detail what had happened, and the Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na chu dang so shing ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na chu dang so shing ma gtogs so //
translated: “Therefore, except for water and tooth cleaners,

original: glang po che cang shes dang spre'u cang shes dang dom cad shes dag yod nas de dag gis dge slong rnams la shing thog dag dbul ba na dge slong rnams 'gyod pas de dag me len nas /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: “Since there is a receiver, there is also a giver.

analyzed: de lta bas na de @159b dag gis bstabs pa ni byin len byas par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, you should say that what they offer is received.

original: de la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'gyod par mi bya'o //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags ba brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags ba brjod nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training,

original: yul ni mnyan yod /

analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus dang chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa'i bza' bar bya ba byin len ma bstabs pa nyid la der 'du shes pas khar zos na byin len ma

analyzed: byas par zos pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis ma brlabs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis ma brlabs pa la na smad pa med do //

original: lang gang zhen /

original: de las mnos na byin len yin gyi /
analyzed: de las mnos na byin len yin gyi /

translated: The phrase from a non-human means that if one accepts from an elephant, horse, monkey, bear, or other animal that can understand and give, it is a proper acceptance.
