analyzed: de dag gis der gang gzhag pa de la byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi dus byin gyis brlabs te bza' bar bya zhing de la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: They should eat what is placed there, consecrating it with the name of Uttarakuru, and should not regret it.

original: lhung bzed dang lhung bzed kyi gzhi dag ni 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang lhung bzed kyi gzhi dag ni 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: The bowl and the bowl-rest are similar.

original: byin len byas pa zhig pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: byin len byas pa zhig pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in the consecrated food becoming spoiled.

original: byin len byas pa'i zas 'dril zhing gnas nas gud du song ba gang yin pa de ni dge slong rang stan las ma 'phags pas len nus pa nyid yin na byin len ma zhig pa yin la /
analyzed: byin len byas pa'i zas 'dril zhing gnas nas gud du song ba gang yin pa de ni dge slong rang stan las ma 'phags pas len nus pa nyid yin na byin len ma zhig pa yin la /
translated: If the consecrated food is rolled into a ball and carried away, if the monk is able to take it without rising from his seat, the consecration is not broken.

original: gzhan du zhig pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du zhig pa kho na yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it is broken.

original: sbrang bu dang / grog sbur dang / byi phrug byung ma thag pa'i tshad pas kyang chung ba'i skye bo phra mo dag gis reg pa na byin len ma zhig pa yin la /
analyzed: sbrang bu dang / grog sbur dang / byi phrug byung ma thag pa'i tshad pas kyang chung ba'i skye bo phra mo dag gis reg pa na byin len ma zhig pa yin la /
translated: If the food is touched by small creatures, such as insects, ants, or mice, the consecration is not broken.

original: byi ba dang byi mangs la sogs pa'i byi ba dang / de tsam yan chad kyi srog chags gzhan gyis reg pa dge slong rang dang ma 'brel bas ni byin len zhig pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: byi ba dang byi mangs la sogs pa'i byi ba dang / de tsam yan chad kyi srog chags gzhan gyis reg pa dge slong rang dang ma 'brel bas ni byin len zhig pa kho na yin no //
translated: If it is touched by a mouse, a rat, or other such animal, or by any other living being, then the acceptance is broken, because the monk is not connected to it.

original: dge slong gis ma btang ba la dge slong ma dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i mi gzhan gyis reg pas ni byin len ma zhig pa yin la /
analyzed: dge slong gis ma btang ba la dge slong ma dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i mi gzhan gyis reg pas ni byin len ma zhig pa yin la /
translated: If it is touched by a nun or by another person who has not yet completed the preliminary training, but the monk has not given it away, then the acceptance is not broken.

original: dge slong gis btang ba la de dag gis reg pas ni byin len zhig pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis btang ba la de dag gis reg pas ni byin len zhig pa kho na yin no //
translated: If it is touched by them after the monk has given it away, then the acceptance is broken.

original: byin len bstabs zin pa kho na la yang stobs par byed pa ni mi rigs pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: byin len bstabs zin pa kho na la yang stobs par byed pa ni mi rigs pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not improper to offer food that has already been accepted,

original: 'di las gzhan dag gis reg par ma gyur tam snyam pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan dag gis reg par ma gyur tam snyam pa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because this is done in order to dispel any doubt that it might have been touched by someone else.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus dang chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa'i bza' bar bya ba'i byin len ma bstabs pa nyid la der 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus dang chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa'i bza' bar bya ba'i byin len ma bstabs pa nyid la der 'du shes pa dang yid gnyis za ba la na smad pa med do /
translated: There is no fault in eating food that is not consecrated by the ritual of receiving, except for the time of the northern continent Kuru, or for water and tooth cleaners.

original: rna ba la sogs pa sgo gzhan ma gtogs pa khar zos pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa sgo gzhan ma gtogs pa khar zos pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating food that is not consecrated by the ritual of receiving, except for food that is eaten through another orifice, such as the nose.

original: khar zos shing mgul du mid pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: khar zos shing mgul du mid pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in eating food that is not consecrated by the ritual of receiving, except for food that is eaten and swallowed through the mouth.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus dang chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa'i bza' bar bya ba byin len ma bstabs pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus dang chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa'i bza' bar bya ba byin len ma bstabs pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this downfall is the mind that is the primary factor in the consecration of food by the ritual of receiving, except for the time of the northern continent Kuru, or for water and tooth cleaners.

original: 'di la yan lag drug gis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus ma gtogs pa dang / chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa'i bza' bar bya ba dang / byin len gyi mtshan nyid mngon sum du mtshams kyi nang du 'thob pa'i phyogs na 'dug pas lag pa bkan pas lus sam de dang 'brel par gyen du 'degs nus pa bsnyen par ma @161b rdzogs pa mi ma yin pa las kyang sbyin par 'dod pas yan lag🔽gis sam de dang 'brel pas byin la /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag drug gis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus ma gtogs pa dang / chu dang so shing ma gtogs pa'i bza' bar bya ba dang / byin len gyi mtshan nyid mngon sum du mtshams kyi nang du 'thob pa'i phyogs na 'dug pas lag pa bkan pas lus sam de dang 'brel par gyen du 'degs nus pa bsnyen par ma @161b rdzogs pa mi ma yin pa las kyang sbyin par 'dod pas yan lag gis sam de dang 'brel pas byin la /
translated: the food is raised by the fully ordained monk with his own hand and placed in the bowl or in contact with the body;🔽the food is given by a nonhuman being or by a person who is not fully ordained;

original: mnos pa lta bu'i byin len ma bstabs pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa dang / khar bcug pa dang zos pa'o //
analyzed: mnos pa lta bu'i byin len ma bstabs pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa dang / khar bcug pa dang zos pa'o //
translated: the food is not given by a gesture or by a person who is not fully ordained;🔽the monk perceives the food as being given;🔽the food is placed in the mouth and eaten.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is incomplete, the downfall is a serious transgression.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The preparatory stage of this downfall is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du phyin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du phyin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one does not return the food and eats it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each time one begins a different preparation for the actual basis, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis mi rlob pa nyid kyi tshe na nyes byas so //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis mi rlob pa nyid kyi tshe na nyes byas so //
translated: When one does not consecrate food in the time of Kuru in the north, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i gling nyid dang / bza' bar bya ba byin len bstabs pa nyid la de gnyis ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i gling nyid dang / bza' bar bya ba byin len bstabs pa nyid la de gnyis ma yin par 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: When one is in the northern continent of Kuru, or when one has consecrated food, but one does not perceive it as such, or one is unsure of it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: kha nyid ma gtogs pa rna ba la sogs pa'i sgo gzhan du 'jug pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: kha nyid ma gtogs pa rna ba la sogs pa'i sgo gzhan du 'jug pa la nyes byas so //
translated: When one puts food into any orifice other than the mouth, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: kha nas mgul du mid pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: kha nas mgul du mid pa la nyes byas so //
translated: When one puts food into the mouth but swallows it through the throat, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation for preparation is a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: There are as many preparations for preparation as there are preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation is a misdeed, and the application is also a misdeed, which is a subtle misdeed.

original: ltung ba med pa ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling nyid dang / gzhan du de'i dus byin gyis brlabs pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling nyid dang / gzhan du de'i dus byin gyis brlabs pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is the northern continent Kuru itself, or elsewhere, and one is empowered by the occasion.

original: chu dang so shing la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: chu dang so shing la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is water or a tooth stick.

original: byin len ma bstabs pa nyid dang de ma zhig pa yin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: byin len ma bstabs pa nyid dang de ma zhig pa yin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not offer the food, or if it is not offered, or if one does not accept it.

original: der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one is without conception.

original: byin len byas zin pa'i zas gzhan med dam byin len stobs pa'i mi la sogs pa med na zas de sbyin bdag gis bsam pa thag pas btang ba yin na rang gis byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis brlabs shing blangs te zos pa la
analyzed: byin len byas zin pa'i zas gzhan med dam byin len stobs pa'i mi la sogs pa med na zas de sbyin bdag gis bsam pa thag pas btang ba yin na rang gis byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i dus su byin gyis brlabs shing blangs te zos pa la
translated: If there is no other food that has been offered and accepted, or if there is no one to offer and accept it, and if the donor is very sincere, then if one eats food that has been offered and accepted by oneself, empowered as if it were the time of the northern continent Kuru,

original: ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med do //
translated: there is no offense.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginner, or is insane, or is deranged, or is overwhelmed by pain, or is the first offender.🔽The training rule on eating without having received the alms is finished.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The monks should train in the rule, “‘I will not eat without having received the alms, except in extenuating circumstances.’

original: byin len byed du bcug ste bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: byin len byed du bcug ste bza' bar bya'o //
translated: I will eat after having received the alms.

original: rung ba lnga po mes rung ba dang mtshon gyis rung ba dang sen mos rung ba dang / rnyings pas rung ba dang / ne tsos rma phyung bas rung ba nyid dag bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: rung ba lnga po mes rung ba dang mtshon gyis rung ba dang sen mos rung ba dang / rnyings pas rung ba dang / ne tsos rma phyung bas rung ba nyid dag bza' bar bya'o //
translated: I will eat the five kinds of allowable food: food that has been burned, food that has been cut by a weapon, food that has been scratched by a fingernail, old food, and food that has been pecked at by a parrot.

original: gzhan yang rung ba lnga po /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ba lnga po /
translated: I will eat the five kinds of allowable food:

original: dbyung ba dang / gshegs pa dang / bcad pa dang / phug pa dang / sa bon gyi chos nyid med pa nyid dag bza' bar @162a * //
analyzed: dbyung ba dang / gshegs pa dang / bcad pa dang / phug pa dang / sa bon gyi chos nyid med pa nyid dag bza' bar @162a * //
translated: food that has been disgorged, food that has been walked over, food that has been cut, food that has been pierced, and food that is naturally seedless.

original: bya'o ; chu grang mos rung bar byas pa dag kyang bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o ; chu grang mos rung bar byas pa dag kyang bsten par bya'o //
translated: I will eat food that has been made allowable by washing with cold water.

original: rung ba de dag slob ma dang nye gnas dag gis cang mi smra bas so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rung ba de dag slob ma dang nye gnas dag gis cang mi smra bas so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: The disciples and the pupils should examine the suitability of these by their silence.

original: mes rung bar bya ba ni phung por byas te mes gnas gnyis sam gsum du reg par byas na thams cad du rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mes rung bar bya ba ni phung por byas te mes gnas gnyis sam gsum du reg par byas na thams cad du rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is suitable for fire is suitable for all when it is piled up and touched with fire in two or three places.

original: mtshon dang sen mos ni re re nas so //
analyzed: mtshon dang sen mos ni re re nas so //
translated: That which is suitable for a knife or nail is suitable for each individual.

original: khyim pa rnams mi snyoms par 'dri ma na dge tshul dag 'drim du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa rnams mi snyoms par 'dri ma na dge tshul dag 'drim du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: If the lay people are not equal in asking, the novices should be made to distribute.

original: de dag kyang mi snyoms na dge slong dag gis lag pa bsnyal te byin len byas nas brim par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi snyoms na dge slong dag gis lag pa bsnyal te byin len byas nas brim par bya'o //
translated: If they are not equal, the monks should wash their hands, accept the offering, and distribute it.

original: dge slong byin len byas pas brim pa nyid ni rung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge slong byin len byas pas brim pa nyid ni rung ba nyid yin no //
translated: It is suitable for the monks to distribute what they have accepted.

original: 'on kyang ma snyoms na brim par bya ba'i zas gces pa dang bar ma dang / tha ma dag so sor bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma snyoms na brim par bya ba'i zas gces pa dang bar ma dang / tha ma dag so sor bya'o //
translated: However, if they are not equal, the food to be distributed should be divided into three parts: the best, the middling, and the least.

original: aa mra zhim po rnams logs shig tu btsal te brim par bya'o //
analyzed: aa mra zhim po rnams logs shig tu btsal te brim par bya'o //
translated: The delicious mangoes should be sought out separately and distributed.

original: 'drim par byed pa'i skal ba ni mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis mnos par bya'o //
analyzed: 'drim par byed pa'i skal ba ni mkhan po dang slob dpon gyis mnos par bya'o //
translated: The portion of the one who is distributing should be taken by the preceptor and the teacher.

original: de gnyis rgan pa'i phyir gces pa der 'ong ba 'dri ma par byed pa'i skal ba mi 'thob pa yin na 'drim par byed pa nyid kyi gral gyi drung na 'dug pa dag gis de'i skal ba mnos par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis rgan pa'i phyir gces pa der 'ong ba 'dri ma par byed pa'i skal ba mi 'thob pa yin na 'drim par byed pa nyid kyi gral gyi drung na 'dug pa dag gis de'i skal ba mnos par bya'o //
translated: Because those two are senior, they are cherished. If they do not obtain a portion, those who are sitting in the row near the one who is distributing should take that portion.

original: 'drim par byed pa du ma nyid yin na drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong stan las ma 'phags pa gang yin pa des de dag gi skal ba ci tsam len nus pa de tsam mnod par bya zhing gzhan ni gzhan dag gis gnod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'drim par byed pa du ma nyid yin na drung na 'dug pa'i dge slong stan las ma 'phags pa gang yin pa des de dag gi skal ba ci tsam len nus pa de tsam mnod par bya zhing gzhan ni gzhan dag gis gnod par bya'o //
translated: If there are many who are distributing, then the portion of those who are able to take it should be taken by the monk who is sitting nearby and has not risen from his seat. The rest should be taken by others.

original: 'dril ba dag stan las ma 'phags pas len nus pa dag ni byin len byed du gzhug mi dgos la /
analyzed: 'dril ba dag stan las ma 'phags pas len nus pa dag ni byin len byed du gzhug mi dgos la /
translated: If those who are distributing are able to take it without rising from their seats, they should not be made to do the receiving.

original: mi nus pa dag ni yang byin len byed du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: mi nus pa dag ni yang byin len byed du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: If they are not able, they should again be made to do the receiving.

original: dge slong gis byin len byas pa khyim pa dag kyang 'drim du gzhug par bya zhing /
analyzed: dge slong gis byin len byas pa khyim pa dag kyang 'drim du gzhug par bya zhing /
translated: The laity who have done the receiving should also be made to distribute.

original: byin len 'jig pa spang ba'i phyir dge slong gis dang por bzung zhing khyim pas phyis gzung bar bya'o //🔽dge slong gis byin len byas pa khyim pa dag kyang 'drim du bcug pa de dge slong dag las blangs pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi byin len ni sngar dge slong gis byin len byas pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: byin len 'jig pa spang ba'i phyir dge slong gis dang por bzung zhing khyim pas phyis gzung bar bya'o // dge slong gis byin len byas pa khyim pa dag kyang 'drim du bcug pa de dge slong dag las blangs pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi byin len ni sngar dge slong gis byin len byas pa de nyid yin no //
translated: In order to avoid the destruction of the gift, the monk should first take it, and then the layperson.🔽If the monk has already taken the gift, the layperson should be made to distribute it to the monks.

original: khyim pa dag las blangs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni byin lan byed du gzhug go //
analyzed: khyim pa dag las blangs pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni byin lan byed du gzhug go //
translated: If the layperson has already taken the gift, the monk should be made to distribute it to the laypeople.

original: 'jug lhag gsog 'jog byas par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir dang por dge slong dge slong dag gis gtang bar bya zhing phyis khyim pa dag gis gtang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'jug lhag gsog 'jog byas par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir dang por dge slong dge slong dag gis gtang bar bya zhing phyis khyim pa dag gis gtang bar bya ste /
translated: In order to avoid the fault of hoarding, the monk should first give it to the monks, and then the laypeople.

original: phyi de nyin par dge 'dun la brim par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi de nyin par dge 'dun la brim par bya'o //
translated: The next day, it should be distributed to the Saṅgha.

original: bram ze dang khyim bdag dang pa can dag dge 'dun la zhun mar gyi bum pa la sogs pa dag 'bul na blang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dang pa can dag dge 'dun la zhun mar gyi bum pa la sogs pa dag 'bul na blang bar bya zhing /
translated: If brahmins, householders, or renunciants offer a pot of ghee or the like to the Saṅgha, it should be accepted.

original: blangs nas dge @162b 'dun la brim par bya'o //
analyzed: blangs nas dge @162b 'dun la brim par bya'o //
translated: Having taken it, he should distribute it to the saṅgha.

original: de dag gis chos gos dag snum par gyur pa ltan par du rtsva 'am lo ma dag bcug ste brim par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis chos gos dag snum par gyur pa ltan par du rtsva 'am lo ma dag bcug ste brim par bya'o //
translated: If their robes become oily, they should distribute it after inserting grass or leaves into the oil.

original: de dag bzung ste 'greng ba na ngal bar 'gyur ba lta na gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag bzung ste 'greng ba na ngal bar 'gyur ba lta na gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If they become tired while standing and holding it, they should put it down.

original: gzhag pa na 'dril ba lta na 'og gzhi la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhag pa na 'dril ba lta na 'og gzhi la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If it spills while being put down, they should put it down on a mat.

original: snod phul ba dag kyang blang zhing chu'i rdzing bu zab mo'i nang du zhag bdun nam brgyad gzhug par bya zhing /
analyzed: snod phul ba dag kyang blang zhing chu'i rdzing bu zab mo'i nang du zhag bdun nam brgyad gzhug par bya zhing /
translated: They should also take the offered bowls and put them in a deep water pot for seven or eight days.

original: gang gi tshe nya'am rus sbal lam sbal pa 'am chu srin byis pa gsod dam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nya'am rus sbal lam sbal pa 'am chu srin byis pa gsod dam /
translated: When the fish, turtles, frogs, or crocodiles have completely eaten the worms,

original: nya khyi ba dag gis ma lus par ldogs par gyur pa de'i tshe na rung ba'i khang par bcug ste mnod pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa las kyang mnod par bya'o //
analyzed: nya khyi ba dag gis ma lus par ldogs par gyur pa de'i tshe na rung ba'i khang par bcug ste mnod pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa las kyang mnod par bya'o //
translated: they should put them in a suitable house and take the novitiate vows.

original: de med na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa las kyang mnod par bya'o //
analyzed: de med na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa las kyang mnod par bya'o //
translated: If there is no one to take the novitiate vows, they should take the novitiate vows from someone who is not fully ordained.

original: nad pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas ni de gnyis bstabs pa bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas ni de gnyis bstabs pa bza' bar bya'o //
translated: The sick person who is not fully ordained may eat the two foods that have been offered.

original: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir bcos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The amendment is the same as before.🔽The thirty-ninth downfall is finished.

original: byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu dgu pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: byin len ma byas par za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu dgu pa bshad zin to /
translated: The bases for the downfall of begging for alms

original: // / bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: // / bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni bcas pa dang gnang ba'i dbang gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: are of two types: according to the proscriptions and according to the permissions.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya rnams kyi nang du ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na ser skya'i gnas su byon nas ser skya'i gnas na n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya rnams kyi nang du ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na ser skya'i gnas su byon nas ser skya'i gnas na n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The proscription: The Blessed Buddha, the Bhagavat, was traveling through the Shakya country and arrived at Kapilavastu, where he stayed in the Nyagrodha Park.

original: sh'akya ming chen gyis de thos nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: sh'akya ming chen gyis de thos nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Shakya Mahanama heard that the Buddha had arrived and went to him.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: He bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //🔽mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug go //🔽mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas /
translated: and sat to one side.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya ming chen la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya ming chen la chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par ston par mdzad / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /
translated: enthused, and delighted the Licchavi Mahānama with a discourse on the Dharma.

original: yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad /🔽yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs stod par mdzad / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: Having instructed, inspired,

original: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod //🔽yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid kyis yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod // yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
translated: enthused, and delighted him with a discourse on the Dharma in a variety of ways, he remained silent.🔽Then the Licchavi Mahānama invited the Blessed One and the community of monks to take their meal at his house the next day, and they assented by remaining silent.

original: de nas sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa sang bdag gi sdum par gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang zhes spyan drangs nas gshegs te gdugs tshod gsol nas sh'akya ming chen la chos bstan nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so
analyzed: de nas sh'akya ming chen gyis bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa sang bdag gi sdum par gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang zhes spyan drangs nas gshegs te gdugs tshod gsol nas sh'akya ming chen la chos bstan nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so
translated: The Licchavi Mahānama then served the Blessed One and the community of monks with his own hands, offering them a pure and fine meal of his own accord.🔽When the Blessed One had finished his meal and washed his hands and his bowl, the Licchavi Mahānama sat to one side.🔽The Blessed One then taught him the Dharma, exhorting, inspiring, and delighting him.
Having instructed, inspired,🔽enthused, and delighted him with a discourse on the Dharma in a variety of ways, he rose from his seat and departed.

original: nang par drug sde dag sngar langs te sbyin bdag gi khyim du dod ba dang / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: nang par drug sde dag sngar langs te sbyin bdag gi khyim du dod ba dang / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,🔽“Noble ones, please have your meal here.”

original: 'phags pa dag 'di nyid du gdugs tshod gsol cig / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag 'di nyid du gdugs tshod gsol cig / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: kho bo cag mgron du bos so //
analyzed: kho bo cag mgron du bos so //
translated: “We have been invited elsewhere.”🔽“Who invited you?”

original: sus sh'akya ming chen gyis so //
analyzed: sus sh'akya ming chen gyis so //
translated: “The Śākya Mahānāman.”🔽“Well then, please have your meal tomorrow.”

original: 'o na sang gdugs tshod gsol cig / de ltar bya'o zhes drug sde dag gis sbyin bdag de dag phyi de nyin par gyi zan drug cu sbyor du bcug nas sh'akya ming chen gyi khyim du dong ba dang / ci tsam na kha zas sta gon byas pa yang med /
analyzed: 'o na sang gdugs tshod gsol cig / de ltar bya'o zhes drug sde dag gis sbyin bdag de dag phyi de nyin par gyi zan drug cu sbyor du bcug nas sh'akya ming chen gyi khyim du dong ba dang / ci tsam na kha zas sta gon byas pa yang med /
translated: “We will do that.” The next day the group of six had the benefactor prepare a meal for sixty people and then went to the house of the Śākya Mahānāman.

original: gnas mal bshams pa yang med par mthong nas /
analyzed: gnas mal bshams pa yang med par mthong nas /
translated: When they saw that there was no food prepared and no seats set out,

original: drug sde dag gis sh'akya ming chen gyi zho shas 'tsho ba dag la smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis sh'akya ming chen gyi zho shas 'tsho ba dag la smras pa /
translated: the group of six said to the Śākya Mahānāman’s servants,🔽“Why is there no food prepared and no seats set out?”

original: shes ldan dag khyed kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drangs nas snying las chung dur 'khod cing gdugs tshod kyang sta gon mi byed /
analyzed: shes ldan dag khyed kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drangs nas snying las chung dur 'khod cing gdugs tshod kyang sta gon mi byed /
translated: “Sirs, you have invited the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks, but you are sitting around doing nothing and have not even prepared the midday meal.

original: gnas mal kyang shom par mi byed na ji ltar sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gdugs tshod gcod par byed dam /🔽de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gnas mal kyang shom par mi byed na ji ltar sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gdugs tshod gcod par byed dam / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: You have not even set out the bedding, so how will you serve the midday meal to the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks?”

original: 'phags pa dag khyed cag gcig pu dag rnal bar gyur tam ci /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag khyed cag gcig pu dag rnal bar gyur tam ci /
translated: “Sirs, are you alone?”

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod gsol te gshegs lags so //🔽drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun gdugs tshod gsol te gshegs lags so // drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: “The Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks have eaten and left.”

original: ji kho bo cag gi zan gcad par bya 'am de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: ji kho bo cag gi zan gcad par bya 'am de dag gis smras pa /
translated: “Noble ones, should we fast?”

original: 'phags pa dag bdag cag gis sh'akya ming chen la sbran gyi bar du re zhig yud tsam zhig gzhes shig ces de dag dong ste sh'akya ming chen la smras pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bdag cag gis sh'akya ming chen la sbran gyi bar du re zhig yud tsam zhig gzhes shig ces de dag dong ste sh'akya ming chen la smras pa /
translated: “Noble ones, please wait a moment while we inform Śākya Mahānāman.” They went and said to Śākya Mahānāman,🔽“Noble ones, please wait a moment while we inform Śākya Mahānāman.”

original: 'phags pa drug sde dag gzod mchis te 'tshal ma slong ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa drug sde dag gzod mchis te 'tshal ma slong ngo //
translated: The noble group-of-six arrived and asked for alms.

original: sh'akya ming chen gyis smras pa /
analyzed: sh'akya ming chen gyis smras pa /
translated: Mahānāman the Śākya said,

original: deng la lhag rol chung zad cig gda' ba de byin cig / de dag dong ste smras pa /
analyzed: deng la lhag rol chung zad cig gda' ba de byin cig / de dag dong ste smras pa /
translated: “Go and give them the leftovers.”🔽They went and said, “Noble ones, please stay and eat.”

original: 'phags pa dag bzhugs la gsol cig ces de dag gis brim par brtsams pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bzhugs la gsol cig ces de dag gis brim par brtsams pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group-of-six said,

original: sh'akya ming chen gyis kha shin tu chen pos bcom ldan 'das kyis sang bdag gi sdum par dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs gcig tu gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang zhes spyan drangs na /
analyzed: sh'akya ming chen gyis kha shin tu chen pos bcom ldan 'das kyis sang bdag gi sdum par dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs gcig tu gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang zhes spyan drangs na /
translated: “Mahānāman the Śākya invited the Blessed One and the community of monks to his house tomorrow, saying, ‘May the Blessed One please accept tomorrow’s meal at my house together with the community of monks.’

original: gal te zan 'di 'dra bas sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drang du rung na ni nye dgas kyang nyi ma re re zhing sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan 'dren par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te zan 'di 'dra bas sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan drang du rung na ni nye dgas kyang nyi ma re re zhing sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan 'dren par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is appropriate to invite the Buddha and the community of monks with such food as this, then Upāli would invite the Buddha and the community of monks every day.”

original: 'di ltar bkren pa 'di la ci bdog gi deng la khyim bdag che ge mo'i khyim nas 'o ma long shig / che @163b ge mo'i khyim nas zho lod shig / che ge mo'i khyim nas mar long shig / che ge mo'i khyim nas nya sha long shig
analyzed: 'di ltar bkren pa 'di la ci bdog gi deng la khyim bdag che ge mo'i khyim nas 'o ma long shig / che @163b ge mo'i khyim nas zho lod shig / che ge mo'i khyim nas mar long shig / che ge mo'i khyim nas nya sha long shig
translated: Go to the house of such-and-such a householder and get fish from him.🔽Go to the house of such-and-such a householder and get meat from him.🔽Go to the house of such-and-such a householder and get dried meat from him.”

original: / che ge mo'i khyim nas sha long shig / che ge mo'i khyim nas sha skam dag long shig ces de dag gis bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te der zos nas gtsug lag khang du dong ba
analyzed: / che ge mo'i khyim nas sha long shig / che ge mo'i khyim nas sha skam dag long shig ces de dag gis bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te der zos nas gtsug lag khang du dong ba
translated: They took such delicious food from the houses of others for themselves, ate it there, and then went to the monastery.

original: dang / dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: dang / dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa /
translated: The monks asked them,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed kyis zan gar zos /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed kyis zan gar zos /
translated: “Venerables, where did you eat?”

original: de nyid du'o //
analyzed: de nyid du'o //
translated: “Right there.”

original: khyed cag de na ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: khyed cag de na ma mthong ngo //
translated: “We didn’t see you there.”

original: kho bo cag phyis lhags so //
analyzed: kho bo cag phyis lhags so //
translated: “We arrived later.”

original: khyed cag gis zan ji lta bu zos /
analyzed: khyed cag gis zan ji lta bu zos /
translated: “What did you eat?”

original: 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam po dag go //
analyzed: 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam po dag go //
translated: milk, curd, butter, fish, meat, and dried meat.

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks said,

original: kho bo cag gis zan de lta bu ma thob po //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis zan de lta bu ma thob po //
translated: “We didn’t get such food.”

original: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

original: bkren pa de la zan de lta bu ga la yod /
analyzed: bkren pa de la zan de lta bu ga la yod /
translated: “How could the poor man have such food?

original: kho bo cag gis khyim du 'gro ba'i khyim dag nas blangs te der zos so //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis khyim du 'gro ba'i khyim dag nas blangs te der zos so //
translated: We took it from the houses of the people who were going to the feast and ate it there.”

original: khyed cag bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te bzar rung ngam /🔽rung yang srid mi rung yang srid de ji kho bo cag gis ltogs te 'chi bar bya 'am zhes zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te
analyzed: khyed cag bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te bzar rung ngam / rung yang srid mi rung yang srid de ji kho bo cag gis ltogs te 'chi bar bya 'am zhes zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te
translated: “Is it proper for you to take such good food for yourselves from the houses of others?”🔽“It may be proper or it may not be proper. What will we do, die of starvation?”🔽Those monks who were modest … criticized them,🔽“How can monks take such good food for themselves from the houses of others and then eat it?”

original: 'cha' ba dang za bar byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: 'cha' ba dang za bar byed ces smod par byed /
translated: They rebuked those monks in many ways and then went to the Blessed One.

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: After bowing their heads at his feet, they sat down to one side.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: When the monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, the Blessed One, in this connection, in this context, assembled the community of monks and questioned the group of six:

original: drug sde dag la rmas nas /🔽dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag la rmas nas / dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: “Is it true, monks, that the group of six did this?”🔽“Monks, this is not in accordance with the Dharma,

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not in accordance with the monastic code,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not suitable,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam grangs du mar rnam par smad de /
translated: it is not to be done by a monastic.”

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: After rebuking them in many ways, the Buddha spoke in great detail about the ten benefits of establishing training rules, and said, “Therefore, the monks should recite this training rule:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi zas bsod pa gang dag gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi zas bsod pa gang dag gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: ‘The Blessed One has spoken about the good food of monks.

original: 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam dag ste /
analyzed: 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam dag ste /
translated: milk, yogurt, butter, fish, meat, and dried meat.

original: yang dge slong gang bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: “If a monk receives such delicious food for himself from the houses of the faithful and then eats it, he commits an offense entailing confession.”

original: yul ni ser skya'i gnas /
analyzed: yul ni ser skya'i gnas /
translated: The place was Kapilavastu.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /🔽nyon mongs @164a * //
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde / nyon mongs @164a * //
translated: The people were the group of six.

original: pa ni rang nyams dang lto 'dun /
analyzed: pa ni rang nyams dang lto 'dun /
translated: The affliction was self-indulgence and greed.

original: nyes pa ni mi na bas bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te za ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni mi na bas bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te za ba'o //
translated: The fault was that, being healthy, they received delicious food for themselves from the houses of the faithful and then ate it.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gnas na n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gnas na n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The background story of the allowance is this. The Blessed Buddha was staying in the Nyagrodha Park in Kapilavastu.

original: dge slong na ba zhig gis sman pa la dris pa /
analyzed: dge slong na ba zhig gis sman pa la dris pa /
translated: A sick monk asked a doctor,🔽“Sir, please prescribe medicine for me.”🔽“Noble one, drink milk.”

original: bzhin bzangs je kho bo la sman ston cig /'phags pa 'o ma gsol cig / bzhin bzang kho bo la 'o ma sus sbyin par 'gyur /
analyzed: bzhin bzangs je kho bo la sman ston cig /'phags pa 'o ma gsol cig / bzhin bzang kho bo la 'o ma sus sbyin par 'gyur /
translated: “Sir, who will give me milk?”

original: 'phags pa khyim gzhan dag nas slongs shig / bzhin bzang bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa khyim gzhan dag nas slongs shig / bzhin bzang bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba mdzad do //
translated: Good man, the Blessed One has established a rule of training.🔽Noble one, your teacher is compassionate. He will allow it, making that very condition a condition.

original: 'phags pa khyod kyi ston pa thugs rje can lags pa sde nyid rkyen du mdzad nas gnang bar 'gyur ba gang lags pa de lta bu'i gnas mchis par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyi ston pa thugs rje can lags pa sde nyid rkyen du mdzad nas gnang bar 'gyur ba gang lags pa de lta bu'i gnas mchis par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang /
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: de lta bas nan pa'i dus ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas nan pa'i dus ma gtogs so //
translated: Therefore, I authorize begging from other houses except in times of famine.

original: de bzhin du dge slong na pa gzhan la zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam po dag khyim gzhan dag nas slong du gnang ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong na pa gzhan la zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam po dag khyim gzhan dag nas slong du gnang ba'i bar du snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, he authorized begging from other houses for curd, ghee, fish, meat, and dried meat for other sick monks, as before.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dag de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dag de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training, spoke to the monks about what is consistent with that, what is predominantly that, and what is endowed with the Dharma that is consistent with that.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: Having spoken this way, he said to the monks, Monks, therefore, the previous was a rule, but this is a concession.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul bal bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul bal bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this training precept in this way in the Vinaya:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi zas bsod par gang dag gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi zas bsod par gang dag gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed One has said that these are the pure foods for monks:

original: 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam dag ste /
analyzed: 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam dag ste /
translated: milk, yogurt, butter, fish, meat, and dried meat.

original: yang dge slong gang min bar bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang min bar bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes gnang ba mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One laid down a rule: If a monk, not being sick, takes and eats such fine foods as these in the houses of others, then that monk should confess a wrong-doing: 'I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing which should be confessed. I confess it.'

original: yul ni ser skya'i gnas gang zag ni dge slong nad pa dag / nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do //🔽de la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis so //
analyzed: yul ni ser skya'i gnas gang zag ni dge slong nad pa dag / nyon mongs pa dang nyes pa ni med do // de la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis so //
translated: The place was Kapilavastu. The person was a sick monk. There was no affliction or offense.

original: dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa rnams kyis so //
translated: In regard to that, the Blessed One said: Monks, I will lay down a rule for monks who are sick, for the comfort of monks who are sick.🔽Monks, if a monk, not being sick, takes and eats such fine foods as these in the houses of others, then that monk should confess a wrong-doing: 'I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing which should be confessed. I confess it.'

original: zas bsod pa gang dag gsungs pa @164b zhes bya ba ni rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zas bsod pa gang dag gsungs pa @164b zhes bya ba ni rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, Monks, what are the fine foods?

original: 'di lta ste 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam dag ste zhes bya ba ni zas bsod pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam dag ste zhes bya ba ni zas bsod pa dag go //
translated: They are milk, curd, butter, fish, meat, and dried meat.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde 'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Any bhikṣu” means the group of six or anyone like them.

original: mi na bar zhes bya ba ni nab ma gtogs par ro //
analyzed: mi na bar zhes bya ba ni nab ma gtogs par ro //
translated: The monk who is not sick means that the group of six or any other monk who is not sick.

original: bdag nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la bsngos te'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la bsngos te'o //
translated: For himself means that he is dedicated to himself.

original: zas bsod pa de lta bu dag ces bya ba ni 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam dag go //
analyzed: zas bsod pa de lta bu dag ces bya ba ni 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam dag go //
translated: Such good food means milk, yogurt, butter, fish, meat, and dried meat.

original: gzhan gyi khyim dag nas zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim dag nas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi khyim dag nas zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim dag nas so //
translated: In other houses means in the houses of Brahmins and householders.

original: blangs te zhes bya ba ni gsol te'o //
analyzed: blangs te zhes bya ba ni gsol te'o //
translated: He takes means he requests.

original: 'cha' 'am za na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
analyzed: 'cha' 'am za na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //
translated: If he eats it means if he swallows it.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: One commits an infraction means as above.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is an infraction?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang / sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, the characteristics of this should be understood through the downfalls, the preparations, the preparations for the preparations, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the amendments.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong min pas ji bder bstabs pa ma byas pas sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim pa nyid las zas bsod pa 'o ma 'am /🔽zho 'am mar ram /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong min pas ji bder bstabs pa ma byas pas sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim pa nyid las zas bsod pa 'o ma 'am / zho 'am mar ram /
translated: Here, the presentation of the actual downfalls is this: If a monk, without being sick, does not make an effort to be hospitable, and eats fresh, good food, such as milk, yogurt, butter,

original: nya sha 'am /
analyzed: nya sha 'am /
translated: fish,

original: sha 'am / sha skam lta bu rang gis blangs te zos pa dang ngan pa 'am bsod pa 'am tha mal pa 'am /
analyzed: sha 'am / sha skam lta bu rang gis blangs te zos pa dang ngan pa 'am bsod pa 'am tha mal pa 'am /
translated: meat, or dried meat, that he himself has requested from a layperson who is not a relative,🔽and if he eats fresh, good food, such as the above, that he himself has requested, whether it is good, bad, or mediocre,

original: bzang po 'thob pa na zas bsod pa snga ma lta bu rang gis blangs te zos na bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzang po 'thob pa na zas bsod pa snga ma lta bu rang gis blangs te zos na bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then he commits the actual downfall of requesting good food.

original: dge slong mi na ba la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong mi na ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the monk is sick, there is no fault.

original: na ba la ni rang slong ba dang / bslangs pa 'thob ba zos pa dang / gzhan slob du bcug pa dang / gzhan slong du bcug pa thob pa zos pa dang / de dag ma zos pa thob pa thams cad la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na ba la ni rang slong ba dang / bslangs pa 'thob ba zos pa dang / gzhan slob du bcug pa dang / gzhan slong du bcug pa thob pa zos pa dang / de dag ma zos pa thob pa thams cad la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense for a sick monk to request, to eat what he has obtained, to cause another to request, or to cause another to request and eat what he has obtained, or to obtain and eat what he has not eaten.

original: dge slong ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: dge slong ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk has not been served as he wishes.

original: dge slong bsod snyoms la rgyu ba khyim dag tu nye bar phyin pa na bud med zas khyer te phyis byung bas dge slong la cang mi smra ba 'am kho bo la 'di mi dgos so zhes phyir spong ba la /
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms la rgyu ba khyim dag tu nye bar phyin pa na bud med zas khyer te phyis byung bas dge slong la cang mi smra ba 'am kho bo la 'di mi dgos so zhes phyir spong ba la /
translated: If a monk who is wandering for alms arrives at a house and a woman comes out with food, if the monk does not say anything or if he says, “I do not need this,” he rejects the offering.

original: bud med kyis 'phags pa 'o na ci slong zhes 'dri na bstabs pa yin pas de la ci 'dod pa bslangs kyang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bud med kyis 'phags pa 'o na ci slong zhes 'dri na bstabs pa yin pas de la ci 'dod pa bslangs kyang ltung ba med do //
translated: If the woman asks, “Noble one, what do you need?” he has been served. Therefore, there is no offense if he asks for whatever he wishes.

original: sbyin bdag la ci 'dod pa slongs shig ces ci bder byas par gyur pa na yang de la ci 'dod pa bslangs kyang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin bdag la ci 'dod pa slongs shig ces ci bder byas par gyur pa na yang de la ci 'dod pa bslangs kyang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the giver says, “Please ask for whatever you want,” then there is no offense in asking for whatever one wants.

original: sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim pa nyid la na smad pa med do //
translated: If the giver is a layperson who is not a relative, there is no offense if there is no criticism.

original: @165a * // zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis bro ma 'tshal bar bdag nyid kyi slad du khyim dag nas zas bsod pa bslangs te 'cha' 'am 'tshal ba de la ltung bar mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: @165a * // zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis bro ma 'tshal bar bdag nyid kyi slad du khyim dag nas zas bsod pa bslangs te 'cha' 'am 'tshal ba de la ltung bar mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: The Buddha said, “Venerables, if a monk who is not sick begs for good food for himself from householders, is there an offense or not?”

original: yod de nye du las bslangs te za na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: yod de nye du las bslangs te za na ltung ba med do //
translated: “If he eats food begged from relatives, there is no offense.

original: gal te rtags 'di pa sbyin bdag yin na de'i tshe yang ltung ba med do//
analyzed: gal te rtags 'di pa sbyin bdag yin na de'i tshe yang ltung ba med do//
translated: If the giver is a non-Buddhist, there is no offense.

original: gal te phyi rol pa rab tu byung ba sbyin bdag yin na ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te phyi rol pa rab tu byung ba sbyin bdag yin na ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the giver is a non-Buddhist renunciate, there is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: zas bsod pa 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam lta bu thams cad dam de dag gang yang rung ba lan smad pa med do //
analyzed: zas bsod pa 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam lta bu thams cad dam de dag gang yang rung ba lan smad pa med do //
translated: It is not wrong to eat any of these foods that are considered good, such as milk, curd, butter, fish, meat and dried meat, or any of these foods that are considered good.

original: so sor thar pa dang de rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: so sor thar pa dang de rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: The Pratimokṣa Sūtra and its commentary state:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi zas bsod pa gang dag gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi zas bsod pa gang dag gsungs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed One said that the following are good foods for monks:

original: 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam dag ste /
analyzed: 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang nya sha dang sha dang sha skam dag ste /
translated: milk, curd, butter, fish, meat and dried meat.

original: yang dge slong gang min bar bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas bslangs te 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang min bar bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas bslangs te 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If a monk asks for and eats such good foods in other’s homes for his own sake, he commits an offense.

original: 'o ma la sogs pa de dag kyang mtshon pa cam du zad de rnam pa de lta bu dag dang mar khu la sogs pa'i zas bsod gzhan dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa de dag kyang mtshon pa cam du zad de rnam pa de lta bu dag dang mar khu la sogs pa'i zas bsod gzhan dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Milk and so on are merely examples. Other good foods such as soup and so on are also like this.

original: rang gis blangs te zos pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang gis blangs te zos pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: It is not wrong to eat them if you obtain them yourself.

original: dge slong min pas zas bsod pa de dag rang gis blangs pa tsam dang / gzhan slong du bcug pa nyid dang / gzhan slong du bcug pa thob pa zos pa ni nyes byas la /
analyzed: dge slong min pas zas bsod pa de dag rang gis blangs pa tsam dang / gzhan slong du bcug pa nyid dang / gzhan slong du bcug pa thob pa zos pa ni nyes byas la /
translated: If one is not a fully ordained monk, then merely receiving the food oneself, or causing another to receive it, or eating the food received by one who was caused to receive it, is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de ma zos pa ni nyes byas phra mor gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma zos pa ni nyes byas phra mor gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one does not eat it, it is said to be a minor offense.

original: zas ngan pa 'am bsod pa'am tha mal pa 'am bzang po thob pa na gal te zas bsod pa snga ma dag lta bu'i yul la rang gis blangs te zos pa la na smad pa med do //🔽gang gi phyir 'dir ci bder bstabs pa kho na 'ba' zhig la ltung ba med pa de'i phyir dge slong ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa des zas ngan pa'am /
analyzed: zas ngan pa 'am bsod pa'am tha mal pa 'am bzang po thob pa na gal te zas bsod pa snga ma dag lta bu'i yul la rang gis blangs te zos pa la na smad pa med do // gang gi phyir 'dir ci bder bstabs pa kho na 'ba' zhig la ltung ba med pa de'i phyir dge slong ci bder bstabs pa ma byas pa des zas ngan pa'am /
translated: If one receives bad food, good food, ordinary food, or excellent food, if one receives it oneself in a place where one previously received good food, there is no fault.

original: bsod pa 'am tha mal pa'am bzang po thob pa na gal te zas bsod pa snga ma dag lta bu'i yul la rang gis bslangs te zos na dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod pa 'am tha mal pa'am bzang po thob pa na gal te zas bsod pa snga ma dag lta bu'i yul la rang gis bslangs te zos na dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Because here there is no downfall for merely receiving whatever is offered, therefore, if a fully ordained monk does not receive whatever is offered, and receives bad food, good food, ordinary food, or excellent food, if he receives it himself in a place where he previously received good food, he commits an actual basis.

original: de la zas ngan pa zhes bya ba ni 'o ma la sogs pa las gzhan pa 'bru mar la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la zas ngan pa zhes bya ba ni 'o ma la sogs pa las gzhan pa 'bru mar la sogs pa'o //
translated: Bad food is oil, etc., other than milk, etc.

original: bsod pa zhes bya ba ni 'o ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod pa zhes bya ba ni 'o ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Good food is milk, etc.

original: tha  mal  pa zhes bya ba ni 'o ma de nyid la sogs pa'i yin pa'o //
analyzed: tha  mal  pa zhes bya ba ni 'o ma de nyid la sogs pa'i yin pa'o //
translated: Ordinary food is the same milk, etc.

original: bzang po zhes bya ba ni 'o ma de nyid ba la sogs pa'i yin pa'o //
analyzed: bzang po zhes bya ba ni 'o ma de nyid ba la sogs pa'i yin pa'o //
translated: Excellent food is the same milk, etc., of a cow that eats grain.

original: yang na ngan pa zhes bya ba ni ra'i 'o ma'o //
analyzed: yang na ngan pa zhes bya ba ni ra'i 'o ma'o //
translated: Or, bad is the milk of a ewe.

original: bsod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras kyi 'o thug mar dang sha ka ra dang bsres pa'o //
analyzed: bsod pa zhes bya ba ni 'bras kyi 'o thug mar dang sha ka ra dang bsres pa'o //
translated: Good is rice gruel mixed with oil, sugar, and salt.

original: tha mal pa zhes bya ba ni ba'i 'o ma'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa zhes bya ba ni ba'i 'o ma'o //
translated: Ordinary is cow's milk.

original: bzang po zhes bya @165b ba ni gang ma sreg la sogs pa'i sha bal po se'u'i khu ba na le sham la sogs pa spod kyi bye brag dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: bzang po zhes bya @165b ba ni gang ma sreg la sogs pa'i sha bal po se'u'i khu ba na le sham la sogs pa spod kyi bye brag dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: Excellent is the meat of a goat, etc., cooked with the juice of tamarind, and various spices such as ginger.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong min pa ci ba der bstabs pa ma dang / sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim pa nyid dang zas bsod pa dag ni byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong min pa ci ba der bstabs pa ma dang / sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim pa nyid dang zas bsod pa dag ni byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this is not a fully ordained monk, but a layperson who is not a relative and who gives good food.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there are five branches for the downfall of the actual basis:

analyzed: dge slong min pa nyid dang / tsi bder bstabs pa ma byas pa nyid dang / zas bsod pa nyid dang / sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim pa nyid dang / rang gis blangs te zos pa'o //

analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas ste ji srid du zas bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //

analyzed: dge slong mi na bas rang gis blangs pa tsam la nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk who is not sick asks for it himself, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong min pas gzhan slong du bcug pa dang / de thob pa zos pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong min pas gzhan slong du bcug pa dang / de thob pa zos pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If he is not a monk, but he asks someone else to ask for it, and he eats what he gets, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong min pas gzhan slong du bcug cing za bar mi byed na nyes byas na smad do //
analyzed: dge slong min pas gzhan slong du bcug cing za bar mi byed na nyes byas na smad do //

analyzed: sbyin par byed pa phyi rol pa'i rab tu byung ba la nyes byas so //

translated: water, oil, butter, sesame oil, honey, molasses, milk, curd, ghee, salt, grain, flour, water for drinking, water for washing, wood, and food.🔽What kind of living beings are they that make water, etc.,
