analyzed: srog chags re re shi ba'i mthar ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi re rer 'gyur ba la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault if you use water that is suitable for the use of living🔽beings born in the three times.🔽There is no fault if you use water that is suitable for the use of living🔽beings born in

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni rang spyad pa'i don du chu la sogs pa srog chags dang bcas pa la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni rang spyad pa'i don du chu la sogs pa srog chags dang bcas pa la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The agent of this is one who, for the sake of his own use, is the one who primarily makes the perception of water, etc. that have living beings in them.

original: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag ldas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there are ten branches to the downfall of the actual basis:🔽any water, etc. that have living beings in them,🔽any living being that is included in the animal birth-state,🔽the perception of that,🔽the use of it by oneself or another,

original: rang spyad pa'i don gang yang @168b rung ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags gang yang rung ba dang bcas pa'i chu la sogs pa dang / der 'du shes pa dang / rang dang gzhan gyis spyad pa dang / srog chags ji snyed shi ba'o //
analyzed: rang spyad pa'i don gang yang @168b rung ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags gang yang rung ba dang bcas pa'i chu la sogs pa dang / der 'du shes pa dang / rang dang gzhan gyis spyad pa dang / srog chags ji snyed shi ba'o //
translated: and the number of living beings that die.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these branches are incomplete, then it is a downfall of a lesser magnitude, as appropriate.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a minor infraction.

original: ji srid du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: ji srid du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: As long as one has begun the preparation for the downfall of using water that has living beings in it, but has not reached the actual basis, it is a minor infraction.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each of the various preparations that are distinct from the actual basis, there is one misdeed.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa nyid ma yin pa la srog chags dang bcas pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa nyid ma yin pa la srog chags dang bcas pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang / yid gnyis za ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If it is not inhabited by living beings, but one perceives it as inhabited, or one is unsure of it, there is a misdeed.

original: rang spyod pa ma yin pa dang dud 'gro ma yin pa dag ni ltung ba gzhan gyi yul yin no //
analyzed: rang spyod pa ma yin pa dang dud 'gro ma yin pa dag ni ltung ba gzhan gyi yul yin no //
translated: If it is not one's own use or not an animal, it is the domain of other downfalls.

original: ma shin sbyor ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma shin sbyor ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: There is a misdeed if one does not apply oneself.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /
translated: The downfall of preparation is a subtle misdeed.

original: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: As many preparations as there are, there are that many preparations of preparation.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: The preparation of a misdeed is also a misdeed, a subtle misdeed.

original: ltung ba med pa ni der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni der 'du shes med pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall if one has no perception of it as such.

original: rang dang gzhan gyis ma spyad pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyis ma spyad pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no downfall if one does not use it oneself or have it used by others.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyes pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyes pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginner; if he is insane; if he is the first offender; if he is overwhelmed by pain; or if he is mentally disturbed.🔽The training rule on not pointing out is finished.

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bstan par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bstan par bslab par bya'o //
translated: The monks from the group of six did not strain the water properly.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu legs par btsag par bya'o //
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu legs par btsag par bya'o //
translated: They should strain the water properly.

original: de'i don du dpyang tshags bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don du dpyang tshags bcang bar bya'o //
translated: They should carry a water strainer.

original: dpyang tshags de ji 'dra ba zhig ce na shing bu gsum mdung khyim lta bur ya thog bsnol mal lcags gzer gyis sprel la /
analyzed: dpyang tshags de ji 'dra ba zhig ce na shing bu gsum mdung khyim lta bur ya thog bsnol mal lcags gzer gyis sprel la /
translated: What is a water strainer like? It is like a spear, with three sticks crossed and tied together with string.

original: rtsa ba gsum phral te sa la gzugs shing /
analyzed: rtsa ba gsum phral te sa la gzugs shing /
translated: The bottom is spread out on the ground.

original: de'i rked par lcags gzer gyi zungs btab pa la dpyad tshags chu dgang bar bya ba dang / btsag par bya ba'i ras bzang po las byas pa bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rked par lcags gzer gyi zungs btab pa la dpyad tshags chu dgang bar bya ba dang / btsag par bya ba'i ras bzang po las byas pa bcang bar bya'o //
translated: The bladder is tied with iron nails and it is filled with water and boiled. It is made from good cloth that can be filled with water and boiled.

original: de'i 'og tu dpyad tshags de nas chu 'dzag pa zed par byed ba'i zed snod bum pa la sogs pa sa la gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dpyad tshags de nas chu 'dzag pa zed par byed ba'i zed snod bum pa la sogs pa sa la gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Then, the bladder is placed on the ground in a container such as a pot that can hold the water that will flow out of the bladder.

original: chu snod gzhan gyis dpyad tshags kyi nang du chus dgang bar bya zhing dpyad tshags nas zags pa'i chu zed snod kyis gzung bar bya ste de ni dpyang tshags zhes bya'o //🔽dpyad tshags kyis chu btsags pa'i 'og tu dpyang @169a * //
analyzed: chu snod gzhan gyis dpyad tshags kyi nang du chus dgang bar bya zhing dpyad tshags nas zags pa'i chu zed snod kyis gzung bar bya ste de ni dpyang tshags zhes bya'o // dpyad tshags kyis chu btsags pa'i 'og tu dpyang @169a * //
translated: Another container is filled with water and the bladder is filled with that water. The water that flows out of the bladder is held in the container. This is called a “hanging bladder.”

original: tshags kyi nang na gnas pa'i srog chags mi 'chi bar dpyang tshags kyi nang na chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir tshags gcal gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: tshags kyi nang na gnas pa'i srog chags mi 'chi bar dpyang tshags kyi nang na chu gnas par bya ba'i phyir tshags gcal gzhug par bya'o //
translated: After the bladder is boiled, a strainer is placed inside the hanging bladder so that the living beings that are in the hanging bladder do not die and so that the water remains in the hanging bladder.

original: tshags gcal de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: tshags gcal de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is that strainer like?

original: bye ma 'am lci ba gang yang rung ba gcal du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: bye ma 'am lci ba gang yang rung ba gcal du gzhug pa'o //
translated: It is spread out on the ground, either sand or ashes.

original: yang na tshags gcal zhes bya ba ni tshags rten snod du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshags gcal zhes bya ba ni tshags rten snod du gzhug pa'o //
translated: Or, the word “spread” means that it is placed in a container.

original: tshags rten snod de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: tshags rten snod de yang ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is that container?

original: sa las byas pa yang rung /
analyzed: sa las byas pa yang rung /
translated: It is made of earth or copper.

original: zangs ma las byas pa yang rung ba'i snod kha'i thon kor gyi phyogs ngos gnyis sam gsum du bu gu phug pa shing bu gsum rked bsnol du gzer btab pa'am /
analyzed: zangs ma las byas pa yang rung ba'i snod kha'i thon kor gyi phyogs ngos gnyis sam gsum du bu gu phug pa shing bu gsum rked bsnol du gzer btab pa'am /
translated: It is a vessel with two or three holes on one side, with three sticks crossed at the waist and fastened with nails or bound.

original: bcings pa'i rtsa ba sa la btsugs pa'i ya thog gsum la tha gu 'am lcags thag 'jam pos dpyangs te de'i nang du dpyang tshags kyi zhabs gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: bcings pa'i rtsa ba sa la btsugs pa'i ya thog gsum la tha gu 'am lcags thag 'jam pos dpyangs te de'i nang du dpyang tshags kyi zhabs gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The base of the roots is planted in the earth, and the three tops are suspended with a soft rope or chain. The base of the swing is placed inside that.

original: de yang sa las byas pa ni tha gus gdags so //
analyzed: de yang sa las byas pa ni tha gus gdags so //
translated: Moreover, if it is made of earth, it is suspended with a rope.

original: zangs ma las byas pa ni lcags thag 'jam pos gdags so //
analyzed: zangs ma las byas pa ni lcags thag 'jam pos gdags so //
translated: If it is made of copper, it is suspended with a soft chain.

original: de ni tshags rten snod ces bya ste de bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni tshags rten snod ces bya ste de bcang bar bya'o //
translated: That is called a container for the swing, and it should be kept.

original: chu tshags gang yang rung ba dag thags bzang bas chu mi 'dzag na chu tshags de la shing leb kyis dal bus dal bus gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: chu tshags gang yang rung ba dag thags bzang bas chu mi 'dzag na chu tshags de la shing leb kyis dal bus dal bus gdab par bya'o //
translated: If any of the water-filters leak because the weave is too loose, then one should slowly and gently beat that water-filter with a piece of wood.

original: bum tshags gce'u can ni tshegs chung zhing bya sla bas de la 'dod pa bskyed bar bya'o //
analyzed: bum tshags gce'u can ni tshegs chung zhing bya sla bas de la 'dod pa bskyed bar bya'o //
translated: The water-filter with a spout is less troublesome and easier to make, so one should develop a desire for it.

original: bum tshags gce'u can de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: bum tshags gce'u can de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the water-filter with a spout like?

original: sa las byas pa yang rung zangs ma las byas pa yang rung ba'i snod bum pa'i dbyibs lta bu kha yangs pa /
analyzed: sa las byas pa yang rung zangs ma las byas pa yang rung ba'i snod bum pa'i dbyibs lta bu kha yangs pa /
translated: It is a vessel made of clay or copper, shaped like a pot, with a wide mouth,

original: nang pad ma'i snying po'i sa bon gyi gnas kyi sbu gu lta bu mang po dang ldan pa /🔽sbu gu de rnams kyi kha phyir bltas pa 'og ma rnams gce'u sbu bas can cug pa /
analyzed: nang pad ma'i snying po'i sa bon gyi gnas kyi sbu gu lta bu mang po dang ldan pa / sbu gu de rnams kyi kha phyir bltas pa 'og ma rnams gce'u sbu bas can cug pa /
translated: and many tubes like the hollow of a lotus-heart seed.🔽The mouths of those tubes face outward, and the lower ones are inserted into the upper ones.

original: nang gi zhabs su bu gu de dag nas chu 'dzag ba'i steng du gcal thabs su chu tshags su rung ba'i rdzas kyi ras mas g-yogs pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi zhabs su bu gu de dag nas chu 'dzag ba'i steng du gcal thabs su chu tshags su rung ba'i rdzas kyi ras mas g-yogs pa ste /
translated: At the lower end, those tubes are covered with a cloth suitable for a water-filter, like a strainer.

original: de ni bum tshags gce'u can zhes bya ste de bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bum tshags gce'u can zhes bya ste de bcang bar bya'o //
translated: This is called a “water-pot with a spout,” and one should carry it.

original: dge 'dun dang gang zag gis kyang chu tshags nye bar gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun dang gang zag gis kyang chu tshags nye bar gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The Saṅgha and individuals should also keep a water-strainer.

original: chu tshags zhes bya ba ni chu la sogs pa kun nas 'dzag par byed pa'i chu tshags ras la sogs pa las byas pa spyi la bsnyegs so //
analyzed: chu tshags zhes bya ba ni chu la sogs pa kun nas 'dzag par byed pa'i chu tshags ras la sogs pa las byas pa spyi la bsnyegs so //
translated: As for the term “water-strainer,” it refers to a water-strainer made of cloth or some other material that is used to filter out all the flowing water.

original: chu tshags gru gsum ma ma ril ba zhabs tshags can nam bsal tshags kyang nye bar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: chu tshags gru gsum ma ma ril ba zhabs tshags can nam bsal tshags kyang nye bar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should also keep a three-cornered water-strainer, a water-pot with a spout, or a water-strainer.

original: chu tshags gru gsum zhes bya ba de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: chu tshags gru gsum zhes bya ba de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is a three-cornered water-strainer like?

original: ras la sogs pa chu tshags su rung ba'i rdzas las kha logs gru gsum pa zhabs 'phyang ba byin gyis phra mor btsems pa smyig ma'am khar ba la sogs pa'i yang mig gru gsum yu ba can la bu gu phug @169b pa las dpyangs pa'o //
analyzed: ras la sogs pa chu tshags su rung ba'i rdzas las kha logs gru gsum pa zhabs 'phyang ba byin gyis phra mor btsems pa smyig ma'am khar ba la sogs pa'i yang mig gru gsum yu ba can la bu gu phug @169b pa las dpyangs pa'o //
translated: It is made of a suitable material such as cloth, with a three-cornered mouth, a hanging bottom, and a small opening. It is sewn together with bamboo or wood, and a hole is made in the handle of a three-cornered bamboo or wooden tube, and it is hung from that.

original: ril ba zhabs tshags can zhes bya ba de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ril ba zhabs tshags can zhes bya ba de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is a water-pot with a spout like?

original: sa las byas pa yang rung /🔽shing las byas pa yang rung zangs ma las byas pa yang rung ba'i snod ril ba'i dbyibs 'dra ba /
analyzed: sa las byas pa yang rung / shing las byas pa yang rung zangs ma las byas pa yang rung ba'i snod ril ba'i dbyibs 'dra ba /
translated: It can be made of clay,🔽wood, or copper. It is shaped like a pot.

original: zhabs ril gyis zo ba zhabs ma bcug pa 'dra bar gsod ldong du gzhag par chu tshags su rung ba'i ras kyis nang rol nas zhabs thabs su spyar ba /
analyzed: zhabs ril gyis zo ba zhabs ma bcug pa 'dra bar gsod ldong du gzhag par chu tshags su rung ba'i ras kyis nang rol nas zhabs thabs su spyar ba /
translated: The bottom is completely flat, like the bottom of a bucket. It is placed in a container that is suitable for a water strainer. The bottom is covered from the inside with a cloth that is sewn together.

original: kha'i mthongs phye ste rlung gi gsang btod la /
analyzed: kha'i mthongs phye ste rlung gi gsang btod la /
translated: The opening is left open and the air hole is opened.

original: zhabs chu'i 'jings su btsir te chu nang du gzhib thabs su btsags la /
analyzed: zhabs chu'i 'jings su btsir te chu nang du gzhib thabs su btsags la /
translated: The bottom is pressed into the water and the water is squeezed out from the inside.

original: phyir dbyung khar kha'i mthongs bkag ste rlung gi gsang bsubs nas chu rang gang dang bcas te dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: phyir dbyung khar kha'i mthongs bkag ste rlung gi gsang bsubs nas chu rang gang dang bcas te dbyung ba'o //
translated: When it is taken out, the opening is closed and the air hole is covered. The water comes out together with the air.

original: bsal tshags zhes bya ba de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: bsal tshags zhes bya ba de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is a water strainer like?

original: dpyang chags la sogs pas chu btsags pa'i nang du srog chags 'tshigs pa rnams khron pa 'am lu ma 'am 'bab chu la sogs pa'i 'jings su gang nas bcus pa'i gzhi nyid du phyir bskyal ba'i snod sa las byas pa yang rung /
analyzed: dpyang chags la sogs pas chu btsags pa'i nang du srog chags 'tshigs pa rnams khron pa 'am lu ma 'am 'bab chu la sogs pa'i 'jings su gang nas bcus pa'i gzhi nyid du phyir bskyal ba'i snod sa las byas pa yang rung /
translated: The container for the living beings that are killed by straining the water with a cloth filter and so on is a vessel made of earth, wood or copper, shaped like a bucket or a pot, with a rope attached to the mouth and the bottom.

original: shing ngam zangs ma las byas pa yang rung zo ba'am bum ba'i dbyibs 'dra ba kha dang zhabs nas dpyang thag re re btags pa thur du btang ba'i tshe ni kha'i dpyang thag bsdams te zhabs kyi dpyad thag klod de 'jings su bor ba'i tshe ni kha'i dpyang🔽thag klod de /
analyzed: shing ngam zangs ma las byas pa yang rung zo ba'am bum ba'i dbyibs 'dra ba kha dang zhabs nas dpyang thag re re btags pa thur du btang ba'i tshe ni kha'i dpyang thag bsdams te zhabs kyi dpyad thag klod de 'jings su bor ba'i tshe ni kha'i dpyang thag klod de /
translated: When it is lowered, the rope attached to the mouth is tightened and the rope attached to the bottom is loosened. When it is raised, the rope attached to the mouth is loosened and the rope attached to the bottom is tightened.

original: zhabs kyi dpyang thag bsdams nas khas sbub ste srog chags dbo ba kha nas mi g-yeng bar dal bus chur btang ba'i snod yin no //
analyzed: zhabs kyi dpyang thag bsdams nas khas sbub ste srog chags dbo ba kha nas mi g-yeng bar dal bus chur btang ba'i snod yin no //
translated: It is turned upside down and the living beings are slowly poured into the water without being spilled.

original: bya ma bum dang ril ba dag gis chu rung ba bcus pa nyid ni chu tshags dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: bya ma bum dang ril ba dag gis chu rung ba bcus pa nyid ni chu tshags dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: The water that is poured with a ladle or a pot is similar to a water strainer.

original: lam ji srid du chu rung ba yod pa nyid yin na de yang chu tshags dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: lam ji srid du chu rung ba yod pa nyid yin na de yang chu tshags dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: If there is drinkable water on the road, it is like a water filter.

original: chu tshags la sogs pa de med par ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: chu tshags la sogs pa de med par ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go on a journey without a water filter and so on.

original: dge slong zhe 'gras pa nad dang bcas pa dang lhan cig ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhe 'gras pa nad dang bcas pa dang lhan cig ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go on a journey with a hostile monk who is sick.

original: gal te de dang 'grogs te mi 'gro na tshul khrims dang srog la sogs pa'i bar chad byed pa de lta bu'i rkyen yod na gtsug lag khang nyid du des bzod pa gsol nas sam de yis bzod par byas te lhan cig ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar bya'o
analyzed: gal te de dang 'grogs te mi 'gro na tshul khrims dang srog la sogs pa'i bar chad byed pa de lta bu'i rkyen yod na gtsug lag khang nyid du des bzod pa gsol nas sam de yis bzod par byas te lhan cig ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro bar bya'o
translated: If one does not go with him, and there are conditions such as an obstacle to morality or life, then one should go on a journey with him after asking for his forgiveness in the monastery, or after he has forgiven you.

original: // chu tshags la sogs pa'i yo byad ni bya ba byed pa'i dus nyid na yod na yod pa nyid yin gyi ;
analyzed: // chu tshags la sogs pa'i yo byad ni bya ba byed pa'i dus nyid na yod na yod pa nyid yin gyi ;
translated: The water filter and so on are only present when the activity is being performed.

original: yul dang dus kyis bskal pa na yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dus kyis bskal pa na yod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not present when separated by space and time.

original: dge slong gzhan gyis 'di ltar chu btsags pa'i dus der chu tshags sbyin no zhes khas blangs pa ni chu tshags de dang ldan pa nyid yin gyi gal te de ltar khas ma blangs na dge slong gzhan la chu tshags yod du zin kyang dge slong de la
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyis 'di ltar chu btsags pa'i dus der chu tshags sbyin no zhes khas blangs pa ni chu tshags de dang ldan pa nyid yin gyi gal te de ltar khas ma blangs na dge slong gzhan la chu tshags yod du zin kyang dge slong de la
translated: If he has not promised, then even if another monk has a water filter,

original: chu tshags yod pa nyid ma @170a * //
analyzed: chu tshags yod pa nyid ma @170a * //
translated: that monk does not possess a water filter.

original: yin no // ljongs rgyu ba'i tshe 'bral ba ni chu tshags sbyin par pha rol pos khas ma blangs na gzhi nas cha ba'i tshe nas de'i chu tshags la brten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yin no // ljongs rgyu ba'i tshe 'bral ba ni chu tshags sbyin par pha rol pos khas ma blangs na gzhi nas cha ba'i tshe nas de'i chu tshags la brten par mi bya'o //
translated: If he is traveling in a country where he will not be separated from his water filter, he should not rely on another’s water filter from the time he sets out if the other has not agreed to give him his.

original: rgyang grags lnga'i mtha' tshun chad chus phongs par mi 'gyur bas nges par 'gro ba ni ljongs rgyu ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyang grags lnga'i mtha' tshun chad chus phongs par mi 'gyur bas nges par 'gro ba ni ljongs rgyu ba yang ma yin la /
translated: If he is traveling to a place where he will definitely go, but where there is no water for five krośas, he should not go without a water filter.

original: der chu tshags med par yang 'gror rung ngo //
analyzed: der chu tshags med par yang 'gror rung ngo //
translated: But if he is traveling to a place where there is water, he may go without a water filter.

original: dar song na chu tshags kyang yod par 'gyur bar ma nges par rang gi chu tshags bzhag ste 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dar song na chu tshags kyang yod par 'gyur bar ma nges par rang gi chu tshags bzhag ste 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: If he is traveling to a place where there is water, but he is not sure that he will find a water filter there, he should not go without his own water filter.

original: chu tshags gcig yod na des dge 'dun man chad dge slong du ma dag chu tshags dang ldan pa nyid du gyur pas des ljongs rgyu zhing 'dong du rung ngo //
analyzed: chu tshags gcig yod na des dge 'dun man chad dge slong du ma dag chu tshags dang ldan pa nyid du gyur pas des ljongs rgyu zhing 'dong du rung ngo //
translated: If he has a water strainer, then the Sangha and so forth, down to the monks who are his companions, will be endowed with water strainers and it will be suitable for them to go wandering in the countryside.

original: rgyang grags lnga'i mtha' tshun chad du 'gro ba la yang chu rgyun mgyogs ba sngar thal ba lta na chu tshags bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyang grags lnga'i mtha' tshun chad du 'gro ba la yang chu rgyun mgyogs ba sngar thal ba lta na chu tshags bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If he goes within a distance of five kishva, and the current of the river is fast and the water is clear, he should carry the water strainer.

original: chu rgyun mgyogs pa de la chu rgyun phyogs su rjes su 'brel par 'gro bas ni rgyang grags kyi mgor chu brtags ba des rgyang grags gcig gi bar du brtag mi dgos par 'jug tu rung la /
analyzed: chu rgyun mgyogs pa de la chu rgyun phyogs su rjes su 'brel par 'gro bas ni rgyang grags kyi mgor chu brtags ba des rgyang grags gcig gi bar du brtag mi dgos par 'jug tu rung la /
translated: If the current of the river is fast, and he goes with the current, then at the beginning of the kishva he should examine the water and it will be suitable to enter without examining it for one kishva.

original: de man chad ni yang de bzhin du brtag par bya'o /
analyzed: de man chad ni yang de bzhin du brtag par bya'o /
translated: From there on he should examine it again.

original: rgyang grags gcig gi bar der gal te chu gzhan dang 'dres par gyur na de yan chad du sngar brtags pas 'jug tu rung gi de man chad yang brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyang grags gcig gi bar der gal te chu gzhan dang 'dres par gyur na de yan chad du sngar brtags pas 'jug tu rung gi de man chad yang brtag par bya'o //
translated: If within that kishva the water mixes with another river, then it will be suitable to enter beyond that by the previous examination, but below that he should examine it again.

original: chu'i kha'i nye 'khor ni 'dom gang yin pas chu brtags pa'i gnas nas 'dom gang khor khor yug tshun chad ni brtags pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: chu'i kha'i nye 'khor ni 'dom gang yin pas chu brtags pa'i gnas nas 'dom gang khor khor yug tshun chad ni brtags pa nyid yin no //
translated: The water should be examined within a distance of one fathom from the place where it is examined.

original: lha'i mig ma yin pa sha'i mig tha mal bas brtags te /
analyzed: lha'i mig ma yin pa sha'i mig tha mal bas brtags te /
translated: The examination is done with the ordinary fleshly eye, not with the divine eye.

original: dag pa nyid kyi chu ni dag pa yin na //
analyzed: dag pa nyid kyi chu ni dag pa yin na //
translated: The water is pure if it is clear.

original: chu mi g-yo ba nyid dang rnyog pa med pa la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: chu mi g-yo ba nyid dang rnyog pa med pa la brtag par bya'o //
translated: The water should be examined for its stillness and lack of turbidity.

original: bum pa gang ba nyid la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa gang ba nyid la brtag par bya'o //
translated: The water should be examined for its fullness.

original: chu brtags pa de la yun ni bya ba las 'das par bgrang ba'i yun ring po nyid du mi bya ste /🔽ji srid kyis ba lang drug dang ldan pa'i shing rta smyig ma'i shar bas bkang ba g-yangs kyis lan cig 'khor bar 'gyur ba de srid dam /
analyzed: chu brtags pa de la yun ni bya ba las 'das par bgrang ba'i yun ring po nyid du mi bya ste / ji srid kyis ba lang drug dang ldan pa'i shing rta smyig ma'i shar bas bkang ba g-yangs kyis lan cig 'khor bar 'gyur ba de srid dam /
translated: The examination of the water should not be done for a long time, beyond the time required for the performance of the rite.

original: ji srid kyis sems dag par gyur pa de srid du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid kyis sems dag par gyur pa de srid du brtag par bya'o //
translated: It should be done for as long as it takes a cart drawn by six oxen to make a round trip, or for as long as it takes to purify the mind.

original: gal te la la chu'i srog chags la the tshom za ba'am mi mthong na de'i tshe thur ma'am rtsa'am shing bu rtse mo 'jam pos srog chags dag bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te la la chu'i srog chags la the tshom za ba'am mi mthong na de'i tshe thur ma'am rtsa'am shing bu rtse mo 'jam pos srog chags dag bstan par bya'o //
translated: If one is in doubt about the presence of small creatures in water, or if one does not see them, one may drink the water after straining it with a cloth or with one’s hand.

original: de dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i lam du mi dor ro //
analyzed: de dag 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i lam du mi dor ro //
translated: One should not throw into a place where there are small creatures things that will kill them, such as grain, grass, or wood.

original: de las gzhan pa zhig dang rtsva shig la sogs pa dag kyang 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i lam du mi dor ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhig dang rtsva shig la sogs pa dag kyang 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i lam du mi dor ro //
translated: One should not throw into a place where there are small creatures things that will kill them, such as grain, grass, or wood.

original: gal te mar me'i nang du srog chags ltung na mar me snang bar byed pa'i 'od khang gis mar me de g-yogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mar me'i nang du srog chags ltung na mar me snang bar byed pa'i 'od khang gis mar me de g-yogs par bya'o //
translated: If small creatures have fallen into the lamp, one should cover the lamp with a vessel so that they may escape.

original: 'od khar de ci @170b 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'od khar de ci @170b 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the shape of the vessel?

original: smyig tshal gyi gze ba dar dkar ram lhang tsher srab mos g-yogs pa ni 'od khang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: smyig tshal gyi gze ba dar dkar ram lhang tsher srab mos g-yogs pa ni 'od khang zhes bya ste /
translated: It is like a bamboo tube covered with white silk or thin cotton cloth.

original: yul gzhan dag ni ting khang zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan dag ni ting khang zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: In other countries it is called a “lamp house.”

original: 'od khang ma rnyed na mig brgya bas g-yogs su rung ngo //
analyzed: 'od khang ma rnyed na mig brgya bas g-yogs su rung ngo //
translated: If one cannot find a lamp house, one may cover the lamp with one’s hand.

original: mig brgya pas zhes bya ba ni ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: mig brgya pas zhes bya ba ni ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is a “hundred-fold eye”?

original: dang po nas sa las byas pa'i snod khrol ma'i mig lta bu'i bu gu mang po can nam /
analyzed: dang po nas sa las byas pa'i snod khrol ma'i mig lta bu'i bu gu mang po can nam /
translated: The first is a vessel made of clay, with many holes like the eyes of a sieve.🔽The second is a vessel with holes made by striking a pot, etc. with a stone.

original: phyis bum pa la sogs pa la gsor bus de ltar phug pa'i snod bu gu can ni 'od khang mig brgya pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyis bum pa la sogs pa la gsor bus de ltar phug pa'i snod bu gu can ni 'od khang mig brgya pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A vessel with holes is called a “hundred-eyed light house.”

original: skra dang rda ma dang / rngog ma la sogs pa'i rnyis sbrul gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: skra dang rda ma dang / rngog ma la sogs pa'i rnyis sbrul gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not catch a snake with the hair of the head, beard, or body hair, etc.

original: sbrul bsal ba la se gol gyi sgra phyung ste /
analyzed: sbrul bsal ba la se gol gyi sgra phyung ste /
translated: In order to remove the snake, one should snap one’s fingers

original: bzhin bzangs mig lam na ma 'dug shing ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin bzangs mig lam na ma 'dug shing ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: and say, “Good person, do not stay in the path of my sight.”

original: 'on kyang 'dug na dbyu gu skam khas dal bus rdza ma'am bum par bcug ste kha bcad nas rlung rgyu ba'i bu gu dag btod de bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dug na dbyu gu skam khas dal bus rdza ma'am bum par bcug ste kha bcad nas rlung rgyu ba'i bu gu dag btod de bsal bar bya'o //
translated: If it still stays, one should slowly put it into a pot or a vessel with a dry bamboo stick, cover the mouth, and make holes for the wind to pass through.

original: gal te thabs de lta bu ma grub na lcag khod dam shur bu'am shur bu phre'u 'am tha gu ras mas dkris pa'i zhags mig gis mgul bar bcings te dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te thabs de lta bu ma grub na lcag khod dam shur bu'am shur bu phre'u 'am tha gu ras mas dkris pa'i zhags mig gis mgul bar bcings te dor bar bya'o //
translated: If one is not successful with such a method, one should tie a noose made of a rope of cloth around its neck and throw it away.

original: thabs de ni rdza ma'am /
analyzed: thabs de ni rdza ma'am /
translated: That method is for a pot, etc.

original: bum par gzhug pa yang bya'o //
analyzed: bum par gzhug pa yang bya'o //
translated: And he should put it in a pot.

original: sbrul de gang du rang gis me gtong ba'i nyes dmigs su 'gyur ba'i tshang tshing gi nang du dor bar mi bya bar sa sgre bo la khung la sogs pa yod par dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbrul de gang du rang gis me gtong ba'i nyes dmigs su 'gyur ba'i tshang tshing gi nang du dor bar mi bya bar sa sgre bo la khung la sogs pa yod par dor bar bya'o //
translated: He should not throw the snake into a thicket where it would be burned by the fault of its own fire. He should throw it into a place with bare ground, without holes, etc.

original: khung du ma zhugs kyi bar du 'ol ba la sogs pas 'khyer ba bsrung ba'i phyir bsdad par bya'o //
analyzed: khung du ma zhugs kyi bar du 'ol ba la sogs pas 'khyer ba bsrung ba'i phyir bsdad par bya'o //
translated: He should stay there until it has entered a hole, in order to protect it from being carried off by a crow, etc.

original: shig rnams ni ras mas dkris te ka ba la sogs pa'i gzeb tu gzhag go //
analyzed: shig rnams ni ras mas dkris te ka ba la sogs pa'i gzeb tu gzhag go //
translated: He should wrap the lice in a piece of cotton and put them in a cage on a post, etc.

original: rtsva shig rnams ni gsing bar dor ba 'am yang na phyogs bsil bar dor ro //
analyzed: rtsva shig rnams ni gsing bar dor ba 'am yang na phyogs bsil bar dor ro //
translated: He should throw the grass lice on a lawn or in a cool place.

original: chu'i srog chags chu tshags kyis btsags pa phyir gzhug pa'i ched du dge 'dun dang gang zag gis kyang bsal tshags dang dpyang thag gnyis pa bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu'i srog chags chu tshags kyis btsags pa phyir gzhug pa'i ched du dge 'dun dang gang zag gis kyang bsal tshags dang dpyang thag gnyis pa bcang bar bya'o //
translated: For the purpose of letting out the water creatures that have been filtered out by the water strainer, both the Saṅgha and individuals should keep a strainer and a rope for hanging.

original: yang na chu tshags de nyid kyis gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na chu tshags de nyid kyis gzhug par bya ste /
translated: Or he should let them out with that very water strainer.

original: de la yang kha dang zhabs gnyis kar dpyang thag gnyis kyis gdags par bya'o //🔽chu tshags la srog chags dag chags pa bsal ba'i thabs ni bshal ba yin no //
analyzed: de la yang kha dang zhabs gnyis kar dpyang thag gnyis kyis gdags par bya'o // chu tshags la srog chags dag chags pa bsal ba'i thabs ni bshal ba yin no //
translated: Two ropes should be attached to it, one to the mouth and one to the base.🔽The method for removing living beings that have attached themselves to the water strainer is to rinse it.

original: chu tshags la dri ma chags pa bsal ba'i thabs ni chur bkru ba yin no //
analyzed: chu tshags la dri ma chags pa bsal ba'i thabs ni chur bkru ba yin no //
translated: The method for removing stains that have attached themselves to the water strainer is to wash it with water.

original: chu tshags rul ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i thabs ni skam pas so //
analyzed: chu tshags rul ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i thabs ni skam pas so //
translated: The method for preventing the water strainer from rotting is to dry it.

original: dri ma bkru ba dang skam pa de gnyi ga la yang dam du btsir te chu gzags na phan pa nyid do //
analyzed: dri ma bkru ba dang skam pa de gnyi ga la yang dam du btsir te chu gzags na phan pa nyid do //
translated: In both cases, washing and drying, it is helpful to squeeze it tightly and let the water drain out.

original: chu rung ba rnam pa lnga po dge 'dun gyis rung ba dang / gang zag gis rung ba dang / chu tshags kyis rung ba dang / khron pas rung ba dang / nyin zhag @171a * //
analyzed: chu rung ba rnam pa lnga po dge 'dun gyis rung ba dang / gang zag gis rung ba dang / chu tshags kyis rung ba dang / khron pas rung ba dang / nyin zhag @171a * //
translated: There are five types of suitable water: suitable for the saṅgha, suitable for individuals, suitable for water strainers, suitable for wells, and suitable for one day.

original: gcig rung ba rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa'i kha na ma tho ba med do //
analyzed: gcig rung ba rnyed pa'i shes pas 'jug pa'i kha na ma tho ba med do //
translated: If you find any of these, there is no offense if you use it with the understanding that it is suitable.

original: dge 'dun gyis rung ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun 'di la srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu tha snyad byed par mi spyod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis rung ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun 'di la srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu tha snyad byed par mi spyod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Sanctioned by the community” means that the community has agreed not to use water that contains living beings.

original: gang zag gis rung ba zhes bya ba ni gang zag rab tu byung ba dang khyim pa yang gal te gang zag 'di srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu mi spyod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag gis rung ba zhes bya ba ni gang zag rab tu byung ba dang khyim pa yang gal te gang zag 'di srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu mi spyod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Sanctioned by an individual” means that an individual, whether ordained or a layperson, has agreed not to use water that contains living beings.

original: chu tshags kyis rung ba zhes bya ba ni chu tshags 'dis btsags pa'i chu dus thams cad du dag pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chu tshags kyis rung ba zhes bya ba ni chu tshags 'dis btsags pa'i chu dus thams cad du dag pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Sanctioned by a strainer” means that water that has been strained with this strainer is pure at all times.

original: khron pas rung ba zhes bya ba ni khron pa'i chu 'di la nam yang srog chags dang bcas par ma gyur to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khron pas rung ba zhes bya ba ni khron pa'i chu 'di la nam yang srog chags dang bcas par ma gyur to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Sanctioned by a well” means that the water in this well has never contained living beings.

original: nyin zhag gcig rung ba zhes bya ba ni chu bcus pa dang khron pa dag gis nyi ma 'char kha tshun chad brtags pa nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig rung ba zhes bya ba ni chu bcus pa dang khron pa dag gis nyi ma 'char kha tshun chad brtags pa nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: “Sanctioned for a day” means that water that has been drawn and a well have been examined up to sunrise.

original: dge 'dun gyis rkang khrus snod stong par mthong na dgang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis rkang khrus snod stong par mthong na dgang bar bya'o //
translated: If the Saṅgha sees that the foot-washing vessel is empty, it should be filled.

original: dge 'dun gyis chu dang mar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa'i snod kyang bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis chu dang mar dang 'bru mar la sogs pa'i snod kyang bcang bar bya'o //
translated: The Saṅgha should also keep vessels for water, ghee, oil, and so on.

original: dge 'dun gyis chu snod la sogs pa snod spyad du gtogs so cog brubs pa dang / dbyung ba la sogs pa ni dge slong snod spyad brubs pa'i las yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis chu snod la sogs pa snod spyad du gtogs so cog brubs pa dang / dbyung ba la sogs pa ni dge slong snod spyad brubs pa'i las yin no //
translated: The Saṅgha should fill and empty all the vessels that are part of the water vessel and so on. The Saṅgha should do the work of filling the vessels.

original: de dag sbyin pa dang blang ba dag kyang de'i las yin no //🔽khyim bdag dge 'dun la snod spyad rnying pa brnyan pa nyid la de yod pa nyid na snod spyad brubs pas g-yar por sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag sbyin pa dang blang ba dag kyang de'i las yin no // khyim bdag dge 'dun la snod spyad rnying pa brnyan pa nyid la de yod pa nyid na snod spyad brubs pas g-yar por sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The work of giving and receiving those is also its work.🔽If the Saṅgha has old vessels that are to be discarded, and if they are still usable, they should be given out as alms.

original: khyim pa yon bdag rnams gtsug lag khang du 'ongs te snod spyad rnying pa brnyan pa nyid la yang de yod pa nyid na snod spyad brubs pas g-yar por sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa yon bdag rnams gtsug lag khang du 'ongs te snod spyad rnying pa brnyan pa nyid la yang de yod pa nyid na snod spyad brubs pas g-yar por sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If lay donors come to the monastery and see that the old vessels are to be discarded, and if they are still usable, they should be given out as alms.

original: dge slong dag dge 'dun la snod spyad brnyan tam slong na snod spyad brubs pas snod spyad sar pa dag yod pa nyid ni gtan sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag dge 'dun la snod spyad brnyan tam slong na snod spyad brubs pas snod spyad sar pa dag yod pa nyid ni gtan sbyin par bya'o //
translated: “Monks, if the Saṅgha is offered a vessel or a utensil, it should be given to the one who is the most senior in the Saṅgha.🔽If the Saṅgha is offered a vessel or a utensil, it should be given to the one who is the most senior in the Saṅgha.🔽If the Saṅgha is offered a vessel or a utensil, it should be given to the one who is the most senior in the Saṅgha.

original: snod sbyang kye ched du mdzod khang bskor bar bya'o //🔽sa dang zangs ma'i snod spyad dag so sor gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: snod sbyang kye ched du mdzod khang bskor bar bya'o // sa dang zangs ma'i snod spyad dag so sor gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If the Saṅgha is offered a vessel or a utensil, it should be given to the one who is the most senior in the Saṅgha.🔽If the Saṅgha is offered a vessel or a utensil, it should be given to the one who is the most senior in the Saṅgha.

original: de'i dge 'dun gyi chu nye bar gzhag par bya'o //🔽chu de gar bab bab tu mi gzhag go //🔽de'i ched du chu khang bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dge 'dun gyi chu nye bar gzhag par bya'o // chu de gar bab bab tu mi gzhag go // de'i ched du chu khang bya'o //

original: chu khang ni gtsug lag khang gi rgyab logs dang rgyab kyi g-yas logs kyi mtshams sam lho nub kyi mtshams su bya'o //🔽chu khang de la skar khung gdod pa dang / so phag gi gcal dgram pa dang / chu khung gdod pa dang / sgo gdod pa dang / sge glegs dang yang mig gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: chu khang ni gtsug lag khang gi rgyab logs dang rgyab kyi g-yas logs kyi mtshams sam lho nub kyi mtshams su bya'o //🔽chu khang de la skar khung gdod pa dang / so phag gi gcal dgram pa dang / chu khung gdod pa dang / sgo gdod pa dang / sge glegs dang yang mig gzhug par bya'o //
translated: If the Saṅgha is offered a vessel or a utensil, it should be given to the one who is the most senior in the Saṅgha.🔽If the Saṅgha is offered a vessel or a utensil

original: chu khung de'i nang du chu tshags gzhag pa'i phyir gdang bu bya'o //
analyzed: chu khung de'i nang du chu tshags gzhag pa'i phyir gdang bu bya'o //
translated: A rack should be made for placing the water-filters in.

original: chu snod shing gi khri'u dag gi steng du gzhag par bya'o //

analyzed: kun dga' bo song la dge slong dag la de bzhin gshegs pa ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyur gshegs na khyed las gang de bzhin gshegs pa dang thabs cig ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyur 'gro bar spro ba des chos gos kyi las gyis shig ces
