original: bsgo shig / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos dge slong rnams la de skad bsgo ba rgyal po'i khab pa'i tshong pa de dag gis thos nas de dag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas gsal pa /
analyzed: bsgo shig / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos dge slong rnams la de skad bsgo ba rgyal po'i khab pa'i tshong pa de dag gis thos nas de dag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas gsal pa /
translated: When the merchants of Rājagṛha heard that the venerable Ānanda had given this order, they went to the Blessed One, bowed their heads at his feet, and said,

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pas rgyal po'i khab nas mnyan yod kyi bar ji tsam bar bdag cag las na bza' dang bsod snyoms dang gnas mal dang bsnyung ba'i rkyen dang sman gyi yo byad dag bzhed par ci gnang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pas rgyal po'i khab nas mnyan yod kyi bar ji tsam bar bdag cag las na bza' dang bsod snyoms dang gnas mal dang bsnyung ba'i rkyen dang sman gyi yo byad dag bzhed par ci gnang /
translated: “Blessed One, please accept from us Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding, medicine for the sick, and other necessities for as long as the Blessed One and the saṅgha of monks remain in Rājagṛha on their way to Śrāvastī.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to them by his silence.

original: de nas rgyal po'i khab pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs mal ci tsam pa dris nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dgongs mal bzhin du rgyang grags bcur gshegs pa thos nas
analyzed: de nas rgyal po'i khab pa'i tshong pa rab tu mang po de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la de bzhin gshegs pa'i dgongs mal ci tsam pa dris nas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dgongs mal bzhin du rgyang grags bcur gshegs pa thos nas
translated: Then the many merchants of Rājagṛha, having asked Venerable Ānanda about the size of the Tathāgata’s bed, heard that it was the size of a universal monarch’s bed and that it extended for ten fathoms.🔽They prepared for the Blessed One and the saṅgha of monks🔽a set of ten beds, each extending for ten fathoms.

original: / de dag gis rgyang grags bcu bcur bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i tshogs dag bshams nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa @178a * //
analyzed: / de dag gis rgyang grags bcu bcur bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i tshogs dag bshams nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa @178a * //
translated: The Blessed One, together with the saṅgha of monks,

original: mnyan yod ga la ba de logs su ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs so //
analyzed: mnyan yod ga la ba de logs su ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs so //
translated: proceeded to Śrāvastī, traveling through the countryside.

original: tshong pa de dag dang mu stegs gcer bu pa zhig dang lhan cig 'gro ba de phongs pa'i dus la bab cing bkres pas nyam thag par gyur nas /
analyzed: tshong pa de dag dang mu stegs gcer bu pa zhig dang lhan cig 'gro ba de phongs pa'i dus la bab cing bkres pas nyam thag par gyur nas /
translated: One of the merchants was traveling with a naked ascetic. When the time came for them to be in need, they were afflicted by hunger.

original: de dge slong rnams kyi gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: de dge slong rnams kyi gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: He went to the monks and said,

original: khyed cag gi ston pa ni bzang po la mos pa yin te /
analyzed: khyed cag gi ston pa ni bzang po la mos pa yin te /
translated: “Your teacher is devoted to the good.

original: de gser gyi thong gshol gyis zhing rmos pa des khyed cag la zas ro brgya pa dang / gos 'bum ri ba dang / khang pa brtsegs pa lnga brgya pa yang rjes su gnang bas khyed cag re zhig tshe 'di nyid la yang bde ba la reg par gnas la /
analyzed: de gser gyi thong gshol gyis zhing rmos pa des khyed cag la zas ro brgya pa dang / gos 'bum ri ba dang / khang pa brtsegs pa lnga brgya pa yang rjes su gnang bas khyed cag re zhig tshe 'di nyid la yang bde ba la reg par gnas la /
translated: He has given you permission to enjoy food of a hundred flavors, clothes worth a hundred thousand, and five hundred mansions, by plowing the fields with golden plows. You will enjoy happiness in this life.

original: tshe 'di nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And after you die, you will be reborn among the gods.”

original: kho bo cag gi ston pa ni ngan pa la mos pa yin te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ston pa ni ngan pa la mos pa yin te /
translated: “Our teacher is devoted to the bad.

original: de til gyi tshigs ma'i gshol gyis zhing rmo bas des kho bo cag la gcer bu dang sgre byi dang sprong zan dang / yul rgyu ba dang sa la nyal ba las gzhan rjes su ma gnang bas kho bo cag ni re zhig tshe 'di nyid la yang sdug bsngal la reg par gnas shing /
analyzed: de til gyi tshigs ma'i gshol gyis zhing rmo bas des kho bo cag la gcer bu dang sgre byi dang sprong zan dang / yul rgyu ba dang sa la nyal ba las gzhan rjes su ma gnang bas kho bo cag ni re zhig tshe 'di nyid la yang sdug bsngal la reg par gnas shing /
translated: He plowed the fields with a plow made of sesame seeds. He did not allow us to do anything other than go naked, beg for food, be a beggar, wander the land, and sleep on the ground. We are now living in suffering in this very life.

original: 'di nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyang sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyang sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After we die, we will be reborn among the hell beings.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bsams pa /
translated: The monks thought,

original: gcer bu pa shes pa can 'di dad par gyur to snyam nas de dag gis de la smras pa /
analyzed: gcer bu pa shes pa can 'di dad par gyur to snyam nas de dag gis de la smras pa /
translated: “This learned naked one has become faithful.” They said to him,

original: shes pa can ji ltar 'tsho dka' bas so //
analyzed: shes pa can ji ltar 'tsho dka' bas so //
translated: “Learned one, how do you live?”🔽“Because it is difficult.”

original: dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi lhag ma 'dod dam /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi lhag ma 'dod dam /
translated: “Do you want the leftovers from the monks’ begging bowls?”

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

original: gal te dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi lhag ma ma zos na ltogs te 'chi bar 'gyur ro snyam nas des smras pa /
analyzed: gal te dge slong rnams kyi lhung bzed kyi lhag ma ma zos na ltogs te 'chi bar 'gyur ro snyam nas des smras pa /
translated: “If I do not eat the leftovers from the monks’ begging bowls, I will die of hunger.” He said,🔽“I want them.”

original: 'tshal lo // dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'tshal lo // dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks said,

original: shes pa can dge slong dag zan za ba'i mig lam du 'dug cig dang / khyod la lhung bzed kyi lhag ma sbyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa can dge slong dag zan za ba'i mig lam du 'dug cig dang / khyod la lhung bzed kyi lhag ma sbyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: “You should sit in the monks’ line of sight while they eat, and they will give you the leftovers from their bowls.”

original: de der 'dug pa dang dge slong rnams kyis de la lhung bzed kyi lhag ma byin nas de'i slong phor khur bas byur bur byas so //
analyzed: de der 'dug pa dang dge slong rnams kyis de la lhung bzed kyi lhag ma byin nas de'i slong phor khur bas byur bur byas so //
translated: He sat there, and the monks gave him the leftovers from their bowls. He filled his begging bowl to overflowing.

original: de slong phor khur bas byur bur byas pa thogs te /
analyzed: de slong phor khur bas byur bur byas pa thogs te /
translated: He took his overflowing begging bowl

original: phyir byung ba de ded dpon gyis mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: phyir byung ba de ded dpon gyis mthong nas smras pa /
translated: and left. The captain saw him and said,

original: gcer bu pa khyod la khur ba sus byin des smras pa /
analyzed: gcer bu pa khyod la khur ba sus byin des smras pa /
translated: “Who gave you this food, naked one?”

original: khyod kyi yon gnas ni dge slong de dag yin la /🔽de dag gi yon gnas ni kho bo yin la /
analyzed: khyod kyi yon gnas ni dge slong de dag yin la / de dag gi yon gnas ni kho bo yin la /
translated: “Your recipients of offerings are those monks,🔽and they are my recipients of offerings.

original: kho bo la de dag gis phul lo /
analyzed: kho bo la de dag gis phul lo /
translated: They gave it to me.”

original: ded dpon gyis spyos te btang ba dang / lam de nas 'gron pa don mthun tshur 'ong ba dag cig gi zla la gcer bu pa zhig 'ong ba des de @178b mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: ded dpon gyis spyos te btang ba dang / lam de nas 'gron pa don mthun tshur 'ong ba dag cig gi zla la gcer bu pa zhig 'ong ba des de @178b mthong nas smras pa /
translated: On the way, a group of merchants who were returning from a trip saw him. A naked ascetic came along and asked him,

original: shes pa can nyod pa nyod dam /
analyzed: shes pa can nyod pa nyod dam /
translated: “Wise one, are you tired? Are you tired?”

original: des smras pa nyod do //
analyzed: des smras pa nyod do //
translated: “I am tired,” he replied.

original: gang nas des smras pa /
analyzed: gang nas des smras pa /
translated: “Where are you from?”

original: khyim bdag sgre byi 'di dag kho bo la stobs par byed do //
analyzed: khyim bdag sgre byi 'di dag kho bo la stobs par byed do //
translated: “These householders are giving me strength.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The naked ascetic said,

original: gcer bu pa khyod ni byas pa mi shes pa yin te /
analyzed: gcer bu pa khyod ni byas pa mi shes pa yin te /
translated: “Naked ascetic, you don’t know what you’re talking about.

original: 'di dag khyod kyi khyim bdag sgre byi dag yin nam /
analyzed: 'di dag khyod kyi khyim bdag sgre byi dag yin nam /
translated: Are these householders your friends?🔽Among them, five hundred groups have passed into parinirvāṇa, but have you seen even one wise person pass into parinirvāṇa?”

original: de dag las ni lnga brgya pa'i tshogs dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das par snang gi khyod kyis shes pa can ni gcig 'ga' yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mthong ngam zhes spyos te tshigs su bcad pa dag smras pa /
analyzed: de dag las ni lnga brgya pa'i tshogs dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das par snang gi khyod kyis shes pa can ni gcig 'ga' yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mthong ngam zhes spyos te tshigs su bcad pa dag smras pa /
translated: He scolded him and spoke these verses:

original: ngan pa ci'i phyir sa la 'bying mi byed //
analyzed: ngan pa ci'i phyir sa la 'bying mi byed //
translated: “Why don’t you fall to the ground, you evil one?

original: ci'i phyir lce yang tshal pa brgyar mi 'gas //
analyzed: ci'i phyir lce yang tshal pa brgyar mi 'gas //
translated: Why does your tongue not split into a hundred parts?🔽Why do you not shoot forth vajra-bolts,

original: khyod kyi lus la ci phyir gsang ba dag / rdo rje'i ser ba mdung thung mda' mi 'phen //🔽ji ltar seng ge'i ltag ma za ba'i wa //
analyzed: khyod kyi lus la ci phyir gsang ba dag / rdo rje'i ser ba mdung thung mda' mi 'phen // ji ltar seng ge'i ltag ma za ba'i wa //
translated: spears, and arrows from your body?🔽Just as a jackal, wanting to eat🔽the lion’s leftovers,

original: seng ge nyid la gsod pa 'dod pa ltar //
analyzed: seng ge nyid la gsod pa 'dod pa ltar //
translated: wants to kill the lion itself,

original: de bzhin khyod kyang stobs bcu'i khyor zas za //
analyzed: de bzhin khyod kyang stobs bcu'i khyor zas za //
translated: so you, too, want to eat the leftovers of the one with ten powers

original: stobs bcu nyid la smod byed ma 'phags pa //
analyzed: stobs bcu nyid la smod byed ma 'phags pa //
translated: and to revile the one with ten powers yourself, you who are not noble.

original: gang du gang la nyes par bsten byas na //
analyzed: gang du gang la nyes par bsten byas na //
translated: When you associate with evil people,

original: mi ngan 'dris 'dra 'tsho ba 'thob pa las //
analyzed: mi ngan 'dris 'dra 'tsho ba 'thob pa las //
translated: you get a livelihood that is like a bad friend.

original: de ni nges par mdza' bshes dgra rnams la //
analyzed: de ni nges par mdza' bshes dgra rnams la //
translated: But when you are even-minded toward friends and enemies,

original: mnyam mdzad blo ldan thams cad mkhyen pa yin //
analyzed: mnyam mdzad blo ldan thams cad mkhyen pa yin //
translated: you are wise and omniscient.

original: mi rnams gang dag byas pa mi shes pa //
analyzed: mi rnams gang dag byas pa mi shes pa //
translated: People who do not know how to repay kindness

original: de dag khyim pas shin tu ngan par bsam //
analyzed: de dag khyim pas shin tu ngan par bsam //
translated: are thought to be very bad by householders.

original: khyi yang mi la byas pa shes snang na //
analyzed: khyi yang mi la byas pa shes snang na //
translated: Even dogs seem to know how to repay kindness to people,

original: sprul 'dra'i mi dag dug ni gtong bar byed /
analyzed: sprul 'dra'i mi dag dug ni gtong bar byed /
translated: but people who are like snakes spread poison.

original: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig byung ba yin te /
translated: This is what happens when you are in this situation:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das re zhig 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas do not immediately establish the bases of training for the disciples in the Vinaya.

original: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na mnyan yod du byon to //
analyzed: bcas pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na mnyan yod du byon to //
translated: The origin of the rules is that the Blessed One, while wandering through the country of Kosala, arrived in Śrāvastī.

original: mnyan yod na skyed mos tshal zhig na yugs sa mo lnga brgya tsam dog pa 'khal zhing 'khod pa de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis gzugs brgyan cing gsal ba la sogs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: mnyan yod na skyed mos tshal zhig na yugs sa mo lnga brgya tsam dog pa 'khal zhing 'khod pa de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis gzugs brgyan cing gsal ba la sogs pa mthong ngo //
translated: In a park in Śrāvastī, about five hundred widows were spinning wool. They saw the Blessed Buddha, his body adorned and radiant with the thirty-two marks of a great being, and so forth.

original: mthong nas kyang 'di lta ste dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems can gyis dang por sangs rgyas mthong ba na sems nyams bde ba skyed par byed pa de ltar ni lo bcu gnyis su zhi gnas kyi sems go mas par byas pa dang
analyzed: mthong nas kyang 'di lta ste dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems can gyis dang por sangs rgyas mthong ba na sems nyams bde ba skyed par byed pa de ltar ni lo bcu gnyis su zhi gnas kyi sems go mas par byas pa dang
translated: Having seen him, just as the first seeing of the Buddha by a sentient being who has accumulated roots of virtue gives rise to mental bliss, in the same way, for twelve years, they had cultivated the mind of śamatha

original: / dbul pos gter mthong ba dang / bud med bu thob pa dang / rgyal srid la mngon par dga' ba rgyal srid la dbang bskur ba yang sems nyams bde ba @179a * //
analyzed: / dbul pos gter mthong ba dang / bud med bu thob pa dang / rgyal srid la mngon par dga' ba rgyal srid la dbang bskur ba yang sems nyams bde ba @179a * //
translated: Like a poor person who finds a treasure, like a woman in childbirth who finds relief, like a king who is anointed, the minds of those who delight in the kingdom of the Dharma are also filled with joy.

original: skyed par mi byed pas /
analyzed: skyed par mi byed pas /
translated: But the minds of those who delight in the kingdom of cyclic existence are not like that.

original: de dag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod do //🔽mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag gi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang rang bzhin thugs su chud nas ci nas kyang de dag gis 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ste rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas par gyur pa de ltar chos bstan pa
analyzed: de dag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'khod do // mtha' gcig tu 'khod nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag gi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang rang bzhin thugs su chud nas ci nas kyang de dag gis 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ste rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas par gyur pa de ltar chos bstan pa
translated: They went to the Blessed One, and upon their arrival they touched their heads to the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.🔽When they had sat to one side, the Blessed One, knowing their thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature, gave a teaching on the Dharma that was appropriate for them and that caused them to penetrate the real nature of phenomena.

original: mdzad pas de dag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob po //
analyzed: mdzad pas de dag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob po //
translated: Through that teaching on the Dharma, they destroyed with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection, and they manifested the resultant state of stream entry right where they sat.

original: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa sang bdag gi gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang zhes spyan drangs nas gnang ba dang / k'ara sh'a pa na dag khyer te tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo'i gan du song nas smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa sang bdag gi gdugs tshod gsol bar ci gnang zhes spyan drangs nas gnang ba dang / k'ara sh'a pa na dag khyer te tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo'i gan du song nas smras pa /
translated: They invited the Blessed One and the community of monks to take their meal the next day, and when they had accepted, they took some gold coins and went to the venerable Ānanda. They said, We have invited the community of monks headed by the Buddha to take their meal tomorrow.

original: btsun pa kun dga' bo bdag cag la snod spyad dang mi blas dang gnas mal gyi 'byor pa ma mchis kyi /
analyzed: btsun pa kun dga' bo bdag cag la snod spyad dang mi blas dang gnas mal gyi 'byor pa ma mchis kyi /
translated: They invited the Blessed One and the community of monks to take their meal the next day, and when they had accepted, they took some coins and went to the venerable Ānanda, saying, Venerable Ānanda, we do not have the means for utensils, servants, or bedding.

original: khyed kyis k'ara sh'a pa na 'di dag gis zhal zas sta gon bgyid du gsol cig dang / bdag cag mchis te brim par bgyi'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis k'ara sh'a pa na 'di dag gis zhal zas sta gon bgyid du gsol cig dang / bdag cag mchis te brim par bgyi'o //
translated: Please have the meal prepared with these coins, and we will come and serve it.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la khyim bdag khyod kyis 'di dag dang bdag nyid kyis k'ara sh'a pa na gzhan dag bsres te zhal zas bsod pa sta gon gyis la 'dir skur cig ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos khyim bdag mgon med zas sbyin la khyim bdag khyod kyis 'di dag dang bdag nyid kyis k'ara sh'a pa na gzhan dag bsres te zhal zas bsod pa sta gon gyis la 'dir skur cig ces smras so //
translated: The venerable Ānanda said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada, Householder, mix these with other coins of yours, prepare a good meal, and send it here.

original: des de ltar byas nas rgyal byed kyi tshal du bskur ro //
analyzed: des de ltar byas nas rgyal byed kyi tshal du bskur ro //
translated: He did as he was asked and sent it to the Jetavana.🔽The venerable Ānanda sent a message to those daughters of good family, “Prepare the food and come to distribute it to the Buddha and the community of monks.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos rigs kyi bu mo de dag la zhal zas lta gon byas kyi tshur gshegs la sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la brims shig ces spring ba dang / de dag lhags te smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos rigs kyi bu mo de dag la zhal zas lta gon byas kyi tshur gshegs la sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la brims shig ces spring ba dang / de dag lhags te smras pa /
translated: They came and said,

original: btsun pa kun dga' bo khyod bdag cag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen lags kyi tshur spyon khyed kyis kyang brim du gsol /
analyzed: btsun pa kun dga' bo khyod bdag cag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen lags kyi tshur spyon khyed kyis kyang brim du gsol /
translated: “Venerable Ānanda, you are our spiritual friend. Please come and distribute it yourself.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos brims par brtsams pa dang der gcer bu ma rgan gzhon gnyis shig 'ongs te de gnyis kyis khyim bdag mo de dag la zas bslangs pa na de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos brims par brtsams pa dang der gcer bu ma rgan gzhon gnyis shig 'ongs te de gnyis kyis khyim bdag mo de dag la zas bslangs pa na de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The venerable Ānanda began to distribute it. Two naked ascetics, one old and one young, came and asked those householders for food. They said,

original: zas 'di ni rgyal bu 'di'i yin no //
analyzed: zas 'di ni rgyal bu 'di'i yin no //
translated: “This food is for the prince.”

original: gcer bu ma de gnyis kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bslangs pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos ma bsams par brims pa na rgan mo la ni khur ba gcig byin /
analyzed: gcer bu ma de gnyis kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bslangs pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos ma bsams par brims pa na rgan mo la ni khur ba gcig byin /
translated: The two naked ascetics asked Venerable Ānanda for some, and without thinking, he gave them some.

original: gzhon nu ma la ni khur ba gnyis byin @179b nas /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma la ni khur ba gnyis byin @179b nas /
translated: He gave one cake to the old woman and two to the young woman.

original: rgan mos smras pa /
analyzed: rgan mos smras pa /
translated: The old woman said,🔽“Young woman, this prince is courting you, so prepare yourself.”

original: gzhon nu ma khyod rgyal bu 'dis khyod don du gnyer gyi sta gon gyis shig ces zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag gcer bu pa dang / gcer bu ma kun du rgyu dang / kun du rgyu mo la rang gi lag nas bca' ba dang bza' ba sbyor bar byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma khyod rgyal bu 'dis khyod don du gnyer gyi sta gon gyis shig ces zer nas dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag gcer bu pa dang / gcer bu ma kun du rgyu dang / kun du rgyu mo la rang gi lag nas bca' ba dang bza' ba sbyor bar byed ces smod par byed /
translated: “Why do monks give food with their own hands to naked ascetics, male and female ascetics, and female ascetics?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized them, saying,🔽“How can monks do this?”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba'i 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba'i 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, in this situation, with this introduction, and on this occasion, gathered the saṅgha of monks.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la rmas nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la rmas nas /
translated: He asked Venerable Ānanda,

original: mi brtson pa dang / mi sbyor ba dang / ma brtags par spyod pa rnam par smad de /
analyzed: mi brtson pa dang / mi sbyor ba dang / ma brtags par spyod pa rnam par smad de /
translated: and he condemned those who are not diligent, who do not apply themselves, and who practice without analysis.

original: brtson pa dang / spyod pa dang / brtags te spyod pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang gcer bu pa'am /🔽gcer bu ma kun du rgyu'am /
analyzed: brtson pa dang / spyod pa dang / brtags te spyod pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / yang dge slong gang gcer bu pa'am / gcer bu ma kun du rgyu'am /
translated: He praised those who are diligent, who apply themselves, and who practice with analysis. Seeing ten benefits, he laid down this training rule:

original: kun du rgyu mo la rang gi lag nas bca' ba dang bza' ba sbyin na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: kun du rgyu mo la rang gi lag nas bca' ba dang bza' ba sbyin na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: ‘If a monk gives with his own hands fresh or cooked food to a naked ascetic or to a female naked ascetic or to a wanderer or to a female wanderer, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location for this training rule is in Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
analyzed: gang zag ni tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo /
translated: The individual is Venerable Ānanda.

original: nyon mongs pa ni ma brtags par spyod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni ma brtags par spyod pa /
translated: The affliction is any of the three poisons.

original: nyes pa ni gcer bu pa la rang gi lag nas zas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gcer bu pa la rang gi lag nas zas sbyin pa'o //
translated: The offense is giving food with one’s own hand to a naked ascetic.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: In regard to that, “a monk” means a monk of this Dharma.

original: gcer bu pa'am gcer bu ma kun du rgyu'am kun du rgyu mo la zhes bya ba ni rtags 'di pa dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gcer bu pa'am gcer bu ma kun du rgyu'am kun du rgyu mo la zhes bya ba ni rtags 'di pa dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa la bya'o //
translated: “A naked ascetic or a naked ascetic woman” means one who has this sign and is a renunciant.

original: rang gi lag nas zhes bya ba ni lag pas lag par ro //
analyzed: rang gi lag nas zhes bya ba ni lag pas lag par ro //
translated: “With one’s own hand” means with one’s own hand.

original: bca' ba dang bza' ba zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga po dang bza' ba lnga po dag go //
analyzed: bca' ba dang bza' ba zhes bya ba ni bca' ba lnga po dang bza' ba lnga po dag go //
translated: “Food” means the five cooked foods and the five foods that are not cooked.

original: sbyin na zhes bya ba ni bsam mi dgos par ro //
analyzed: sbyin na zhes bya ba ni bsam mi dgos par ro //
translated: “If one gives” means if one gives without thinking.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense” means as before.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In regard to that, what is an offense?

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o //🔽de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis gzhan mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba gcer bu pa pho yang rung mo yang rung ba rtags 'di dang / rab tu byung ba 'di med par nye du dang @180a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi dang sbyor ba dang / sbyor ba'i sbyor bas ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / ltung ba med pa dang / bslab par bya ba dang / phyir bcos pa rnams kyis 'di'i mtshan nyid shes par bya'o // de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni dge slong gis gzhan mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba gcer bu pa pho yang rung mo yang rung ba rtags 'di dang / rab tu byung ba 'di med par nye du dang @180a * //
translated: Here, the characteristics of the downfalls, the non-downfalls, the trainings, and the restorations should be understood through the main part, the preparatory stage, and the preparatory stage of the preparatory stage.🔽Here, the presentation of the main part of the downfalls is this: If a fully ordained monk gives with his own hands to a naked ascetic of another religion, whether male or female, food and drink that are suitable for him and that are suitable for himself, except to a relative,

original: rab tu byung ba la ltos pa dang nad pa dang / sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang 'bral ba nyid ma gtogs pa la rang gi lag nas bca' ba dang / bza' ba rang dang de la rung ba dag de'i lus sam lus dang 'brel par sbyin na gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba la ltos pa dang nad pa dang / sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang 'bral ba nyid ma gtogs pa la rang gi lag nas bca' ba dang / bza' ba rang dang de la rung ba dag de'i lus sam lus dang 'brel par sbyin na gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: except in an emergency, except when there is a need to rely on a naked ascetic, except when the naked ascetic is free from sinful views, then it is a root downfall of giving to a naked ascetic.

original: gzhan mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba gcer bu pho yang rung mo yang rung brtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba gcer bu pho yang rung mo yang rung brtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the other is a naked ascetic of another religion, male or female, and the one who is ordained is not a monk or nun.

original: nye du dang rab tu byung ba la ltos pa dang / nad pa dang sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang dbral ba nyid ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: nye du dang rab tu byung ba la ltos pa dang / nad pa dang sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang dbral ba nyid ma gtogs pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the one who is ordained is not a monk or nun, and the other is a relative or a fellow monastic, or if the other is a patient or someone who has been separated from his or her wholesome thoughts.

original: rang gis sbyin pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rang gis sbyin pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the gift is given by oneself.

original: zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa rang dang de la rung ba de dag la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa rang dang de la rung ba de dag la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the gift is one of the five kinds of cooked food or one of the five kinds of fresh food, and the recipient is suitable to receive it.

original: de'i lus sam lus dang 'brel par sbyin pa la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: de'i lus sam lus dang 'brel par sbyin pa la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the gift is given to someone else’s body or to something connected to the body.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni gzhan mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba dang rang gis sbyin pa dang zas dus su rung ba dag go //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni gzhan mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba dang rang gis sbyin pa dang zas dus su rung ba dag go //
translated: The agent in this downfall is a naked ascetic of another religion, oneself, or someone who gives food at the proper time.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The basis of this downfall is fivefold.

original: gzhan mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba gcer bu pho yang rung mo yang rung ba rtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa nye du dang rab tu byung ba la ltos pa dang / nad pa dang / sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang dbral ba nyid ma gtogs pa dang rang gis sbyin pa dang /🔽zas rung ba dag go //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba gcer bu pho yang rung mo yang rung ba rtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di med pa nye du dang rab tu byung ba la ltos pa dang / nad pa dang / sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang dbral ba nyid ma gtogs pa dang rang gis sbyin pa dang / zas rung ba dag go //
translated: Also, it is a downfall to give to naked ascetics, whether male or female, who are non-Buddhist renunciates, except to those who are relatives or to those who have renounced evil views.🔽The gift should be suitable,

original: gnyi ga la rung ba nyid dang / de'i lus dang lus 'brel par sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la rung ba nyid dang / de'i lus dang lus 'brel par sbyin pa'o //
translated: and the gift should be given to them either directly or indirectly.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these aspects is missing, the downfall is a serious transgression, a minor offense.

original: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te /🔽ci srid du gcer bu pa la sbyin pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas te / ci srid du gcer bu pa la sbyin pa'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba brtsams nas dngos gzhi la ma thug gi bar du nyes byas so //
translated: The downfall is accrued by the act of giving.🔽The downfall is accrued by the act of giving, from the time one begins the act of giving to naked ascetics until the gift is actually received.

original: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi la sbyor ba tha dad pa ji snyed brtsams pa re re la nyes byas re re'o //
translated: For each act of giving that is part of the actual downfall, a minor offense is accrued.

original: zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga ma yin pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for not eating the five cooked foods and the five non-cooked foods.

original: rang dang de la mi rung ba'i zas la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rang dang de la mi rung ba'i zas la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for eating food that is not suitable for oneself or for the sick person.

original: gzhan sbyin du 'jug pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gzhan sbyin du 'jug pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for having someone else give the food.

original: rang gi zhal ta byas pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: rang gi zhal ta byas pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for having it prepared by oneself.

original: lus sam de dang 'brel pa las gzhan pa'i phyogs su bgo bsha' byed pa'i tshul gyis 'jog pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: lus sam de dang 'brel pa las gzhan pa'i phyogs su bgo bsha' byed pa'i tshul gyis 'jog pa la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for storing it in a way that is shared with others in a place other than where it was prepared or where it is kept.

original: gcer bu pa las gzhan pa'i mu stegs can dag la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gcer bu pa las gzhan pa'i mu stegs can dag la nyes byas so //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for giving it to non-Buddhist ascetics other than naked ascetics.

original: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste /🔽sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i ltung ba ni nyes byas phra mo ste / sbyor ba ji snyed pa la sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang de snyed de /
translated: The offense of wrong conduct for preparation is a minor offense.🔽There are as many offenses of wrong conduct for preparation as there are preparations.

original: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi @180b sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba nyes byas kyi @180b sbyor ba'i sbyor ba yang nyes byas te /
translated: The offense of wrong conduct for preparation for an offense of wrong conduct is also an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: It is a minor offense.

original: ltung ba med pa ni rtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di yod pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni rtags 'di dang rab tu byung ba 'di yod pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one has the sign and the going forth, and there is no offense.

original: nye du dang rab tu byung ba la ltos pa dang / nad pa dang sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang / dbral bar 'dod pa la ltung ba med do //🔽zas dum bur byas nas sbyin na sbyin du 'jug pa la ltung ba med do //🔽gzhan pa'i blos gdol ba bzhin du gzhan 'jog pa la ltung ba med do //🔽las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nye du dang rab tu byung ba la ltos pa dang / nad pa dang sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang / dbral bar 'dod pa la ltung ba med do // zas dum bur byas nas sbyin na sbyin du 'jug pa la ltung ba med do // gzhan pa'i blos gdol ba bzhin du gzhan 'jog pa la ltung ba med do // las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the person is a relative or a monastic; if the person is sick; if the person has wrong views; or if the person is determined to leave.🔽There is no offense if one gives food that has been cut up.🔽There is no offense if one is insane; if one is the first offender; if one is acting to set an example; if one is mentally disturbed; if one is in physical pain; or if one is a beginner.🔽

original: bslab par bya ba ni dge slong gis yul thams cad la gnas skabs thams cad du gcer bu la sbyin pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba rnam pa thams cad mi bsten par bslab par bya'o //
